{s3}: This person looks quite busy. I think I shouldn't interrupt...
This person looks quite busy. I think I shouldn't interrupt...
You think you're better than us, huh.
I have never said anything like that...
So you think I'm stronger than you?
Yes.
I do not like to be mocked.
Well, no. We are equals. So it would not be smart to start a fight in which both of us may lose, right?
Well, you are right about that. I want to lose in a fight no more than you. I hope to see you again.
I certainly am!
I'll wipe that smirk right off your face!
It is an honor to be a part of your fine company of men.
I want to see your skills.
Very well.
Done.
I think we need to part our ways.
Thank you.
I wish to defer the appointment of a lord, until I take the counsel of my subjects
As you wish, {reg33?my lady:sire}. You may decide this matter at a later date.
As you wish, {reg33?my lady:sire}. {reg6?I:{reg7?You:{s11}}} will be the new {reg33?lady:lord} of {s1}.
{s1} is not being managed by anyone. Whom shall I put in charge?
{reg0?{s65}:Please {s65}}, I want to have {s1} for myself. (fiefs: {s0})
{s66}, you should have {s1} for yourself. (fiefs: {s0})
You should appoint no one yet, and decide later.
Hmmm. All right, {playername}. I value your counsel highly.  I shall defer appointment of a lord for {s1} for the time.
Hmmm. All right, {playername}. I value your counsel highly. {reg6?I:{reg7?You:{s11}}} will be the new {reg3?lady:lord} of {s1}.

Hello there. We are polishing off our combat skills here with a bit of sparring practice.You look like you could use a bit of training. Why don't you join us, and we can show you a few tricks.And if you need explanation of any combat concepts, just ask, and I will do my best to fill you in.
What do you want to practice?
Tell me what kind of practice you want.
I want to practice attacking.
I want to practice blocking with my weapon.
Let's do some sparring practice.
[Leave]

All right. There are four principle directions for attacking. These are overhead swing, right swing, left swing and thrust. Now, I will tell you which direction to attack from and you must try to do the correct attack.^^(Move your mouse while you press the left mouse button to specify attack direction. For example, to execute an overhead attack, move the mouse up at the instant you press the left mouse button.The icons on your screen will help you do the correct action.)
Let's begin then. I am ready.
Actually I want to do something else.

Unlike a shield, blocking with a weapon can only stop attacks coming from one direction.For example if you block up, you'll deflect overhead attacks, but you can still be hit by side swings or thrust attacks.^^(You must press and hold down the right mouse button to block.)

I'll now attack you with different types of strokes, and I will wait until you do the correct block before attacking.Try to do the correct block as soon as you can.^^(This practice is easy to do with the 'automatic block direction' setting which is the default.If you go to the Options menu and change defend direction control to 'mouse movement' or 'keyboard', you'll need to manually choose block direction. This is much more challenging, but makes the game much more interesting.This practice can be very useful if you use manual blocking.)
Let's begin then. I am ready.
Actually I want to do something else.

Sparring is an excellent way to prepare for actual combat.We'll fight each other with non-lethal weapons now, until one of us falls to the ground.You can get some bruises of course, but better that than being cut down in the real thing.
Let's begin then. I am ready.
Actually I want to do something else.
Good. You were able to block my attacks successfully. You may repeat this practice and try to get faster each time, until you are confident of your defense skills. Do you want to have another go?
Well that didn't go too well, did it? (Remember, you must press and hold down the right mouse button to keep your block effective.) Do you want to try again?
Yes. Let's try again.
No, I think I am done for now.
Hey! We are doing a blocking practice, mate! You are supposed to block my attacks, not attack me back.
I am sorry. Let's try once again.
Sorry. I must leave this practice now.
All right. As you wish.
Well that didn't go too well, did it?  Don't feel bad, and try not to do same mistakes next time. Do you want to have a go again?
Yes. Let's do another round.
No. That was enough for me.
Well, all right. Talk to me again if you change your mind.
Hey, that was good sparring. You defeated me, but next time I'll be more careful. Do you want to have a go again?
Very good. You have learned how to attack from any direction you want. If you like we can try this again or move to a different exercise.

Not bad. Not bad at all! You seem to have grasped the basics of archery. Now, try to do the same thing with a crossbow.Take the crossbow and the bolts over there and shoot those three targets. The crossbow is much easier to shoot with compared with the bow,but you need to reload it after each shot.
Good. You didn't have too much difficulty using the crossbow either. Next you will learn to use throwing weapons.Pick up the javelins you see over there and try to hit those three targets.

Well, with that you have recevied the basic skills to use all three types of ranged weapons. The rest will come with practice. Train each and every day, and in time you will be as good as the best marksmen in Perisno.
Now, you can go talk with the melee fighters or the horsemanship trainer if you haven't already done so. They can teach you important skills too.

Good day to you, young {reg33?lass:fellow}. I spend my days teaching about ranged weapons to anyone that is willing to learn.If you need a tutor, let me know and I'll teach you how to use the bow, the crossbow and the javelin.
Yes, show me how to use ranged weapons.
No, not now.

All right. Your first training will be in bowmanship. The bow is a difficult weapon to master. But once you are sufficiently good at it, you can shoot quickly and with great power.Go pick up the bow and arrows you see over there now and shoot those targets.
All right. I am ready.
Just a minute. I want to do something else first.
I hope you enjoyed the ride. Now we move on to something a bit more difficult. Grab the lance you see over there and ride around the course hitting each target at least once.

Good! You have been able to hit all targets on horseback. That's no easy feat for a starter. Your next challange will be using a bow and arrows to shoot at the archery targets by the road. You need to put an arrow to each target to consider yourself successful.
Very good. You were able to shoot all targets from horseback. Keep riding and practicing each day and in time you will be an expert horseman.
Now, you can go talk with the melee fighters or the archery trainer if you haven't already done so. You need to learn everything you can to be prepared when you have to defend yourself.

Good day! I have come here for some riding practice, but my old bones are aching badly so I decided to give myself a rest today. If you would like to practice your horsemanship, you can take my horse here. The exercise would be good for her.
Yes, I would like to practice riding.
Uhm. Maybe later.

Good. Now, I will give you a few exercises that'll teach you riding and horseback weapon use. Your first assignment is simple. Just take your horse for a ride around the course. Go as slow or as fast as you like. Come back when you feel confident as a rider and I'll give you some tougher exercises.
All right. I am ready.
Just a minute. I need to do something else first.
Hey, I am trying to practice here. Go, talk with the archery trainer if you need guidance about ranged weapons.
Is there a change of plans?
What's going on?
I can speak your tongue. What is your business here?
I am nothing but a merchant, sir.
Merchant you say? I take it your wares were on that ship?
Indeed.
Well... There are many bandits, is all I can say. I know not who those ones are. It seems you are safe now, I wish you luck in your travels.
My business? I will be having that armor of yours, or I will take it off your dead body.
You are a fool. Okel Jakkaarii!
Oleth hrakkarikh, lanqoyi rhoa.
Where is Torsson?
He died bravely, I am sorry I could not save him.
Where is Torsson? That is a very good question; he couldn't make it on the voyage back, perhaps he is still raiding.
Stop playing games! He is dead, I can see right through you, coward!
And why did you not die with him, like a true kinsman?
He is dead and couragous, you are living and cowardly. Soon you will be dead and cowardly. Draw your spear if you still have any iron in your blood.
Ready to leave?
Yes, let me be off.
Not quite yet.
Well, I see Kvensson has a spear in his throat. I cannot blame you for his death, as he challenged you. However, you are one of two survivors to Torsson's raid. Tell me what happened.
Well, a Valahir Aethling attacked us you see... [admit cowardice]
Well, he asked Hyk and I to scout ahead you see, and he wasn't there upon our return... [deny cowardice]
You disgust me.
You do not deserve the very clothes on your back, wrought by better hands than yours.
*spits* But I will give you another chance. Do not act such a coward again, or you will find me less lenient.
You say you found a bit of cloth with Aethling Svafar's sigil on it when looking at your camp? I have no doubt that it is his doing.

You must avenge Torsson's death, as the survivor and friend to him. Talk to me when you are ready to sail back to Perisno. I know you may not have the capacity to beat him now, but you have all the time in the world. Svafar's death is your mission.
Thank you for giving me this chance to prove myself. I will not fail in this.
Good day, I am a merchant from south, looking to sell a few of my wares. What can I do for you?
I want to trade. Show me your wares.
Ah, yes. Take a look.
Anything else?
Tell me. What are people talking about these days?

Well, nothing new lately. Prices, weather, the wars; the same old things. I know little of what men are talking of here on Hylr, I am simply a merchant trying to find my way to as many remote places as possible to sell my wares and hopefully, find some interesting stories. You could say I'm a bit of an adventurer myself!
Good-bye.
I have no words for you, coward.
What are you looking at?
Are you looking at me?
Such a waste...
Better him than me
I'm not sure... Some sort of animal, clearly
Excuse me -- please accept my apologies
I'll let it slide... this time.  Now buzz off.
I'll wipe that smirk right off your face!
I'll wipe that smirk right off your face!
Do you have any idea who I am?
Do I care?
Big talk from a little runt.  I'll put you in your place!
Emmm... Actually... Yes, yes, I do know who you are, {s0}. Please forgive me, your grace -- it must be the drink. I'll be leaving, now...
Why, if you want a fight, you shall have one!
I thought as much. Now, remove yourself from here
You look like a {reg33?dame:fellow} who can take a few hard knocks -- and deal them out, too. I have a business proposition for you.
How's that?
Good -- I'm glad you're interested. Here's the plan... It's a little complicated, so listen well.

You and this other fellow will start up a fight here. No weapons, no armor -- I'll sit back and take bets, and split the profits with the winner. If we make a loss, then I'll cover it. You've got nothing to lose -- except a bit of blood, of course.

However, we can't organize this like one of those nice arena bouts, where everyone places their bets beforehand. People will walk in, drawn by the noise, and put a aurum or two on whichever one of your two they think is winning. I'll give 'em even odds -- anything else is going to be too tricky for someone who's already on his third flagon of ale.

So, as you can see, the trick is to stretch things out for as long as possible where it looks like you're losing, and people bet against you -- and then come back fast, and win, before the betting can turn. The best way to make money is for you to be battered almost to the floor, and then jump back off your feet and take the other guy down. However, you have to win in the end in order for me, and you, to make money.
Also, you can't stretch the fight out too long, or people will suspect a fix. So, one of you has to take a punch every so often. I don't care whose blood is spilled, but there has to be some blood.
And one other thing -- my mate, your opponent, he doesn't take to well to complexity. So he's just going to come straight at you. It's up to you to supply the artistry.
So, what do you think?
{!}[Yes -- not yet implemented]
I have better things to do
Good day to you, {reg33?lassie:young man}.
Forgive me, you look like a trader, but I see none of your merchandise.
Never mind.
A trader? Oh, aye, I certainly am that.My merchandise is a bit different from most, however. It has to be fed and watered twice a day and tries to run away if I turn my back.
Livestock?
Close enough. I like to call myself the man who keeps every boat on this ocean moving.Boats are driven by oars, you see, and oars need men to pull them or they stop. That's where I come in.
Galley slaves.
Now you're catching on! A trading port like this couldn't survive without them.The ships lose a few hands on every voyage, so there's always a high demand. The captains come to me and they pay well.
Where do the slaves come from?

Mostly I deal in convicted criminals bought from the authorities.Others are prisoners of war from various nations, brought to me because I offer the best prices.However, on occasion I'll buy from privateers and other . . . 'individuals'. You can't be picky about your suppliers in this line of work.You wouldn't happen to have any prisoners with you, would you?
Me?

Why not? If you intend to set foot outside this town,you're going to cross swords with someone sooner or later. And, God willing, you'll come out on top.Why not make some extra money off the whole thing? Take them alive, bring them back to me, and I'll pay you fifty aurums for each head.Don't much care who they are or where they come from.
Hmm. I'll think about it.
Do think about it!There's a lot of silver to be made, no mistake. More than enough for the both of us.
Hello, {playername}.
Anything else?
I've brought you some prisoners, Ramun. Would you like a look?
I want to sell all the prisoners I have with me.
I'll take your {reg1} {reg2?prisoners:prisoner} off your hands for {reg0} aurums. Do we have a deal?
We have a deal.
Let me think about it again.
Let me see what you have...
A pleasure doing business with you.
How do I take somebody as prisoner?
Can you tell me again about capturing prisoners?

You're new to this, aren't you? Let me explain it in simple terms.The basic rule of taking someone prisoner is knocking him down with a blunt weapon, like a mace or a club,rather than cutting him open with a sword. That way he goes to sleep for a little while rather than bleeding to death, you see?I'm assuming you have a blunt weapon with you . . .
Of course.
As a matter of fact, I don't.

Good. Then all you need to do is beat the bugger down with your weapon, and when the fighting's over you clap him in irons.It's a bit different for nobles and such, they tend to be protected enough that it won't matter what kind of weapon you use,but your average rabble-rouser will bleed like a stuck pig if you get him with something sharp. I don't have many requirements in my merchandise,but I do insist they be breathing when I buy them.
No? Heh, well, this must be your lucky day. I've got an old club lying around that I was going to throw away.It a bit battered, but still good enough bash someone until he stops moving.Here, have it.
Thanks, Ramun. Perhaps I may try my hand at it.

Alright, I'll try and expain it again in simple terms. The basic rule of taking someone prisoner is knocking him down with a blunt weapon, like a mace or a club,rather than cutting him open with a sword. That way he goes to sleep for a little while rather than bleeding to death, you see?It's a bit different for nobles and such, they tend to be protected enough that it won't matter what kind of weapon you use,but your average rabble-rouser will bleed like a stuck pig if you get him with something sharp.
Alright, I think I understand. Anything else?

Well, it's not as simple as all that. Blunt weapons don't do as much damage as sharp ones, so they won't bring your enemies down as quickly.And trust me, given the chance, most of the scum you run across would just as soon kill you as look at you, so don't expect any courtesy when you pull out a club instead of a sword.Moreover, having to drag prisoners to and fro will slow down your party, which is why some people simply set their prisoners free after the fighting's done.It's madness. How could anyone turn down all that silver, eh?
Is that everything?

Just one final thing. Managing prisoners safely is not an easy thing to do, you could call it a skill in itself.If you want to capture a lot of prisoners, you should try and learn the tricks of it yourself,or you won't be able to hang on to a single man you catch.
Thanks, I'll keep it in mind.
I'd better be going.
Remember, any prisoners you've got, bring them to me. I'll pay you good silver for every one.
Do you have any tasks for me?

Why, of course! Business lately has been absolutely terrible! It seems like people like to kill other people more than to take them prisoner! It is absolutely horrible. Why kill someone with a sword when you can knock them out with blunt weapons and sell them as nice slaves?
Why, indeed!
Since business is so terrible right now, I am hoping you can capture some prisoners for me. Any prisoner is fine. I will reward you well.
Alright! I'll do it.
No thanks. Maybe another time, Ramun.
Excellent! Remember, you need 15 prisoners of any kind.
I have the prisoners!
Excellent! Here is the reward I promised you.
I humbly request that your {reg33?lady:lord}ship keeps {reg33?her:his} hands where I can see them.
You should never see this. If you do, PM 'Something Unusual' on Taleworlds forum.
What do you wish to know, {reg33?my Lady:Sire}?
What do you know of the lords of the other kingdoms?
Where are the monarchs of the other kingdoms, currently?
Where would you recommend I send my armies next?
I want to target an enemy lord.
Never mind.
I will be available when needed, {reg33?my Lady:Sire}.
My men tell me that the following lords could be turned...^{s4}
My men tell me that the following lords could be turned...^{s4}
Thank you, you have been most helpful.
Thank you.

{reg33?Madam:Sir}, it is not unusual for the great and good of this land to be targeted by assassins and the like - you yourself have had a scare or two. As Spymaster, I am in a position to offer you the same service. ^^ Be aware that this type of action, though covert, could affect your reputation if it is discovered that you have had anything to do with it. Would you like to hear your options?
Tell me what my options are.
I have no enemies I would wish this upon.

Very well, {reg33?Madam:Sir}. You can go about targeting an enemy lord in two ways. ^^ First, you can sponsor an attack on a lord by hiring a mercenary company. There is one in town right now that would prove suitable. This group would hunt down and attack your chosen lord, and they will pursue him to the ends of the earth. For example, if he is defeated by another, they will lie in wait until he regroups and attack again. Note that the lord needs to be in transit between centres before our troops can attack. The ususal fee for this service is in the region of ten thousand aurums.

Second, you can hire assassins to target that lord when he is away from his retinue. These men can be relied upon for their secrecy, though past attempts have shown that there is a high chance that the lord will fight them off. However, attacks which do succeed cause a lot of damage to a lord and his reputation. The target lord needs to own at least one fief, as that makes it easy for the assassins to lie in wait.^^ This service does not come cheap; the assassins usually command a fee of fifteen thousand aurums.
I'd like to target an enemy lord and his army.
I'd like to order an assassination.
I've changed my mind. This skulduggery is not for me.

By the way, it would be very foolish to target a king in this way, as you would lose the goodwill of both the people and the gentry if discovered, so I do not offer you that option.^^ The following lords all hold some enmity towards you. Which one would you like to target?
Never mind.
I'm afraid the Kingdom does not have enough money to sponsor an attack.

Very well. The Mercenaries are outside, preparing for their journey. My {reg33?lady:lord}, if you decide to follow them, please do so at a discreet distance. It would not do to have your name associated with this attack.

By the way, it would be very foolish to target a king in this way, as you would lose the goodwill of both the people and the gentry if discovered, so I do not offer you that option.^^ The following lords all hold some emnity towards you. Which one would you like to assassinate?
Never mind.
I'm afraid the Kingdom does not have enough money to sponsor an attack.

Very well. I will pass on your instructions to the right people. Remember, my {reg33?Lady:Lord}, the success of this attack is not guaranteed.^^ Go now, and I will send you word as to our success or failure.

My {reg33?Queen:King}, I am your humble servant in charge of war in this kingdom. I wish to make myself of use. If you need anything war related, just consult me and I will help you in any way possible.
Thank you. I'm sure you will be of much use to me now and in the future.
You have need of me, my {reg33?Queen:King}?
I would like to hire a small Perisnoan army to help keep order.
I would like to hire some mercenaries.
I would like to gather the kingdom vassals for a campaign.
I wish to know the location of a lord.
How many patrols does the kingdom have and what is the limit?
Nevermind.
Of course. This will cost you 30,000 aurums with no extra cost afterwards. You can only have one army on the field at a time. Would you like to hire one?
Yes.
Nevermind. (Not enough money or one is already in the field).
It is done, my {reg33?Lady:Lord}.
Are you sure, my {reg33?Queen:King}? This will cost us a lot of aurums. And who would you like to hire?
Mercenary Party ({reg8} aurums)
Jin Mercenaries ({reg8} aurums)
Company of Perisno Pilgrim Warriors ({reg8} aurums)
Company of Nun Warriors ({reg8} aurums)
Nodah's Mercenary Company ({reg8} aurums)
Sidhethon's Mercenary Company ({reg8} aurums)
Remus's Guardsmen Company ({reg8} aurums)
Hakkon Company of the East ({reg8} aurums)
Filibuster Company of Aethlings ({reg8} aurums)
Company of Holy Crusaders ({reg8} aurums)
Marauder Company ({reg8} aurums)
Freelancers' Cavalry Company ({reg8} aurums)
Freelancers' Infantry Company ({reg8} aurums)
Desouk Mercenaries ({reg8} aurums)
Ukundu Mercenary Company ({reg8} aurums)
Company of Assassins ({reg8} aurums)
Volheere Company ({reg8} aurums)
Company of Ankars Huntresses ({reg8} aurums)
Company of Order of Faith ({reg8} aurums)
Company of Mosoru ({reg8} aurums)
Adventurer Mercenaries ({reg8} aurums)
Female Mercenary Party ({reg8} aurums)
I changed my mind.
It is done. The mercenaries will wait outside the castle for your orders.
Are you sure?
Yes.
Nevermind.
I will send the orders immediately. Is there anything else you need?
Very well. About whom do you wish to hear?
I have a different request.
My reports indicate that of the {reg26} patrols your kingdom can support, there are {reg25} currently active.
Thank you.
Hail, traveler.
Greetings, my lord Torlan.
Death to you and your Tolranian allies!
I do not fear death. I will fight for the Kingdom.
You will not live to see another dawn!
State your business. You are traveling through the landds of the Drachen.
I am just traveling by.
My business? My business is none of your concern. Who do you think you are?
How dare you. You will pay for that insult!
Surrender to the Dragon Empire, or die.
Good day, Ghareebian.
Hello. Just passing through.
Ghareebian? Is that some sort of insult? Die!
Stupid westerner ... Ghareebian. You dare attack us?
We shall ride you down with our elephants. Charge!
Don't do anything you might regret, stranger.
I won't. I am just passing by.
I won't. But you just did. Die!
The Old Gods favor us. We will not lose this fight.
For glory, victory, and blood!
What is it, human?
Nothing.
Die, stupid elf!
We are under the protection of Queen Arwen. Your foolish act will not be forgotten.
Human, you shall die.
What is it?
Nothing.
Die!
You have just declared war against our mighty empire by your foolish action. You will regret it.
The Hakkon Empire will make you pay for your crimes. The Inquisition is not light on these affairs.
I have heard your name, {playername}! Your audacity is at an end! Surrender or die!
What is it, my {reg33?Lady:Lord}?
Nothing. It's good to see an ally around here.
Drop your weapons. You are being arrested for trespassing on my land.
What? This is the land of King Torlan, ruler of the sovereignty of Tolrania!
What a fool you are. You dare attack me?
Please! Don't kill us! We surrender!
Halt! In the name of the Reich, surrender or die!
Yes? What is it?
Nothing. I was merely passing by.
Surrender or die!
Betrayal! Men, kill them for the Reich!
We shall make this quick. Your blood will stain the sands of our desert.
Yes?
Nothing. I was merely passing by.
Drop your weapons and come with me. You're trespassing on my land.
Haha! We shall enjoy killing you.
Well, well! What do we have here? Men, let's kill these trespassers!
Yes, what do you wish, my {reg33?Lady:Lord}?
Nothing. I was merely passing by.
We have you surrounded. Surrender and you may live.
What madness is this? You'll have to fight us to take us, {reg33?chit:fool}!
May the Queen guide us to victory!
Yes, what do you wish, my {reg33?Lady:Lord}?
Nothing. I was merely passing by.
Elf, you don't belong in this land. I shall eliminate you all!
You fool. We are under the protection of the Queen, may her wisdom guide us. We will not forget this!
Halt! I have heard your name, {playername}! Your audacity is at an end! Surrender or die!
Yes, what do you wish, my {reg33?Lady:Lord}?
Nothing. I was merely passing by.
Surrender or die!
By attacking us, you attack the Emperor himself!
Halt! You shall not run away from us, enemy of the realm! The King has offered a nice price for your head!
Yes, {reg33?ma'am:sir}?
Nothing. Watch closely. Enemies are everywhere.
You all die here!
What, {reg33?ma'am:sir}?
Apologies. I mistook you for someone else. Farewell.
You're going to die. Here.
Damn you! You will regret your foolish actions!
Die!
Don't kill us, we surrender!
Surrender to the justice of the Reich, or die!
Nothing. Farewell.
Damn you! For the Reich and the Kaiser!
We will ride you down!
Nothing. Farewell.
You will have to get past our arrows first!
Either die here on our swords, or surrender and live to see another day. It is custom of we Maccavians to treat our enemies, however barbaric, well.
Nothing. Farewell.
At them, men!
In the name of the Queen, surrender your troops and weapons.
Nothing. Farewell.
Damn you! Charge, Elves!
In the name of the Emperor Hakkon, lay down your arms!
Nothing. Farewell.
Damn you! At {reg33?her:his} throat, men!
In the name of the Emperor Hakkon, lay down your arms!
Yes, my {reg33?Queen:King}?
Nothing. Keep your eyes open.
We are watching for the enemy, my {reg33?Queen:King}.
Good. Keep doing so and keep your eyes open. You never know when the enemy may strike.
Yes, what do you wish, my {reg33?Lady:Lord}?
Nothing. Continue scouting.
My {reg33?Queen:King}, we are at your service!
Just passing through. Continue on your business.
For the Kingdom and the King!
Hail, friend.
Greetings, my lords. I wish you good fortune on your journey.
Death to you and your Tolranian allies!
Death is but an inconvenience for our kind. Yours, however, shall be permanent.
You will not live to see another dawn!
Greetings.
Stranger, welcome to the land of the Reich.
Death to you, Drachen scum!
You seek to harm a Drachen Noble? So be it, fool.
We will fight to the bitter end!
Please, don't attack! We surrender!
We shall destroy you and grind you into the desert sands.
What business have you in the Draharan desert?
I am but a traveller, noble ally.
My business is to destroy you!
We were born in our saddles. You will die in yours.
We are the Chosen of the New Gods. Mal'Kij will decide your fate, now.
Greetings. We are the Steel Knights of the New Gods. What business do you have here, friend?
We are just traveling through.
Your gods are worthless and so is the faction you serve. Die!
So be it. If you surrender now, you will be well treated, however.
We are the Chosen of the Old Gods. Mal'Kiarj will decide your fate, now.
Greetings. We are the Black Knights of the Old Gods. What is it you want here?
So be it. For glory, and victory!
For the Queen!!
Get away, vile human! You do not deserve to look upon the eyes of a Highelf.
Sorry, friend.
You die for that, Elf !
Inferior human. I shall pluck your eyes out with arrows myself!
For the Emperor!!
State your business.
Just passing through. I'll leave you in peace.
You will die for your impertinence!
My brothers! To arms!
Foolish Perisnoan. You are all so weak. The Emperor will not tolerate fools like you. Prepare to die!
You are passing through Zann lands. State your business or get out!
Sorry, friend. I'll be leaving in peace.
This is MY land, fool!
Ha! We will enjoy crushing you!
Halt! I have heard your name, {playername}! Your audacity is at an end! Surrender or die!
State your business.
Nothing. I was merely passing by.
Surrender or die!
By attacking us, you attack the Emperor himself!
Do you know who we are? We are the elite of the Zann, coming from the continent of Sine. Our arrows will be the last thing you see.
We are the horsemen of Khergia, united by the Zann. Be honored that you die by our bows!
We are the elites of Shun-Ha, united by the Zann. You shall be crushed to pieces!
Halt! I have heard your name, {playername}! Your audacity is at an end! Surrender or die!
Yes, my {reg33?lady:lord}? What do you need?
Patrol a new area.
Guard a fief.
Follow me.
I have no more need of you. Please disband.
Nothing. Continue with your current orders.
Where?
As you wish.
Where?
As you wish.
Gladly.
As you wish, my {reg33?lady:lord}. We will be up for hire should you need us again.
It's a great day to kill Elintoran Elves, isn't it?.
Indeed.
Die!
It's a good thing that you are a friend of our race. Otherwise you might be dead...
Indeed.
Die!
Human, you are lucky to be our friend. One day, you should come with us to hunt those Elintoran Elves.
Yes, that would be nice.
Die!
You dare trespass our holy forests? I think you deserve a lesson!
Yes, I dare. And I will continue to do so as I please. Now, surrender or die!
We are the Demon Worshippers, the chosen of Death! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
We are the Demon Worshippers, the chosen of Death! It is doom to face us!
That's nice. We'll leave you in peace.
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
May the Dreaded One destroy you!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
May the Dreaded One destroy you!
Get out of my way, fools.
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
We have been in this world for a long time. The time is near ... when the Demons will rule the world. The Dreaded One shall come.
What nonsense! Prepare to die.
We have been in this world for a long time. The time is near ... when the Demons will rule the world. The Dreaded One shall come.
Really.  Well, I don't feel like killing you today. Now, get out of my way!
You will not see that time come to pass. Prepare to die!
We fight for a higher cause. Lesser beings like you must be eradicated in this world.
Your knighthood order is corrupt. I doubt you do anything for a 'higher cause.'
We fight for a higher cause. Lesser beings must be eradicated in this world.
Oh?  Maybe you should try hunting bandits for a change, hypocrites.  Now, get lost!
Is that so?  Let's start with your corrupt order, then.'
Get out of our way, fool. We will cleanse this land of vermin.
Vermin? I'm looking right at it.
Get out of our way, fool. We will cleanse this land of vermin.
Well, have fun! Good luck with your vermin thing.
Vermin? I'm looking right at it.
The Church of Faith guides us. Surrender or die.
I doubt the Church of Faith supports corrupt, greedy and fat men like you.
The Church of Faith guides us. Surrender or die.
Nothing. We'll leave you in peace.
I doubt the Church of Faith supports corrupt, greedy and fat men like you.
Fool, get out of our way, or die! We have assembled to kill Demon Worshippers, not common rogues like you.
Fool, get out of our way, or die! We have assembled to kill Demon Worshippers, not common rogues like you.
Nothing. We'll leave you in peace.
Your knighthood order is corrupt. I doubt you do anything for a 'higher cause.'
Fresh blood! You will make nice sacrifices for the Dreaded One.
Fight us, and we shall sacrifice you to the Dreaded One.
Tempting...but, No.  We'll be leaving now.
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
We hail from Nisaynia, the superior land of these parts. We hear the people of Perisno are mighty warriors, but we shall see for ourselves.
So be it!
We hail from Nisaynia, the superior land of these parts. Do you dare to face us in battle?
Not today.  Go in peace.
I accept your challenge!
You heretical dogs! Bow down to the might of Emperor Hakkon II, we are here to deliver your justice!
We will fight you, and the Gods will decide who is the heretic.
You heretical dogs! Bow down to the might of Emperor Hakkon II, if you know what's good for you!
Bow down yourself.  You have no power here.
Seeing your head on a pike would be good for me right now!
We have survived throughout Perisno's history, and can never be stopped! Zelaeck guides us to victory!
You are nothing but bandits and looters, living off the corpses of the fallen! The honourable will triumph over you!
We have survived throughout Perisno's history, and can never be stopped! Zelaeck guides us to victory!
That's nice. We'll leave you in peace.
Zelaeck is about to guide you to defeat!
We are here to scout a pathway for our Emperor. It's too bad you won't live long enough to see the Zann reign!
The Zann will never reign, so of course I will never live to see it.
We are here to scout a pathway for our Emperor. Soon you shall see the Zann reign!
Charming.  Well, have a nice day.
The Zann may reign, but you will never live to see it.
Foolish wanderer. You dare trespass in our land? It is time for you to die.
Your land? Last I checked, this land belonged to nature.
Foolish wanderer. You dare trespass in our land? It is time for you to die.
We are just passing through.  No need to fight.
Your land? Last I checked, this land belonged to nature.
We have a dozen archers aiming at every one of you.
Let's hope they can't shoot straight, then!
Move any deeper in our forest and we will fill you with arrows.
Oh?  Stop us if you dare.
I'm not waiting for an ambush.  We will fight it out right here!
Well, well, what is this? Another group of foolish adventurers, waiting to be robbed! My fellow elves, we shall enjoy this very much.
You aren't getting anything from me!
Well, well, what is this? Another group of foolish adventurers.
Really, for nobles you should learn some manners.
I think I will fight you, just because I don't like you.
You dare trespass our holy forests? I think you deserve a lesson!
We will see who teaches who a lesson!
You dare trespass our holy forests? It is forbidden!
We will do as we please, and you'll have to live with it.  Now, go away.
Yes, I dare. And I will continue to do so as I please. Now, surrender or die!
Fight me if you dare!
You dare to attack us?
No. We'll leave you in peace.
Yes.  Time for slavers to become slaves.
You dare fight me? Are you crazy, or just plain stupid?
Whatever. We'll leave you in peace.
Brave talk from a dead man.
We fight to protect and preserve the legacy of the Venetor Empire, and its rightful heir, Atanos Octiem! Prepare to die, invaders!
Your empire died long ago. May you join it in death!
We fight for the Venetor Empire, the rightful land of Atanos Octiem! Legionaries! Prepare for glory!
Easy there! We'll leave you in peace.
Your empire died long ago. Soon, you will die with it!
Whoever dies this day, you will be among them!
Not this day. We'll leave you in peace.
Mere assassins? I've dealt with much stronger foes before.
Our Holy Order shall not stand infidels in our land. It is time for you to die.
Your Holy Order is nothing but a collection of fools. You shall be the ones dying this day.
Death is nothing to us, for we know that Mal'Kij watches over us. You, however, are the one I fear for. The depths of Hell shall consume you, infidel, for your insults.
Our Holy Order shall not stand infidels in our land. It is time for you to die.
Your Holy Order is nothing but a collection of fools. You shall be the ones dying this day.
Nothing. We'll leave you in peace.
Death is nothing to us, for we know that Mal'Kij watches over us. You, however, are the one I fear for. The depths of Hell shall consume you, infidel, for your insults.
Bah. Heretic, you are barely worth our energy to fight. For Mal'Kiarj, glory, and victory!
What a bunch of nonsense.
Bah. Heretic, you are barely worth our energy to fight. We will let you live today.
You'd better get up the energy for a fight, because we are about to give you one.
Oh, thanks.  Because killing you is such a bother.
Do you hear the howling? It is the sound of your destruction.
All I hear is the blabbering of a pack of madmen.
Do you hear the howling? It is the sound of your destruction.
Not really. We'll let you live, today.
All I hear is the blabbering of a pack of madmen.
It's no wonder you are mocked. You and your foolish order are all crazy.
Nothing. We'll leave you in peace.
It's no wonder you are mocked. You and your foolish order are all crazy. Surrender or die!
We shall see who rules this desert!
Oh shut up.  We'll be on our way now.
Here's what I have to say to you...prepare for battle!
Hey, you there! You seen any outlaws around here?
Yes, they went this way about an hour ago.
I knew it! Come on, lads, lets go get these bastards! Thanks a lot, friend.
No, haven't seen any outlaws lately.
Bah. They're holed up in this country like rats, but we'll smoke them out yet. Sooner or later.
I wish to collect on the bounties of some criminals I have captured.
There's your bounty. Good work, rounding them up!  Farewell.
Kiss my arse.
How dare you! Prepare to die.
Can you tell me more about the Border Patrol?

We are men who have come from all over the country. We look for bandits and outlaws and we hunt them down as a cat hunts down a mouse. You must be new here, to not have heard of us. Don't go into any trouble, or we'll hunt you down too.
I'm not afraid of you lot. Fight me if you dare!
You'll have nothing of mine but cold steel, scum.
My {reg33?lady:lord}, we're only poor farmers from the village of {s11}. {reg1?We are taking our products to the market at {s12}.:We are returning from the market at {s12} back to our village.}
I am hunting a group of bandits with the following description... Have you seen them?
We'll see how poor you are after I take what you've got!
Carry on, then. Farewell.
I am at your service, {reg33?my lady:sire}
It has been an honor to serve you, {reg33?my lady:sire}
Yes, {playername}? What can I do for you?
Anything else?
I want to review the castle garrison.
Of course. Here are our lists, let me know of any changes you require...
Let me see your equipment.
Very well, it's all here...
I want you to abandon the castle and join my party.
I've grown quite fond of the place... But if it is your wish, {playername}, I'll come with you.
And where would we sleep? You're dragging a whole army with you, {playername}, there's no more room for all of us.
[Leave]
Yes, {s0}?
Are we home yet?
Not yet.
I can't wait to get back. I've missed my family so much, I'd give anything to see them again.
{playername}, when do you think we can reach our destination?
We still have a long way ahead of us.
Very soon. We're almost there.

Ah, I am going to enjoy the road for a while longer then. I won't complain.I find riding out in the open so much more pleasant than sitting in the castle all day.You know, I envy you. You can live like this all the time.
That's good news. Not that I don't like your company, but I did miss my little luxuries.Still I am sorry that I'll leave you soon. You must promise me, you'll come visit me when you can.
Greetings, {playername}, my first and foremost vassal. I await your counsel.
Anything else?
What do you think about our progress so far?

{reg11?We have {reg11} {s0} on our side:We have no {s0} with us yet},whereas {reg21?{s9} still has {reg21} {s0} supporting {reg0?her:him}:{s9} has no loyal {s0} left}.{reg19?We control {reg13?{reg13} towns:} {reg14?{reg14} castles:} {reg15?and {reg15} villages:}:We don't control any settlements},while {reg29?they have {reg23?{reg23} towns:} {reg24?{reg24} castles:} {reg25?and {reg25} villages:}:they have no remaining settlements}.Overall, {s30}.
Then, we must keep fighting and rally our supporters!
It seems this rebellion is not going anywhere. We must give up.
{playername}, you can't abandon me now. Are you serious?
Indeed, I am. I can't support you any longer.
I was jesting. I will fight for you until we succeed.
Are you absolutely sure? I will never forgive you if you abandon my cause.
I am sure.
Let me think about this some more.
So be it. Then my cause is lost. There is only one thing to do for me now. I will go from Perisno and never come back. With me gone, you may try to make your peace with {s4}.
{reg65?My lady:My lord}, would you allow me to check out your equipment?
Very well, it's all here...
If it would please you, can you tell me about your skills?
Well, all right.
I suggest that you decide who should hold a fief that does not have a lord.
Which fief did you have in mind?
And who should receive it?
Never mind.
Let us keep going, {reg65?my lady:sir}.
Anything else?
Anything else?
Yes, {s5}?
As marshal, I wish you to send a message to the vassals of the realm
Let me see your equipment.
Very well, it's all here...
What can you tell me about your skills?
All right, let me tell you...
This is unsafe for you. You should get back to our court.
Are you sure, {s0}?
Yes.
No, I'd rather have you at my side.
We need to separate for a while.
Very well, I will return to managing my own estate.
Oh really? Well, I'm not just going to wait around here. I'm going to go to the towns to look for other work. Is that what you want?
Well, actually, there was something I needed to tell you.
That's right. We need to part ways.
No, I'd rather have you at my side.
Well. I'll be off, then. Look me up if you need me.
I'd like to ask you something.
Never mind.
Very well. What did you want to ask?
How do you feel about the way things are going in this company?
Tell me your story again.
I suppose you know that I aspire to be {reg33?queen:king} of this land?
Do you have any connections that we could use to our advantage?
Would you be interested in holding a fief?
CHEAT: buff this person!
Then shortly after, I joined up with you.
Anything else?
Um... Yes. I had heard.
Would you then support my cause?
Very good. I shall keep that in mind.

I would, {s21}. Moreover, I have a proposal on how I might help you attain your throne. But you recently sent {s22} off on a similar mission. Perhaps we should wait for a couple of weeks to avoid drawing too much attention to ourselves.
Very good. You do that
On second thought, stay with me for a while
Farewell then, {s21}, for a little while

Of course, as few people should know of this as possible. If you want to collect the information, or pull me out, then don't send a messenger. Come and get me yourself -- even if that means you have to sneak through the gates.
Splendid idea -- you do that.
Actually, hold off for now.
Good. I should be ready to report in about five days. Farewell then, {s21}, for a little while.
{playername}, you saved {reg4?her:him}! Thank you ever so much for rescuing my {s11}.Please, take this as some small repayment for your noble deed.
Always an honour to serve, {s65}.
What's new?

A large army of mysterious outlanders is invading Perisno. They call themselves Zann. I once met a man named Shi Jin who was trying to warn people about them, but nobody listened to him.  And now the Zann are crushing our forces,and Shi Jin is probably the only one who know how to stop them.
What kind of nonsense is this?
Then I should find him and talk to him.
I know that you were trying to warn people about Zann invasion. Do you know how to stop them?
I know that you were trying to warn people about Zann invasion. Do you know how to stop them?
I know that you were trying to warn people about Zann invasion. Do you know how to stop them?

Stopping Zann won't be easy but it can be done. First of all, you need to understand that Jin Empire, whence Zann came, consists not only of original Jin lands, but also Khergia steppe, Sine land and Shun-Ha Island. The Emperor granted these lands to his vassals, but not all of them are truly loyal to him. Some of these traitors left with the Zann, but there are also a few cunning ones who pretend to serve the Emperor of Jin yet in fact support Zann from abroad.

They are sending their armies to assist Zann invasion.These armies are The Horde of Jin, The Horde of Sine, The Horde of Shun Ha and The Horde of Khergia. If you defeat them, you will likely find the names of Jin lords who support Zann. Give these names to me, and I will send them to my uncle. And then I can guarantee you that you will no longer see these armies in Perisno.
I defeated The Horde of Jin. Here are some documents I found.
I defeated The Horde of Jin. Here are some documents I found.
I defeated The Horde of Jin. Here are some documents I found.
I obliterated The Horde of Khergia. Here are some documents I found.
I obliterated The Horde of Khergia. Here are some documents I found.
I obliterated The Horde of Khergia. Here are some documents I found.
I crushed the forces of The Horde of Sine. Here are some documents I found.
I crushed the forces of The Horde of Sine. Here are some documents I found.
I crushed the forces of The Horde of Sine. Here are some documents I found.
The Horde of Shun-Ha is no more. Here are some documents I found.
The Horde of Shun-Ha is no more. Here are some documents I found.
The Horde of Shun-Ha is no more. Here are some documents I found.
Excellent! This is what I need. I will immediately send a messenger to the Emperor of Jin.
Excellent! This is what I need. I will immediately send a messenger to the Emperor of Jin.
Excellent! This is what I need. I will immediately send a messenger to the Emperor of Jin.
Excellent! This is what I need. I will immediately send a messenger to the Emperor of Jin.
I failed the quest.
I found the person wearing strange black armor and did what was required.

Good work.  I owe you a lot for helping me with this task.  That's your reward. But be careful. People over there are watching you. And I don't think their intentions are good. Farewell, {playername}.
Yes. I just happen to have a new client. He's a strange type though. I don't think I ever saw a black armor like the one he's wearing. Are you interested?
No, thanks. Maybe next time.
Yes. Where is this client now?
He is waiting in {s8}.
During my travels, I've learned some secrets of engineering. Also, Syabr is now in {s8}!
Take this tamga. If you show it to the Fort captain, he will let you recruit some of our troops from time to time.
Thank you for your help.
Are you that person who was looking for help? I was sent here by the Guild.
Yes. You see, my master ordered me to have a castle built for him with a pond in its yard. But there is a problem...
Wait. I am an adventurer, not a civilian engineer. I don't know how to build castles.

You don't need to. And if you had been patient enough to let me finish, you would have known that my master sent Syabr, a renowned fortification builder, to do this job. My role in this is merely making sure he has all the resources he needs. But now all my efforts will be pointless, because several days ago an escaped soldier from Syabr's escort arrived and said that they were ambushed by a large group of Mosoru riders. Syabr was taken prisoner by them and now I need someone to rescue him.
Don't you have troops for this? You don't look like a person who's experiencing a lack of soldiers at his disposal.
I certainly do. But I am no commander, nor a warrior, and I don't have anyone who could lead my soldiers in battle. So are you willing to take this job and rescue our engineer?
No. It is too dangerous for me.
I'd like to help you but I don't have enough troops for this ask.
Yes, I am ready to help.
That's alright. You are not the first coward who rejects this job after hearing the details.

This is not an issue. Actually, I have just bought some slaves from Ramun to work on castle construction. They will soon be escorted to our fort. Just follow them and when you arrive at the fort, find the captain and talk to him. Give him this letter, and he will give you some troops to help you on the task, as well as a scout who will lead you to the Mosoru.

Splendid. Then let us get to business. A group of slaves, that I have just bought Ramun to work on castle construction, will soon be escorted to our fort. Follow them, and after you arrive at the fort, find the captain and talk to him. Give him this letter, and he will have a scout lead you to the Mosoru.
Go to the Zann Outpost!
Who are you? What do you want?
I was sent here by Temnik Arslan. I need to get to Zann Outpost.
I'd like to search your carts.
Never mind!
Follow us then. We are just heading there
How dare you?! We are under protection of Emperor Zann Mandate of Heaven! Your foolish act will not be forgotten.
I have come from Temnik Arslan (show the letter).
I see. I will have several troops and one of our scouts join your party and help you. Talk to the scout for the details on Mosuru's location
A scout joined your party. Talk to him.
Tell me what happened. Where was Syabr's party attacked?
They were moving across the desert from a dwarven town of {s8} to our outpost. That's when they were ambushed by the Mosoru.
What were they doing in Kaikoth lands?

Tower and bridge schematics for the future castle were designed by the famous Jin architect Gudu de lang. However it turned out that stone in these lands is not firm enough to hold the whole structures.
Go on...
So Syabr headed to the dwarven master Totigor to buy some components that are necessary for creating a sturdier compound.
All right. So where should we start looking for him?
I suggest that we head to the desert, find and capture one of Mosoru riders and ask him what he knows about the ambush and Syabr's current whereabouts.
Great. Then it's what we're going to do.
You! What do you know about a recent attack on the caravan that was carrying a cargo of construction materials?
What? I don't know nothing about it!
I have no idea what you are babbling about.
I've only heard that there was an attack on a caravan that turned out to be carrying some stone dust instead of gold and valuables.
I know that we suffered heavy losses yet only got a couple of prisoners and several bags of dust in the end.
Fine. You are free to go.
Where did you get the prisoners?
As usual, we sold them into slavery to a tavern keeper in one of Hakkon towns.
What town was it?
Fine. You are free to go.
So I've heard you were buying slaves...

Yes. But not for myself. It's just when one of this town's citizens need a slave, they come to me. Adventurers are also happy to get rid of prisoners they captured. Eventually it's a better option than dealing with those professional slave traders.
Have you recently bought anyone who was wearing an unusual armor?
And why should I answer this question?
I need this information. If you want, I can do a favor for you in return.
All right. I could use some help from a good soldier. You see, a group a Masnerian mercenaries had a fight in my tavern a couple of days ago. They broke a lot of stuff but didn't pay for it.
If somebody doesn't teach them a lesson, my other clients will also start to think they can do whatever they want in my tavern.
Do you need them dead or alive? Or just their gold?
I need them to pay. Whether they will end up dead or alive, does not really matter to me.
Fine. I'll do it. So for whom did you buy the slaves that were wearing a strange armor?
I think those Masnerian mercs were about to leave town soon. And it means that my money will leave with them.
All right. You can consider them dead. I'll get back to you soon.
Those troublesome mercenaries are dealt with.
Those troublesome mercenaries are dealt with.
That's good. Except I have heard that it wasn't you who defeated them. Anyway, where are my 10000 aurums?
Great. Where are 1000 aurums that they owe me?
Here is the money.
You'll have them. I'll get back to you soon.
Here is the money.
You'll have them. I'll get back to you soon.
Here is the money.
All right. A deal is a deal. Go and talk to our Guild Master. It was him I bought those slaves of yours for.
Who are you? What do you want?
I'm here to make you pay your debt to the tavern keeper of {s8}.
I've heard that you recently bought some slaves and several of them were wearing strange black armor. Is that true?

Well, yes, I did buy several slaves. I needed them to work on reinforcing town walls.  And - yes, some of those slaves looked unusual, as if there were not from around here. And I can even tell you more - one of those slaves turned out to be quite a brilliant engineer. Thanks to his advice on multiple matters, we could finish in a week what we would otherwise have spent a month working on.
Why are working in reinforcing town walls? Shouldn't that be your lord's concern?

Out town was granted Magdeburg rights by the Emperor a long time ago. For the most of the time, we are making decisions on our own: what to produce, with whom to trade and so on. Justice here also lies in the hand of the court, not the town lord. Other than this, we paying taxes to the lord, while he is partially taking care of town's defenses.
Interesting. Anyway, I'm here because I want to buy that bay those slave including the engineer you were talking about.
Him? Hmm, I don't know if should even consider this. I haven't seen such a talent in a long time. But, well, if the price is right... let's say 30000 denars.
Here is your gold!
What? A fortune for a slave?
Yes. But... well, you could also do something for me.
Tell me what you need.

As I was saying, our lord is only partially responsible for town's defenses. Hence, about a half of our garrison should be comprised of local recruits. But most citizens have grown wealthy and like living their lives. They don't want to serve in the army.
Fine, why won't you hire mercenaries then?
This is just what I am about to do. People here collected 10000 denars to sign a contract with the Freelancer Guild, to hire their troops for our garrison and patrols.
What is this Freelancer Guild?

It is a mercenary guild from the west coast of Tolrania. Their base is located near a river, to the west from Enduin castle. Go there and ask freelancers to sign the contract. If you do it, the slaves will be yours. After all, I believe they will be done with the walls by the time you return.
All right. I'll do this. Give me the money you collected.
He-he. No. First you have freelancers sign the contract, and then we will talk about the money.
I was sent here by the Guild Master of the town of {s8}. He wishes to sign a contract with your guild to hire freelancers for the town garrison as well as patrols.
That can be arranged. Did you bring 10000 aurums?
Here is the money.
Not yet. But I'll get back to you soon.
Here is 10000 denars for the contract.
I'm running short of money these days. Maybe a person like me can do something for you instead?

Hmm. All right. A group of my freelancers deserted from an army that hired them having killed several fellow soldiers in the process. That seriously damaged our reputation, so I need to teach them a lesson. As far as I know, the last time they were spotted near {s7}. Deal with them, and the contract will be yours for only a half of the price.
No, this task is too much for me. I'd rather bring you the money.
I'll do it.
Group a freelancer deserters have been eliminated by another party.
This is also good. Did you bring 10000 aurums?
Here is 5000 denars for the contract.
Those troublesome deserters are dealt with.
This is good. Did you bring 5000 aurums?
Here is the money.
Not yet. But I'll get back to you soon.
Here is 5000 denars for the contract.
So the contract is signed. The party of freelancers will soon head for {s8}.
See you later!
Who are you? What do you want?
I'd like to search your carts.
Nothing
How dare you?! Your foolish act will not be forgotten.
You are a threat to people of {s8}. Surrender or die!
What? You want a fight, so be it!
Who are you? What do you want?
Nothing.
Surrender or die!
I signed the contract with freelancers. Now it's you turn. Give me the slaves and 10000 denars you owe me.
You probably misunderstood me. I'm giving you the slaves, as for money... well, let's say it's a compensation for the fact that I'm letting them keep their equipment.
Fine. Just let's get this over with.
The engineer and his companions will be waiting for you at the town gate.
I can cover the rest of the way ourselves. Thanks.
Well, we have almost reached {s8}. I can cover the rest of the way on our own. Thank you for escorting me. Good luck!
Greetings!
Greetings.  I will lead you to {s8}.
Eh. We've made it this far... What do you want me to do?
You follow my lead. I'll take you through a safe route.
Alright. I'll be right behind you.
You stay here for a while. I'll go ahead and check the road.
Alright. I'll be waiting here for you.
I found the client and did what was required.
Good work.  That's your reward. But be careful. People over there are watching you. And I don't think their intentions are good.
Hello, {playername}. A lord came to our Guild recently, asking for help. Are you interested?
Solving nobles' problems? I think I'll pass.
Yes. Who is this lord?
He is the owner of the town of {s8}.
To continue the quest, improve your relations with the current factions of {s9}
To continue the quest, improve your relations with {s9}.
I'm here on behalf of Adventurer's Guild. What kind of help do you need?

Oh, the problem is the citizens of {s8}, these ungrateful rebels. They keep supporting that Nibor Hood cutthroat. Even a part of town's garrison is practically on his side now, and I have to do something about it. My plan is to hire a team of loyal mercenaries to reinforce the garrison and watch for those traitors.
I'm sorry, I'm not interested.
All right, I can help you with this. What kind mercenaries do you want to hire?
Outlanders. Those who do not share locals' beliefs and views. I think somebody like Nihonian mercenaries will do. Find them and persuade them to work for me.
One of local lords is looking for mercenaries to serve in his town's garrison. Are you interested?
Well, we don't know anything about you, let alone this lord. But money could solve this problem. Hire us, and then we can talk.
You have your money. So what about garrison service I mentioned?

This is a good offer, but there are too few of us here.  However, a large party of my friends along with their chieftain Omelian Kasap were hired to get rid of a band of brigands robbing people near {s9}.  They are probably at the castle at this moment. Go and talk to them.
Greetings, {s9}! My name is {playername}. I came with an offer for you and your men.
Speak then. What is it?
A lord who owns {s8} wants you to serve in the garrison of his town. Money will not be a problem, but you will need to watch for other soldiers and ensure their loyalty to the lord.

Hmm. This is a fine offer for an old man such as I. Speaking frankly, I've gotten  tired of traveling, and the garrison duty is what I probably need now. In other words, I agree. I'll see you outside castle walls.
We can cover the rest of the way on our own. Thanks.
So, we are not far from {s8}. But it looks like there is a rebellion going in the town.
What do we do now?

I have a plan. First I and my people enter the town claiming that we came to join Nibor Hood. Then after the gates are open, it's your turn. We will only be able to hold the gates for a short time, so hurry!
Ok. I'll see you at the tavern after we deal with the rebels! Good luck!
Hi!
Follow me.  I will lead you to {s8}.
Eh. We've made it this far... What do you want me to do?
You follow my lead. I'll take you through a safe route.
Alright. I'll be right behind you.
You stay here for a while. I'll go ahead and check the road.
Alright. I'll be waiting here for you.
The old woman is now in Fountain Hall!
Did she pay you for that? Because she didn't left any gold for The Guild.
What?! She only gave me a couple of coins! I thought that The Guild would pay me the rest... Gods! That old woman...

Ha ... ha ... ha ... Oh, that's been a long time since a laughed so hard!  (clears throat) Well, I'm sorry, but we have no money to give you. The woman left her armor though. You can take it if you need it.
Do you want to make some aurums?
No.
Yes.
Then you have to talk to the elderly woman near town. She looks for help.
Sorry. I can't do that right now.
I can cover the rest of the way ourselves. Thanks.
Well, we have almost reached Fountain Hall. I can cover the rest of the way on our own. Here is your pay...    Thank you for escorting me. Good luck!
Greetings. You must be my escort, right?
What? ... Yes, I suppose so. My name is {playername}. I was told you were looking for help.
That is true. My name is Oksanamunmun. You need to know what you are about to sign up for, so let me tell you my story.

I used to have a daughter who was unfortunate to give birth to a boy. The Amazon Priestesses ordered her to sacrifice him to the gods so that they will help us in our fights against Tolranian lords...
That's barbaric!
... My daughter escaped and left the child with me. When she returned, she was executed. This made me change my mind about life. I ran away and took my grandson with me.
And now you are planning to begin a new life?
Yes. I want to go to the town of free people where residents do not pay attention to one's sex or origins.
Is there such town in Perisno?

There is! It is called Fountain Hall. But I have a problem. The Priestess' cadres are now hunting us. I took refuge in this city. Now I am looking for someone to escort me to my destination. Are you up to this task?
I am! I will lead you to Fountain Hall.
Eh. We've made it this far... What do you want me to do?
You follow my lead. I'll take you through a safe route.
Alright. I'll be right behind you.
You stay here for a while. I'll go ahead and check the road.
Alright. I'll be waiting here for you.
Hey, you! Don't move! Surrender the old traitor to us, and then we will let you go!
No! (clears throat)... And you should rather get married! Maybe then you will stop being so afraid of men!
(Angrily) Get me the traitor! Alive!
Hold on, ladies! Where are your manners? It's no good to attack people without even saying Hello!
Get me this piece of shit too! The Priestess will cut out {reg33?her:his} tongue!
Where did the old hag and her grandson hide?
Gods, you are stubborn! Stay away from me!
What's new?
The elderly amazon is looking for you. I saw her at the tavern of {s8}.
I don't want to see this liar.
Thank you for telling me! I'll talk to her.
Greetings, {playername}. I couldn't pay you for your help back then but I can now.
Thanks!

I managed to do quite well in this town. I'm not short of money anymore, my grandson is safe, but my daughter ... My heart is longing for revenge. I saved some gold and hired a couple of mercenaries, but I cannot leave my grandchild. He needs nurture and protection. So now I am looking for someone who would avenge my daughter's death for me.
No, not interested
Well, those ladies don't like me anyway. Do you know where they are to be found?
No, but captain Berkut is trying to find the murderer of my daughter. From time to time he visits the tavern of Lille. Can you find him there and talk to him?
Go to the town of Lille!
Greetings, {s9}! My name is {playername}. I was sent here to help you. You and your soldiers have been placed at my disposal.
Yes, {reg33?madame:sir}!
How is your investigation doing?
I sent my men to gather information, and they found out that the elves of this town are supporting the Ankars.
From time to time they would send a caravan of goods guarded by female soldiers. I believe such caravans go to Ankars.
In my opinion you should start by finding out what exactly those caravans carry.
Good work, captain! When does the next caravan leave the  town?
Very soon.
Good. I'll deal with the caravan, and you stay here and gather your men.
Who are you? What do you want?
I'd like to search your carts.
How dare you?! We are under protection of Queen Arwen! Your foolish act will not be forgotten.
{reg33?Madame:Sir}
Stay here and gather your men.
Unfortunately, I couldn't search the caravan.
Stay here and gather your men.
Stay here and gather your men.
Unfortunately, I couldn't search the caravan.
That is bad. However, another caravan left the town about an hour ago. You can try and catch this one.
Caravan guards refused to show me their goods voluntarily, so I had to search the caravan by force. It was carrying bows and arrows.
Good work.
So, what do we do now?
I think I have to tell Oksanamun about that. You and your men should stay here.
Yes, {reg33?madame:sir}. But be careful. People over there are watching you. And I don't think their intentions are good.
Greetings, {playername}. What news do you bring?
I intercepted a caravan that departed from the town of Lille. It was carrying amazon bows and arrows.

Good! Amazons do not produce weapons on their own. Instead they maintain good relationship with the elves. Elves deliver supplies. Amazons pay with gold or slaves, protect trade routes and do other things in return.
Now you have to keep looking in this direction.
Find amazons who are waiting for caravans from Lille. Talk to captain Berkut about that.

After you defeat them, let someone live and tell them to tell the others that it was my revenge. Tell them that I will not stop until their priestesses come to me. I am sure that the queen will not risk jeopardizing trade with the elves and therefore will fulfill my demand.
Fine. I'll do as you say.
Be careful.
Go to the town of Lille!
{reg33?Madame:Sir}
I need to find out where caravans are heading.
Good. One of the caravans left about an hour age.
I'll follow it. You and men have to join me.
Yes, {reg33?madame:sir}!
I did what you asked. I found the party of amazons waiting for the goods and defeated them.
Good work. Thank you!
Good work. Thank you for your help!
Greetings, Oksanamun!
Thank you, {playername}! If you ever need my help, do not hesitate to ask.
Hi, {playername}!
Hi, {playername}!
What do you wish?
Follow me
All right
Stay here
All right
Patrol this area
All right
Go to...
Patrol around...
Nevermind
Where?
Okay
Nevermind
I haven't defeated Joan Zwiebel, but the Tolranian Spymaster is dead!
Well...so I haven't got any problem and you have no aurums.
I found Joan Zwiebel's army, defeated and killed her!
Good work.  I owe you a lot for helping me with this task. Farewell, {playername}.
It is great to see you, {playername}. I have a problem. Some time ago, a mysterious stranger came to me. He gave The Guild a dangerous assignments which I was foolish enough to accept.
Back then I did not quite realize how difficult it would be to fulfill it. So now I am asking for you help. Are you up to a challenge?
No, thanks.
Sure, I always am!
Great! It's about getting rid of someone... a woman.
How is this difficult? You could just hire a couple of Ral'Daiun assassins.
They already made five attempts but haven't been successful. The name of the woman is Joan Zwiebel.
Well, I suppose the assassins just couldn't stand against her beauty (smiling).
It's not about that. Joan Zwiebel was leading militia during the War of the Woods. Now she is very popular. A lot of people support her, even more than they would support their own king.
Really?!
Yes. And I am actually inclined to believe that this 'Mysterious Stranger' was the Tolranian Spymaster.
So this is all about politics. And now I either have to cooperate and kill that woman or die because of knowing too much.
Yes, I suppose these are your choices. Good luck.
So this is all about politics. And now I either have to cooperate and kill that woman or die because of knowing too much.
Follow the scout. He will lead you to your target.
Who are you? What do you want?
I am here to kill you.
Where do I find Joan Zwiebel?
Not far from here. She was following me.
Who are you? What do you want?
Halt! Our secrets should not be spread.
Greetings, Joan! I defeated the Tolranian Spymaster.
Thank you, {playername}! If you ever need my help, do not hesitate to ask.
Greetings, Joan!
Thank you, {playername}! If you ever need my help, do not hesitate to ask.
I have a new task for you.
Joan Zwiebel! There is no other choice for me but to kill you!
There is always a choice!
(Attack the party of Joan Zwiebel)
(Attack the party of the Tolranian Spymaster)
Who are you? What do you want?.
I am here to kill you.
Where do I find the Spymaster?
Not far from here. I had been chasing him before you appeared.
Patrol around...
What's new?
Adventurers are looking for you. They have an interesting job.
Thank you for telling me! I'll talk to them.
The log of orders  is in Meadbrewer. You can ask him.
Where's Meadbrewer?
He said that he was going to Fountain Hall.
I did not find Meadbrewer.
You can find Meadbrewer at the tavern of {s8}.
Hi! Do you have customers?
Adventurer Guildsman said that you  can help make a couple of aurums.
Nothing.
What do you want?
That is a shame. You can come back next time for more quests, however.
I failed the quest.
I found the client and did what was required.
Good work.  That's your reward. But be careful. People over there are watching you. And I don't think their intentions are good.
I found the client and did what was required.
Good work.  That's your reward. But be careful. People over there are watching you. And I don't think their intentions are good.
Hi! Can you help me make a couple of aurums?.
Hi! I forgot. Where is the client?
The client lives in {s8}.
You have  unusual drinks?
Such a pity. A barrel of mead with kalyna berries emptied.
Kalyna? What it is?
I do not know. This mead brought Silberfalke. On the feast of armorer.
Where can I find Silberfalke?
Mead with kalyna. Shucks!
John is my cousin. You can find it in the armorer workshop in this town.
Silver Hawk said that you have a good mead with kalyna berries.
Yes, I have. Keep wineglass.
No! Thank you! I do not want to drink this mead.
(You drank a sip of mead).
Ugh! (You do not like this drink)
(You drank a wineglass to the bottom).
Wonderful mead! (You do like this drink)
Yes. Meadbrewer produced delicious mead with kalyna berries.
Kalyna? What it is?
I do not know. (Silberfalke smiles). You should ask Meadbrewer.
I circuited  the tawn in order to find you.  I have never seen Meadbrewer.
Meadbrewer is a retired mercenary guild of adventurers. We traveled Perisno together for a while.
Where can I find Meadbrewer?
You can find Meadbrewer at the tavern of {s8}.
I failed the quest.
That is a shame. You can come back next time for more quests, however.
I found the client and did what was required.
I found the client and did what was required.
Greetings Meadbrewer! My name is {playername}. Do you sell mead?
Yes, but only to my friends.
I drank your mead with kalyna berries. What it kalyna? Silberfalke told me to ask you.
Silberfalke?
Yes. The armorer from Fountain Hall.
Kalyna is a common name for guelder-rose. Kalyna is one of the national symbols of my homeland. Its berries symbolize blood and the undying trace of family roots.
Silberfalke said you were together in the Adventurer Guild.

Yes. Silberfalke returned to his relatives in the city. He is a skilled gunsmith. I stayed here.  Around grow prairie grass. Near the lake grows guelder-rose. It is a paradise for bees and mead-brewers.
Can you help me make some aurums?
You should rather ask my former colleagues about this. Their quests will bring you a lot of gold.
Okay, I'll find them.
Mead you do not sell. How do you make for a living?
You must to find other adventurers.
Okay, I'll find them.
Wait a minute. Let me see if I have anything for you.
Okay. I'll wait.
The client lives in {s8}. Just tell them I sent you to help.
Ha! Just got the message. This problem decided patrol.
Yes. That was me.
Well, I'm a little bit busy now, so maybe next time...
Well, here I am at you service. For a price, of course.

A party of suspicious types is wandering nearby. A few town residents already disappeared. The same thing happened to several merchant caravans, and traders now prefer to stay away from the town. Help us and rid us of those types!
Ha! Just got the message. This problem decided patrol.
Where are they now?
Not far from the town.
You've been causing a lot of trouble around here and I don't have to answer to you. Surrender or die!
You've been causing a lot of trouble around here and  I don't have to answer to you. Surrender or die!
Too bad. No one needs your help at the moment.
I'm afraid I must be going now. Find one of my colleagues  - there are three of us right now that are in taverns, I think, for more tasks.
I have defeated the rebel peasants and taken back the money!

Good work. Now, hand me the money and we will split it half and half. I will be leaving this town shortly, now that my work is done. You will find my colleagues throughout taverns in Perisno, giving you quests, although not every one of them will be as easy as this one! Farewell, {playername}. I can see a brave warrior in you.
I will take the money back immediately.
Hello. I am {playername}. Who are the Adventurer's Guild?
Greetings. What business having you with the Adventurer's Guild? Have you come looking for tasks to complete?

I am glad you asked! We are a group of men and women dedicated to getting beginning adventurers started on their journeys to become famous. We give out tasks, quests, and jobs of all sorts to people who want it and if those in need request a favor we will try to send an Adventurer to help them. Of course, we require payment from the ones who request help from us.
So basically you guys are a group of people that send your guildsman to help those in need, if paid?

Essentially, yes. Although we occasionally send mercenaries to help as well. It is a very fair system, I think. Pay us to help you, and we will pay mercenaries or our guildsman to go help. That way, everyone ends up happy. Are you looking for any tasks to complete, adventurer?
I am a mercenary in these lands. I indeed would like to complete some quests.
No. Goodbye for now.

I was hoping you would ask. I don't know how capable you are, but since you are new, I will give you an easier job. Recently, we were contacted by an anonymous village elder who told us that a group of rebel peasants - around 10 or 20 have rioted and escaped from the village. They are now fugitives, and are told to be around this town. We want you to hunt these peasants down and defeat them, then take their money that they stole from the village elder and give it to us so we can return it to the elder.
I will do it.
No thanks. I don't have time right now.
Very good. Once you defeat the rebellious farmers, return to me and I shall give you a reward as well. Good luck, {playername}.
Who are you? What do you want here? I warn you ... we ... we know how to use our weapons!
What a bunch of fools! I thought you would at least prove a challenge of some sort. I have come to kill you and take back your money that you stole from your village's treasuries.
Men ... steady! We shall let no one get in our way of freedom!
Yes?
Do you have any tasks for me?

Actually, yes. A while ago, a mysterious stranger approached me, telling me to look out for any adventurer who was up for a hard task, and giving me a chest of gold as a reward for the one who would complete it. Might you be up for it?
I don't see why not.
It's about getting rid of someone...a woman.
How is this difficult? You could hire some of Ral D'Aiun's assassins.
They already made five attempts but haven't been successfull. The name of that woman is Nadriela Zwiebel - an Elvarie.
Umm... am I supposed to know that name?

It might ring a bell. Nadriela was the leader of a contingent of rangers back in the War of the Woods. She is very famous - a legend among the Elvarie and Tolranians. I was told that she killed the son of the Tolranian spymaster in a skirmish, which made him hate her.
So you want me to get rid of her?

Yes. However, the Tolranian Spymaster is also hunting her, so you must be careful. I had specific instructions that the Spymaster must not be the one to kill her. I do not know why this is, but the person made it seem vital.
Okay. Do you know where Nadriela is right now?
The person told me that she would be near Elsinore. Good luck, adventurer.
No thanks.
There are no more quests available for you right now. Come back to me later.
Who are adventurer's guild again?

I am glad you asked! We are a group of men and women dedicated to getting beginning adventurers started on their journeys to become famous. We give out tasks, quests, and jobs of all sorts to people who want it and if those in need request a favor we will try to send an Adventurer to help them. Of course, we require payment from the ones who request help from us.
Ah, yes. Thanks for clearing that up for me.
Nevermind.
Greetings, {playername}.
Can you tell me a bit about yourself?
I need to be going now. Farewell.
I have not managed to defeat Kalrind. I am sorry.
Oh well. I guess I will need someone else to do it, then. I am glad that you were not killed - Kalrind is tough! Good luck, {playername}.
I have defeated Kalrind!
Congradulations, {playername}. You have done the kingdom of Elintor - and me a huge favor! Here is your reward.
Greetings. Who might you be?
Me? I am Ulthidir, a minor noble of the Elintoran Nation. What is it you need?
I am {playername}. Can you tell me a bit more about yourself?

I fought in the battle of Lille's Claw, a few years back, young {reg33?Lady:Squire}. We were fighting against a large army of the Tolranian bastards, and we held them off in the pass known as Lille's Claw. The foolish Kingsmen of the Tolranians had no shields, making them easy targets for our archers as we rained death upon our enemies. It was a good day, a day of victory and glory. I also avenged my father that day, who died in the War of the Woods. The damned Tolranians have grown too arrogant, and had forgotten how our bows can easily pierce their armor. Perhaps it is time for all of us to rally again, to drive the Tolranians entirely out of their lands. Many of us hope...
I see. Very interesting. Goodbye.
Do you have any tasks for me?
