Now that you ask, yes. I am a minor noble, and I own a small amount of land near the Geldarin forests. A word of advice, friend. When offered an estate near Geldarin territory, politely decline. I chose to govern it, and now every single day I am plagued by the damn Geldarin elves. There has been one group, in specific, causing more trouble than the others.
I'm guessing you want me to take care of them?

Yes. However, these are not your ordinary group of Geldarin Elves. They are led by one of their nobles, Kalrind. He has an infamous reputation for massacring Elvarie and Humans alike. Beware of him, when you fight him. He will not be taken down easily.
Where do I find him?
You will find him in the Geldarin forests. Good luck, {playername}.
Nevermind, then. I have other things to attend to first.
Nothing. Farewell.
Who are you?.
Me? I am {playername}, and I have come to kill you!
Have you, now? Well, let's see about that!
I am going to find Kunika now.
Ah, good for you to come. Now, you have done us a great service, defeating Kunika. I believe, before we move on to other affairs, that that will need to be addressed. Here is your reward.
Thank you. Now, I have a question. Why were you following me?
Well - no offense, but I could not trust you - a mercenary to fight Kunika. I wanted to see what would happen once you fought him.
So I was simply bait?
Yes, unfortunately. However, I trust you now, and all the dragon priests are grateful for you. I have a request, if I may.
What is it?
I would like to join your party as a companion. My life has been terrible here, as a dragon priest, and I want to take a long break and explore the world. Will you take me?
Of course! Pack your belongings, then, if you are joining, and meet me outside the town walls. I am honored by your offer.
No, I'm sorry. I cannot take you. Goodbye.
Thank you, {playername}. I shall prepare at once.
I shall prepare at once.
{playername}, my scouts have discovered the location of the leader of the Sectarian Priests, Kunika. They say he is somewhere near Reichberg. I want your final task to be to find him and defeat him.
Hmm. That is a lot to ask for. He will undoubtably be strong and have a huge army. How much will I be paid?
You will be paid 15,000 aurums and you will forever have the gratitude of the Priests of the Dragon. I shall also reward you with a Wyvern mount.
I shall do it.
Good luck, {playername}.
I will need time to prepare for this.
You have been causing much grief to us, fool. You have no idea who you are messing with.
I'm guessing you are Kunika? How stupid of you to come to me when I was looking for you!
I will crush you and end your little life. We will become the new Dragon order.
Hello again, {playername}. I assume you have come back to hear your next task?
Yes.
No, I'm a bit busy right now.

Very well. My scouts have reported that the Sectarians are amassing in large numbers, and they have been sending scouts near Drachen lands. I would like you to hunt them down. I will pay you 1500 aurums for each group you destroy, and come back once you have defeated at least five groups.
I will begin immediately.
Good luck.
Yes? Have you made progress?
Not yet. Goodbye.
I have hunted down some Sectarian Scouts.
Yes, my scouts have informed me.    The reward is 1500 aurums for every Sectarian party. Here is your money, as promised.

You certainly deserved your pay. Most of the Sectarian scouting parties have been dealt with and now they won't be getting so many intelligence reports. They will not anticipate us now. You have done an excellent job.
Thank you. Is there any other job for me?
Yes, I will have a job for you later.
Continue hunting them, {playername}. Good luck.
Thank you.
I will escort them now to Voldeberg.
I have succeeded in escorting the wyverns to Voldeberg.
That is good to hear! One of my contacts in Voldeberg told me about you success. You didn't happen to be attacked by any Sectarian priests, did you?
Actually, we were ambushed by them. We fought them off, however.
The Sectarian priests are growing stronger by the day. I fear they may do something drastic soon.
Is there anything else I can do to help you fight them?.
I will have a job for you later so come back once you are ready.
I have failed. I'm sorry.
I am disappointed. I thought better of you, {playername}, but apparently you cannot be trusted.
Nevermind.
Who are you, fool? Why have you come to me without kneeling?
I am {playername}. My apologies, my Lady, I am unaware of your customs. If I may ask, who are you?
Very well. I am Khivachis, one of the three High Priestesses of the Dragon in the Reich des Drachen. High Drachen Priestess Amara is my twin sister. My question still stands. Why have you come to me?
My Lady, I have come seeking adventure. Might you have a task for me?
I don't know. Goodbye.
Someone unimportant. Goodbye.

A task? Why, yes. I was just thinking about this earlier. I need a capable band of mercenaries to escort a group of my Wyvern Riders to {s8}. They are on a mission to deliver a letter to the Baron there, and they must reach their destination. Could you possibly lend a hand on this?

Sure. But I have some questions. First, why are you trusting me to such an important task already, and second, can't the Wyvern Riders defend themselves? I have heard they are fearsome fighters, along with their mounts.

Why am I trusting you? Well, you don't look like a spy or someone who is working for our enemies, and know that I can summon the wrath of the entire Reich and all of our dragons and dragon riders to destroy you. The Wyvern Riders can defend themselves well enough, but ... recently we have heard reports that our enemies, the Sectarian Dragon Priests, are getting stronger. We can't risk losing valuable wyverns to them.
Very well. I will escort them for you.
Nevermind. I am too busy right now. Sorry!
Perfect. The Wyvern riders will wait outside the town for you.
I am afraid I don't have that many soldiers with me.
Sorry. I can't do that right now
We can cover the rest of the way ourselves. Thanks.
Well, we have almost reached {s21}. We can cover the rest of the way ourselves. Thanks for escorting us. Good luck.
Greetings. You must be our escort, right?
Yes. My name is {playername}. I will lead you to {s1}.
Well, It is good to know we won't travel alone. What do you want us to do now?
Eh. We've made it this far... What do you want us to do?
You follow my lead. I'll take you through a safe route.
Alright. We'll be right behind you.
You stay here for a while. I'll go ahead and check the road.
Alright. We'll be waiting here for you.
Well hello, traveler. What have you got with you?
And who are you to ask that?
Who am I? I am a dragon priest - a true dragon priest. I see you have some of your wyverm friends with you.
What I do is none of your business.
No need for rude words, fellow traveler. Better hand over your money and let us deal with the wyvern riders, now.
I will pass, thank you. Instead I think you should hand ME your money instead.
I had hoped you would be reasonable, but oh well. They're all the same ...
Greetings. We are travelling to our destination.
What is it you want?
I wish to join you and become a Demon Worshipper.
Nothing.
Away with you, vile heretic. Those who oppose our kind shall taste the wrath of the Dreaded One. [Placeholder NPC until future versions]
Ha! You think  it is that simple? If you truly wish to become one of us, you must prove that you are not some filthy spy from the Church of Faith.
How do I do that?

You must go on a pilgrimage to our Demon Shrine, and see if the Priests there will accept you. Before you do that, you must give me 1500 aurums. Our treasury is growing thin. Show your dedication in this way.
Very well. I shall travel to the Shrine and pay my respects to the Demon Gods and the Dreaded One.
No thanks, then.
Good. I shall await your return... or not, if the Demon Priests find you unworthy.

Greetings, stranger. Why have you come here, to the holiest of our shrines? Have you come with a demand, or perhaps an offer? Either way, you will not be allowed to leave until you state exactly what you want here.
I have come to join your Order and religion. I believe in your beliefs, and I will do anything it takes to prove it. Shadesin sent me here. I have already paid him 1500 aurums in advance.

You think it is that easy? You will have to prove yourself. I will bestow the rank of Demon Pilgrin upon you for now. Talk to Shadesin again. You must prove yourself as worthy before you can become a full member, or learn any of our secrets. Leave me now.
Thank you, my Lord. I will serve our Order well.
Good day, would you like to have a look at my wares?
Yes, let me see what you have for sale.
No, thanks.
Thank you for your business.
Good day, {reg33?madame:sir}. It is an honor to meet the {reg33?lady:man} that rid us of the oppresive Atanos Octiem. You can buy all kinds of Legion troops from me.
Excellent. Let's see what you have.
I don't need any soldiers right now.
Let me know what you're interested in.
Companion Infantry.
Companion Archers.
Companion Cavalry.
Legionaries.
Atanon Guards.
Nevermind.
Hmm, let me see...
I can get you those for a price of {s4} aurums each. How many would you like?
That is too expensive.
Let me reconsider.
They are all at your service, {playername}
Glad to see you again, {playername}. Have you come for more Legion troops?
Indeed.
No thanks, I have to go.
...I...I can hardly believe it!
We'll meet you outside the fort.
Well? Have you made a decision?
...Hmm? What are you looking at, soldier?
Sir, I was just wondering why you're back here in the residential district.
Forgive me, Visavo.
And why should the business of a Visavo concern a legionary like yourself?
A man of your rank just seems out of place here, that's all.
You're right, sir. I should move along.
Hmm...say, your accent sounds quite odd for a {reg33?woman:man} of the Third. Who is your Visavo?
Uh...Visavo...Oct...uh...Oct-Octervius?
Who? You don't even kn- hold on. Your uniform looks off as well. You're not a real Third soldier, are you!
You know, I should probably get back to my post-
Wait, soldier, your face looks awfully familiar...you're the renowned {reg33?lady:lord} {playername}, aren't you? You've caused quite a stir in the lands of Perisno lately.
(Looks puzzled) Very well...soldier. [Not enough renown]
{playername}, can I be honest with you about something?
Yes, what is it?
Sorry, but I really must be going now.
I...I am not particularly fond of the way Atanos Octiem is running the Third. His vision of resurrecting the ancient Venetor Empire is, well, nonsense.
He fails to recognize the strength of the new powers of Perisno, and I worry he will bring about the destruction of the Venetor legacy once and for all.

I have a proposition for you. I have covertly secured the support of my division and second-in-command Kalero to revolt against the Atanos, and with your help we may actually stand a chance at beating him.

I will warn you however. Even with my division gone, we would be assaulting over 400 troops holed up in this outpost, as well as the Atanos' personal guard regiment. It will no doubt be a punishing fight. What do you say?
Very well. I will help your cause defeat Atanos Octiem and his Legion.
I'm sorry, Visavo, but I do not believe I am currently prepared for such a challenge.
A million thanks, {reg33?madame:sir}. You will not regret overthrowing the militant Octiem. Me and my troops will meet you outside the fort.
We've done it! Sacrifices were made on both sides, but with your help we've captured Octiem and rid the land of his corrupted Legion.
Now that we have control of the fort, we can make some long overdue changes.

The prosperous market that had been shut down by Octiem to discourage external interaction will be repopened at once. We will also no longer send scouting parties out to harrass Perisnoan inhabitants.
As we are now forever in debt to you for preserving our culture, I offer to you Octiem's personal treasury. You can also feel free to use the market and hire troops from our military specialist.
Thank you, and take care {playername}.
What? What do you want? Leave me be. I have no time for beggars.
Shut up  Eared!
Hello.
I am {playername}. Who are you?
I have done it! Now, the Geldarin Elves are free from oppression!
I am a Geldarin Elf.
You have achieved it! I knew you would do it. My friend, we are forever in your debt.
I have a gift for you. This is Duskfall, one of the finest bows ever forged by Geldarin Elves. It is used now by others as well, but this is the original, best one.
Thank you for your gift. I will help the Geldarin Elves defeat the Elintoran Elves. For glory!
I haven't got the time.
I long for the destruction of the vile scum of Elintoran Elves. They have comitted atrocities against us that are unspeakable..
I agree.
The thought of Elves disgusts me.
I am a Geldarin Elf. My ancestors were once the dominant elf clan, but that time is once gone. We are now pushed aside, ruled by our enemies the cruel, savage Elintoran Elves.
I will help you defeat the Elintoran Elves.
Too bad. I dislike elves regardless.
I think you are a good man. You have potential. My task for you is to conquer the capital city of Forniron, the city we are standing in right here. I think you can do it.
Hearing that pleases me. I hope you will succeed.
I shall help you conquer Forniron. I have no love for the Elintoran Elves.
Geldarin elves? There are enough elves in the world already!
Greetings.
Greetings to you too.
I failed. I'm sorry.
Oh . . . Oh well. I suppose you did the best you could. Bad luck, friend.Farewell.
I have done it! I defeated the Red Immortals and took the shield.
I knew you could do it! In my vision, I saw that one day a {reg33?lady:man} would come and defeat them! Now, I have a revelation to make: I used to be a Red Immortal.
What?? Then why would you want me to kill them? And are the visions that you talked about all fake?
They betrayed me and cast me out. I have longed for this day. Yes, the vision is fake too. And I have a reward for you...
This is my old set of armor. Farewell, adventurer. I sense a great future in you...
I have seen it! A vision! A piece of craftsmanship beyond the capabilities of a mortal, wielded by the masters of intimidation... and they all thought it was a lie!
My good man, what in the world are you rambling on about?
I told them they would come! I told them! But no, there is no evidence, and no, the books don't mention them. Now, after long last, I have proof! Real and concrete proof!
You told them that what would come? Please, my patience is thinning.

The Immortals, sir, the infamous Red Immortals, the 'mythical' elites of the Old Hakkon army! After an account written by the Hakkon historian Mirkhond was discovered some years ago, the tale of these invincible soldiers has been used to inspire many a young lad into enlisting in the army.
So you say you have seen these men. Where would I be able to find them?

I have indeed seen them, but their location was not clear to me. Perhaps you should ask a more learned man of what they know of this 'mythical' tale. They may know where to send you next. If you defeat these Red Immortals, you will be able to take nigh invincible loot and their legendary shield, the Aegis!
Where would I be able to find such a man?
I'm sorry- I've had enough of this nonsense. Good day.
The lands of Tolrania is renowned for their interest in the intellects. You will certainly find someone to ask at the center of learning in Perisno.
I shall search for the Red Imortals.
I will take back the relic for you immediately.
I will take back the relic for you immediately.
Leave me be. I am studying.
Alright. Goodbye.
Are you a scholar?
-The man sighs - Indeed I am. Who are you?

I am {playername}, at your service. I have come here, to Galwe, the great center of learning and education, to seek some answers to my questions. I was hoping a very learned man like you could help me.
Well, I suppose I cannot blame a young man for being curious. What it is, exactly, that you seek?
I wish to know more about the Red Immortals.
What?? The Red Immortals are nothing but a children's myth! Leave me be, now. Please.
I'm sorry for bothering, then. Can you at least point me to someone who knows more about it?
-The man shakes his head and rolls his eyes.- Fine. But you must first do something for me.
Of course. What do you need?

The infamous bandit, called Rdahcim, stole a family heirloom of mine. It is a relic, shaped like a cup, and he took it. - The man grinds his teeth in rage - I want you to track that bastard down, destroy his lair, and return to me the relic. Then I shall give you a clue on where the Red Immortals are.
I will do it.
Good luck. You can find Rdahcim near the forests around here.
No thanks. It's a waste of my time (fail the quest).
It's me, {playername}. The one you talked to before. I have your relic.

Ah! Very good then, {playername}! Thank you so much for this! Now, I believe I promised you information for the relic. You will need to go and travel to Amarna to consult my colleague, who is an expert on these matters.
Thank you. Goodbye.
Who the hell are you? And what do you want?
Me? I am the one who will kill you.
If you wouldn't mind, I'm trying to concentrate.
Sorry for bothering you.
The scholar of Galwe told me to find you. I have a question to ask.
My friend from Galwe, yes. What exactly is it you need?
I am seeking information about the legend of the Red Immortals. More specifically, where they are rumored to be located. He said that you are the greatest expert on the subject in all of Perisno.

Well, I'm afraid I can only relay you once more to another source. I have closely studied the texts of the scholar Mirkhond for many years, but I have done so from a purely factual and historical perspective. What you want is more obscure and absolute. The Mythseeker will know the answer to your question, I have no doubt in my mind.
Another person to track down...where can I find this Mythseeker that you speak of?
The last I checked, he was near Sasspegah castle. Perhaps you should search around there.
I seek them ... the myths...
... (you leave the man alone).
The scholar of Amarna told me to find you. I have a question to ask.
What is it? Leave me be! I seek the myths, the truth! Do not talk of foolish scholars to me!
I am sorry. I have a question about the Red Immortals.
The Red Immortals? What business have you with them?
Dangerous business. I seek their legendary weapons and shield, and I will kill them.
You want to find them? And kill them? You are nothing but a fool. You cannot defeat the Immortals.
That is your opinion. Please tell me where they are.
-the man smiles to himself-. I will tell you ... you are going to die anyway. Go to the village of Wahran. That is all I shall tell. Now leave me be.
Surrender or die!
We are the Red Immortals, from the old Hakkon Empire. I would think twice before attacking.
No thanks. You will die, here. Now.
Greetings {playername}.
Greetings to you too, great bard.
I did it, Taragith. I have the book and the lyre.
Excellent! You have done a great job! Here, let me take those..
Aren't you going to tell me where the sword is, now??
Hah! Of course! I have it ... right here, with me!
... ... WHAT?? You mean to tell me that I went on this wild goose chase to find those two relics JUST for some sort of test that you concocted?

Indeed. These two relics are going to be useful for me in my research for the Kingslayer, but they do not provide the answers to where Kingslayer is simply because I have it right here. I did what I did as a test for you. I wanted to see what type of warrior this generation had. You have still done a great favor for me, {playername}. You brought me two important relics. As your payment, I shall give you Kingslayer.
Someday, you will be the one people write stories about. I have great hopes for you.
Thank you, Taragith. I will make good use of this legendary sword. Farewell..
Bard, I failed. I'm sorry.
Oh . . . Oh well. I suppose you did the best you could. Bad luck, friend.Farewell.
Come back when you have it.

Good day, my {reg33?lady:lord}. I am Targith, Great Bard of Perisno. I am the one who wrote the poems, 'Lost One's Soul', 'The Heir of the Heiress', and many more. I am also responsible for chronicling the histories of many legendary weapons and mysterious occurances in Perisno. Furthermore, I have written historical work for the Scholar's Guild, and my work has been praised all over the world.
Continue, please
I have other things to do than to listen to a fool. Farewell.

I'm afraid that if I go on, I will never stop talking. You look like a capable type. I have recently been delving deep into tomes and accounts of the sword, the Kingslayer. It is said that the great Emperor of the Old Perisnoan Empire, Thyceo, slew seven different kings with that one sword to gain dominance. I might have a faint idea of where it is, now that I know most of the details. Would you like to hear my idea?
Yes. Please tell me.
I have other things to do. I believe Kingslayer to be a myth. Farewell.

To search for the sword, you will need to find two items: a lyre and a book. It is said that Emperor Thyceo's bard wrote the secret of where Kingslayer was hidden in the back of his lyre, named the Lyre of Yralis. If this proves untrue, then the book will hold the secret. The book, called the 'Biography of Emperor Thyceo', has the location of the sword inside. I am certain that the secret to Kingslayer lies inside one of these two items.
Interesting. Where shall I find the lyre and book?
I have better things to do than going on a futile treasure hunt. Farewell.

Oh, it is easy. You must meet an old reclusive hermit, called the Unusual Hermit by everyone around him, at Waal Castle. He know where the Lyre is. And the Biography of Thyceo, hmm, I think that the Priest Calain can say something about it's whereabouts, but, alas, I dont know where he lives now.Be warned, these two items are going to be very hard to acquire. You will need to be prepared to face many hardships in order to obtain them. However, I believe you can do it. If you succeed, you get the greatest sword of all... the Kingslayer, rumored to have a blade that never dulls. Oh... and, if you do find these items, you will most likely need me to translate the words for you, as they are written in Old Perisnoan dialect.
Alright. I shall go search for them.
I am not interested, sorry. I don't need a new sword and there are no guarantees of success, after all.
What do you want?.
Nothing. Goodbye.
Are you the one they call the Unusual Hermit? Can you tell me where the Lyre of Yralis is?
I am indeed the hermit. I was once a great general, serving under the Freelancer Guild. But that was a lifetime ago... who are you, and what do you want?
(Lie) I am the descendant of the bard Yralis. I need to know where he hid it.
My name is {playername}. The Great Bard Taragith sent me. We need the Lyre for one of Taragith's discoveries.
I hope you are not trying to fool anyone ... do you think me an idiot? Yralis left no descendant. Begone!
Taragith? Hmm..what has he gotten himself into this time, I wonder? I have heard that you might find the lyre somewhere near the Four Pillars. There, you will find a noble by the name of Galine.
Where? [Intimidate]
Where?
Ah. I'd forgotten that it is not called by that name anymore... it is Westrey Castle.
I don't fear you, {reg33?wench:knave}, I've killed men who were thousand times better warriors than you. But I like your methods. You can find him at Westrey Castle.
Nothing. Sorry for bothering.
Are you called Galine?
Yes. My name is Galine Goldine, and you are... ?
(Lie)I am the last descendant of Emperor Thyceo. I seek the lyre of my ancestor's faithful bard, Yralis.
My name is {playername}. Great Bard Taragith sent me. He seeks the lyre of Yralis for a recent discovery he made.
Do you think I am stupid? Thyceo left only one descendant, who died early in his reign. Take off.

The Lyre of Yralis is an heirloom of my family. However, a Valahir raider by the name of Sekr Frosttongue took it from me.I do not know where it is now, but maybe the Priest Calain will know. Calain once preached to him, I have heard.He currently resides somewhere near Forde but I am not sure exactly his whereabouts. Search around that area.
Well. I will travel to the countryside of Forde, then. Farewell.
Nothing, I'm leaving.
Priest Calain? That is you, correct?

That is who I am. I used to be full of life ... full of zeal and religion. I am now a priest in all but name. I grow old, and my mind grows old along with me... (his eyes grow distant for a second, then turns back to you). Did Taragith send you? He seeks the Book, does he not?
Yes, and I also want the knowledge of the whereabouts of the raider Sekr Frosttongue.
I will tell you where he and the lyre are. But do me a favor first. You must kill me. I would like to quicken my journey to the afterlife. Please, do it.
Well. I will do it, if you wish it so.
I am not an assassin. I shall not do it.
No. You are a wise and good man, and I sense you still have many good things to do. Listen, I can help your mission with 500 coins.

At last! Your enemy is hiding in Wotin Castle, his old home. And the book ... I have the book. You can take it. Now, do it ...(Your weapon sinks into his flesh. You do not hear any cry of pain, but only see his eyes slowly shutting down, until his body is totally limp. Then, you leave the room slowly, after finding and taking the book.)
Hmph... maybe you are right after all. The New Gods still need me ... perhaps. You can find the rogue Sekr at Wotin Castle.(he hands you the book after searching it for a while in his library.)
You have courage, idiot, I thought you were not coming.
You can still save many lives...
It is too late. My god, Valhar, wants your blood. You're nothing more than a fool and I'll drink beer in your skull tonight. Then, I will send your skull to Taragith.
So be it.
Forget about it, I'm leaving.
Sekr Frosttongue. I come to you, looking for the Lyre of Yralis.
Another one? Sigh ... Well, maybe you're smarter. The rest of you 'seekers' have died trying. I give you two options: pay me 3,000 aurums, and I will tell you where they are, or get out of my sight.
Ok, take 3000 aurums. Tell me, where are they?
Somebody bought the lyre two days ago. But you are a fool and I will not give anymore information to you.
I am tired of all these stupid bards' games. I don't want Kingslayer anyways. I give up. So long.
There is another option: You die if you don't tell me where they are.
Hahaha, you think you can kill me? Alright. Let's fight, outside.
You committed a crime against the Church of Faith. Punishment awaits you! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Greeting! We are warriors the Church of Faith.
God bless you!
Zelaeck guides us to victory! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Zelaeck guides us to victory! Glory to Falki!
Glory to heroes!
Lord Ceylius the Dishonorable guides us to victory! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Lord Ceylius the Dishonorable guides us to victory! You have to help him.
I am your ally.
Nox of Zephilli guides us to victory! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Nox of Zephilli guides us to victory! You have to help him.
I am your ally.
Ulfhednar guides us to victory! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Ulfhednar guides us to victory! You have to help him.
I am your ally.
Zolona guides us to victory! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Zolona guides us to victory! You have to help her.
I am your ally.
King Rafklazan guides us to victory! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
King Rafklazan guides us to victory! You have to help him.
I am your ally.
Queen Aegea guides us to victory! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Queen Aegea guides us to victory! You have to help her.
I am your ally.
Centurion Octavius guides us to victory! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Centurion Octavius guides us to victory! You have to help him.
I am your ally.
Marshal Ialoch guides us to victory! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Marshal Ialoch guides us to victory! You have to help him.
I am your ally.
Dreaded Nightmare guides us to victory! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Dreaded Nightmare guides us to victory! You have to help him.
I am your ally.
Nibor Hood guides us to victory! Surrender or die!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Nibor Hood guides us to victory! You have to help him.
I am your ally.
You are damn slave trader. We are fighting for their freedom!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Don't come any closer! We are fighting for their freedom!
Good luck!
We are fighting for their freedom! You are a threat to our liberty!
I'm not afraid of you. I will fight.
Don't come any closer! We are fighting for their freedom!
Good luck!
Hello, old friend.
Did you do it?
Hello, {playername}. I presume you've come back for more tasks?
Greetings {playername}.
Goodbye.
Was your raid successful?
Yes! It was nothing I couldn't handle.
No, not yet.
Good job. This is our first step towards the ressurection of the Illican Empire! Come back to me for harder challenges.
Hello, {reg33?lassie:young man}! Are you looking for a  job or something?
Yes!

The Illicans have been in this land for a millenia, and we have lived in peace unless threatened. We have never intentionally provoked others and are a good people. The Drachens invaded however, and drove us out of our homes and burned our farms! They have commited atrocities. One certain caravan carries a lot of gold. It happens to be traveling to us right now. Can you raid it for me and bring the gold to me for proof?
Yes. I will. For the glory of Illica!
No, I don't have time for that!
Excellent!
Thank you for freeing me! I managed to steal the gold when the chaos started, but I had no idea I would get this far! Here you go, sir!
Thank you and good luck.
Here you go.
Goodbye then!
Who are you?
No one you want to know about.
We are under the protection of the Reich. What do you want?
I want to kill you for the glory of Illica!
Nevermind...
Hey, I recognize you! You're the one who's been causing trouble around here lately. Have you come willingly to die?
Yes, I have come to kill you, in the name of Illica.
Fool! You do not know the power I possess. I have been chosen to destroy the Illican race.
Indeed. You told me that I could come back for more work. Is there anything else you would like me to do?

Of course! There is a local Reich lord in the area who has been hunting down Illicans without end. I want you to go and kill him. He is a cruel man with no loyalties except gold and greed. He will have some strong troops, so be careful.
Sounds good. I'll do it.
Maybe later.
Yes!
Not yet.
Great work! We are getting closer, I feel it! At the rate we are going, we shall be free soon. As promised, your reward.
You've been causing a lot of trouble in the area. I will enjoy killing you.
I'd like to see you try.
Hello again, {playername}. My next task for you will be a hard one.
Have you killed them all yet?
Hello again, {playername}. Word of your deeds are spreading among our people.
Are there any harder tasks for me to complete?
A harder task, eh? There isn't anything right now, but maybe you can pass the time by defeating a certain dragon priest for me. He is near Voldeburg. What say you?
That's a good idea. I will do it.
No thanks. Maybe another time, I am busy at the moment.
Yes!
Not yet.
You are really doing us a big favor. The next task may not be so easy however. Here is the reward for now.
Have you defeated that monster yet?
I have.
Not yet.
Good job. I always knew you could do it.
I will gladly do it. What is the task?

There is a man by the name of Gunnarr. He has been dubbed the Illican killer, and is a Mercenary soldier from Nisaynia. He has special methods of defeating our men, and none of us have managed to fight him and win.
So you want me defeat him?
Indeed. He has ways to kill Illicans, but not normal men. Scouts report that he is currently near this town. I have every faith in you that you will succeed.
I will do this.
No thanks. Maybe another time, I am busy at the moment.
You have quite a bounty on your head from the Reich. I will enjoy crushing your skull. For Wodin and Vanir!
I'd like to see you try.
Have you conquered the town yet?
Yes!
I am making the preperations.
I cannot thank you enough for what you have done! From now on, you may recruit Illicans from me whenever you like.
We have come to it at last. Your final task.
What is the task?

It has been many years since our conquerers have banished us and abused us. We are now fighting back - because of you, our hero! It is now time for you to complete your ultimate task. I want you to conquer this city, Voldeburg.
So the time has come?
Indeed. You are our champion now. Fight well, and win!
Thank you.
I need to prepare first.
Hello. Can you tell me more about the lore of Illica?
Of course, my friend! What would you like to know about them?
Tell me about the general history.
We are a proud race, and have been living in Perisno for centuries. We come way before the Elintorans, or even the Third Legion, I daresay. Our culture is rich and deep.

The Reichans came a few years ago, inten on destroying us. We were already weak from a recently civil war between us and an opposing clan. The Reich came, built huge sprawling cities in our land, and drove us out.

However, you, our hero, came in time. You helped us drive the Reich out and reclaim some of our land. For that, we than you eternally. You will be remembered in our stories alongside our other great heroes like Zeladeck, Myrians, and Ha'beo.
Very interesting. Good bye.
Nevermind.
I would like to recruit some Illicans.
Farewell.
Of course! They all cost 150.
Actually, I don't need them at the moment
I would like to hire one Illican Hunter.
I would like to hire five Illican Hunters.
I would like to hire ten Illican Hunters.
I would like to hire twenty Illican Hunters.
That is too expensive.
Thank you. Goodbye for now.
Well done, good {reg33?madame:sir}.
Welcome back to Arendal. How is your quest going?
Hello there, you fine young fellow. Would you like me to tell you about the Dueler?
Good luck on your quest.
The Dueler? Never heard of him. Go on, you have my intrigue.
No thank you. I have something urgent to attend to.
Well, to be honest, I know very little about the Dueler himself. What I do know more about is his...weapon.
A weapon? What kind, a sword?

A sword, yes. A very special kind of sword; a rapier. This rapier, though I have never seen it myself, is supposed to be one of the finest pieces of craftsmanship to ever exist in Perisno; its speed and the Dueler's own skill making him nigh invincible in combat.
Interesting. Where can I find out more about the Dueler and this rapier of his?
The dueler holds godlike status among the trainers of Perisno who can be found the many training ground locations. They will probably know more about him than I do. Good luck.
Good news. I have the rapier.
No way! Do you mind if I...hold it?
Go ahead.
I'd rather you not.
Fantastic. It's so incredibly light, yet strong as well. It seems to be designed for thrusting attacks.
Fair enough, it looks very valuable. A sword of that design seems very adept at thrusting attacks.
You're a very lucky {reg33?woman:man} to have gotten your hands on such a weapon. Take good care of it for me, will you?
Will do.
I am here to fight your men.
Actually, I have a question to ask you about...more mysterious matters.
A question? Ask away.
I was told that you trainers hold a certain man with the utmost respect for his proficiency in combat. I was wondering if you could tell me a little more about this man, the Dueler.

The Dueler? My my, it has been many years since I last heard that name. To answer your question: yes, I can tell you a little more about him. However, as I don't want this rather valuable information to fall into the wrong hands, you must first prove your worth to me.
And how might I do that?
Excellent. Are you ready to begin?

Well, in a normal practice fight, I would start off easy and work you up the tiers of difficulty. Instead of doing that, I will put you up against 3 of my finest fighters in a row, and then I will tell you what you want to hear. Are you ready?
Yes I am.
Here you go then. Good luck.
Just a minute. I am not ready yet.
Hey, You will never make it if you don't practice.
Well done, very well done. Not only have you proven yourself but you have also impressed me greatly. I am confident that I can now tell you what I know.

It was on that day, the first and last I saw of him, that this man approached my training field. He did not give a name, so thereafter we simply reffered to him as 'the Dueler' for reasons that will soon become apparent.

The moment he began to spar I knew there was something different about him. It was his flawless technique, his record-setting defeat of my fighters, maybe even the sun dancing off that fancy sword of his- it was incredible. I even threw uneven matchups against him, even outnumbered twelve to one he managed to dodge and slash and parry his way to victory.
Soon my men had all but collapsed from exhaustion, and the Dueler, sheathing his narrow sword, turned and departed with nothing but a nod in my direction.
My account of the Dueler is one of many among trainers in Perisno, and you can find a compendium of information on the man in the great library of Galwe. Farewell, and good luck in your quest.
Oh, you again? What is it?
I beg your pardon, but this book requires my full concentration.
Pardon me, but this book requires my full concentration.
I don't want to disrupt your work, but I was hoping to find someone who can direct me to a specific book.
My apologies.
Alright then, quickly. What are you looking for?
I was told this library houses a compilation of information about a man named, or...nicknamed, the Dueler?

Ah, yes! Funny you should inquire about the book at this time, as I was actually about to return it to the library. I had planned on reading it but was sidetracked by my newfound interest in Tolranian political history.
Did you know that Nibor Hood, the nefarious leader of the Outlaws, is the brother of the Tolranian claimant, Lady Tylora? How fascinating!
Anyway, where was I...oh yes. I suppose I can lend the book to you for a little while, until you find what you need. So long.
I'm here to return the book you kindly lent me.
Unfortunately, the book is no longer in my possession. How much do I owe you?
Excellent! I was beginning to worry that you weren't going to bring it back.
I made some notes here and there, and added some information I think you'll find to be...quite relevant the the story of the Dueler.

You...you wrote in a library book!? How could you defile such a delicately assembled compilation of information! Besides, how useful could your little anecdote be? Gah! I don't have time for you right now.
You lost the book!? Gah...the library will want at least 1000 aurums for losing such a valuable piece of information.
Right, here you go.
Fine. Now leave me to my studies, you irresponsible swine.
I don't have that kind of money.
Well, I would advise you get out of my sights before I call the city watch on you!
You've far exceeded my expectations {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}. I will be sure to spread the word of your great accomplishment on this day.
You've far exceeded my expectations {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}. I will be sure to spread the word of your great accomplishment on this day.
He's a tough one isn't he? I hope you learned a lesson or two about...humility among other things.

That was very impressive, young {reg33?lady:man}. Don't feel too good about yourself, however; the Dueler's talent cannot be compared to the men you just fought. Are you sure you still want to do this?
Are you ready to take him on again?
Hmm...as I suspected, it seems you need more practice after all. Come back when you and your men have trained harder.
Are you ready?
Hello again. So what did you want from the Dueler?
Good day friend. How can I help you?
Anything else?
That's not...THE Dueler, is it? I've been looking all over for him.

Oh I'm just looking around, thanks.
Unfortunately, no. This space has been...reserved for the time being.
Ah, so I see you've heard of him. Lucky for you, you've found the place that he and his apprentices train.
He prefers Qaletaqa because few Perisno mainlanders dare to venture out into the Aroulian jungle, and therefore he can perfect his art in seclusion.
So, what would you like from him? He doesn't normally interact with strangers, however I'm sure he'd be willing to listen to someone with your level of determination.
I am here to challenge the Dueler to a duel.
Who exactly is the Dueler?
I'll be back in a little bit.
You want to...duel him? I don't mean to be rude, but I think that may be a bad idea.

Nobody knows for sure who he is or where he comes from, and he isn't exactly the garrulous type. The few times I have heard him speak, however, his accent sounded like nothing I had ever heard before.
Other than that he is not from Perisno, your guess is as good as mine. I do know that he wields that rapier of his with incredible mastery, better than anyone I've ever seen.
Take your time.
I'll be just fine. I'm ready to fight.
On second though, I need some time to prepare first.
Well I won't put you up against the Dueler right away. First, you and your first seven men can go up against his eight apprentices so that I can get an idea of your skill.
Are you ready?
Let's go.
Let me reorder my party first.
I'm ready.
Give me some time to recover from that last fight.
[He doesn't seem to hear you]
So I have been defeated.
It was only a matter of time before my craft with the sword was bested by a challenger.
I suppose you have more right than I to train these men. Take care of them for me.
I also feel obliged to give you something else, for I can no longer hold it in good conscience.
This rapier is made of precious Parandovan titanium, forged by my country's greatest blacksmith and designed to be the lightest and fastest sword ever made.
It was given to me for becoming the most skilled fighter in Parandova, and I was sent by my king to explore and display my strength to the world.
It is now my duty to give the rapier to you, {reg33?lady:lord} {playername}.
You are a most gracious opponent. Thank you for this gift.
I can't accept such a valuable treasure of your people.
You are generous to decline, but I must insist. This sword no longer belongs to me.
Farewell, {playername}. It is time for me to return to my land.
I would be glad to take upon myself a special mission.

A mission? {playername}, I am not in position to ask you to do anything. However, I have a gift for you that I planned to delever to you for quite some time. Please accept it as a sign of our friendship.

Could you perhaps do me a small favor, {reg33?madame:sir}? The task is this: I had planned to give my ruler a wolf as a gift, but alas, war has called and I cannot deliver the beast. Can you convey the animal to him in my stead?
Agree...
Very well, I would not shy from taking this job.
Here is the wolf, and here is the money for his keeping. Know this -- if you should lose the steed, or fail to deliver it in time, you'll have only yourself to blame for what follows.
Refuse...
I am honored to hear that you would wish to bestow such an important task upon me... But alas, I have no time to play nurse to a wolf.
The decision is yours. I shall find myself another who can aid me in this.
Well hello, wayfarer! Why such a hurry? What is it that troubles you?
And who are you to ask that?
Who am I? Why, I am a freedom fighter, at your service. -- And the keeper of this road, too.
What is that supposed to mean?
No need for rude words, wayfarer. Better show us what you have in the cart, now.
In the cart be arms, and I assure you I can use them...
Then we shall just have to see about that...
I believe not my eyes! What a treasure you have here, my good {man/lady}. Perhaps we shall take it!
{reg33?madame:sir}, I brought you a modest gift from Baron Gereon
What a beautiful strange beast! But it is taking a great risk, travelling these roads with such a wolf. Here, take this for your troubles.
I don't have any work for you.

It is good to see you alive, {s5}! {s6}, and I did not know whether you had been captured, or slain, or got away. I've been roaming around since then, looking for you. Shall I get my gear together and rejoin your company?

However, if you do nothing, you risk appearing weak. Such are the burdens of kingship, {reg33?my lady:sire}.

{s1} currently does not have a lord. You may wish to keep it this way, as lords will sometimes gravitate towards lieges who have land to offer, but for the time being, no one is collecting any of its rents.

I should point out though, sire, that I am not very skilled in the ways of politics, and that I am anxious to return to private life. If you wish to issue any but the most basic directives, I suggest appointing a trusted companion in my stead. In the meantime, is there anything you wish done?

A simple ruse, {s65}. If we exchange garments, I shall take your place here in prison,while you make your escape disguised as myself.I paid the guards a handsome bribe, with which I am sure they have already purchased half the wine stocks of the nearest tavern.With some luck they'll soon get so drunk they'd have troublerecognising their own mothers, let alone telling one of us from the other.At least not until you are safely away.

I shall be fine as long there is an ample reward waiting at the end.
You are a brave soul indeed. I won't forget this.

{s66}, I wish to restore my old oath to {s4}.

A shame, {s65}. A shame.
Very well, go and die without me.
Aye, I am ready.
On second thought, no. I don't wish to be in your service again.

Excellent. Though you strayed from us, {playername}, it gladdens all our hearts that you have found your way back to the right path. I hereby restore your homage to me. Rise once more as an honoured {reg33?warrior:man} in my service.
Then get out of my sight, traitor! Begone with you, and do not come back!
I wish to make peace with the {s4}.
Do you indeed, {playername}? Then go and trip on your sword. Give us all peace.
{playername}, you are a {reg33?lady:lord} without a master, holding lands in your name, with only the barest scrap of a claim to legitimacy.No king in Perisno would accept a lasting peace with you.
Make peace when I have you at an advantage? I think not.
I do not see it as being in my current interest to make peace, and have no interest in negotiations.
As things stand I do not see it as being in my current interest to make peace, but if you were to hand over {s0} I would be willing to agree to a truce of twenty days.
I accept.  I will give you {s0}, and let there be peace.
I don't have {s0} with me.

I accept. Let us stop making war upon each other, for the time being anyway.
On second thought, such an accord would not be in my interests.

Hmm. I could use my considerable influence to arrange a pardon for you, {playername},but there are some who see you as an enemy and will not be satisfied unless you pay tribute.All in all, you'd need to bring no less than {reg16} aurums to make any friends in {s4}.

I don't care much about politics. But the king has promised me a great reward for your head. I think that is more than enough incentive.

Congradulations, {playername}. This is more than I had ever hoped for. Here is your reward!
I have heard news of a group of renegade noble in the kingdom. Is there anything I may do to help?

My lord, I have heard that there are those who want to dispute your rule. Is there anything I could do to help?
You've heard, have you? Yes, there are many who want to dispute my rule. Which group are you talking about...?
Well, I've heard rumors recently that a Sectarian group of Dragon Priests have been wrecking havoc in Reich lands.
Nevermind ...

Currently I do not know where those rats are. But, if you do find them, kill them for me and spit on their dead bodies.
So, the Kaiser's dog has come to sniff us out, eh?

The Kaiser talks about a new future in this land, and hopes for a land united under his rule. He is foolish, very foolish, for that. He thinks that he is the one that can raise the Reich to glory. He has deluded himself in his visions for power. We were the first ones to see that, and have decided to break away.

He acts noble and supposedly upholds duty, but he is a hypocrite. All the nobles and kings are alike. Truly, you must realize that. You are smarter than them. If you defeat us, all you will get from the Kaiser is a pat on the back and a little reward for your loyalty. Is not freedom better than that?
If I do plan to break away, it certainly will not be with the likes of you. To arms!

That is pleasing news, {playername}. Thank you for your time and effort. As promised, here is your reward.

That is pleasing news, {playername}. Thank you for your time and effort. As promised, here is your reward.

Hello, my friend. Indeed, something of importance has. It is in fact a matter of great urgency. I found a portrait, which I believe belongs to King Greavth, one of the great Elintoran kings. My mother, Arwen, in particular, loves collecting treasures, and she would love the portrait.
That's great news! How, if I may ask, is this a matter of great urgency?

It's been stolen! The portrait was right under my grasp, but it was stolen! And I have no idea who did it! And now, my mother is coming to see me soon because she wants to see the portrait. She's bringing the council with her! It would be much too embarassing if I said it was stolen, under my very nose!
So, how am I going to come into this?
Please, help me find it! I suggest that you first go to Lord Throthradien, whom I suspect knows a thing or two about it. He was the only one I told.

I haven't found anything during my investigations.
That's okay. I have! I've found out that the entire thing was a ploy. The assassins were acting on their own accord. This was told to me by an anonymous informant.

It turns out that this was all a delicate plan to assassinate the Queen. The portrait is fake. However, the queen would like to talk to you.
Okay. All that was ... for nothing? - You think, what does the queen possibly want with you?-
I'm here, Your Majesty.
It's about time! I think I should reward you for your efforts. Linthrandil told me that you thwarted a delicate plan to assassinate me, by killing those assassins and through your interrogations.
Thank you, Your Majesty.
I shall not forget your favor. Goodbye, for now.
-You lean close to the count until your voice is almost a whisper- Do you know anything about a missing portrait of King Greavth?
-He looks shocked for a minute, and his face turns pale- Yes, I do. I ... I - they made me do it- steal the portrait! They were terrible..those men.
Who? I need a name! Tell me who did it?
Men in red hoods... terrifying. They moved swifty like death itself.
Can you give any more information than that??
Those men ... thy were like assassins. They had red cloaks as well. I don't know what they wanted from me! I had to do it, or they would have killed me.
Thank you. You have been most helpful.
Halt! Tell me what you and your order know about a missing portrait, and what were you doing with it?

What? We are never told anything. A man named Zaos hired us for that. But, why did I just tell you that? I guess it was because we always tell our victims our plans before we kill them - it's quite a nice tradition, too!
I've caught you, Zaos! Come peacefully with me to the Queen. We know what you've done, villain!
Uh... what? What have I done? Fool, what the heck are you talking about? Are you trying to frame a lord of the Elintoran Nation?
Don't play stupid. Come with me peacefully or die.
I really do not know what you are talking about. I swear it on my life.
Uh... are you serious?? Then those assassins were lying! Gah, I knew I shouldn't have listened to them.
Well... I have no idea what you are talking about, but I guess I'll leave it alone. You're lucky I'm in a good mood today. Goodbye.
