My {reg33?lady:lord}, you seem to have the makings of a good war leader. For a {reg33?woman:man} to show such skill is an uncommon thing in Perisno, but not completely without precedent. Noble{reg33?women:men} have often taken command of armies after their {reg33?husbands:wives} or {reg33?fathers:mothers} were slain or captured, for example.

However, I have never heard of a {s0} who granted a fief to a {reg33?woman:man}, no matter how valorous, simply because {reg65?she:he} needed an extra vassal. Were I to do such a thing, I would raise eyebrows across Perisno. People would say that I was besotted or bewitched, or that I aimed to overturn the natural order of things. As much as I regret it, I cannot afford to grant you a fief.
What if I were to take one of your enemy's castles by force?
What if I were to marry one of your lords?
Perhaps one of your competitors will prove to be more open-minded.
I would be willing to fight for you, even without the fief.
Never mind.

Well, I still would not be willing to grant you any fiefs. However, you would no doubt have the use of your {reg33?husband:wife}'s properties, which would allow you to act as one of my vassals in all but name. Did you have an other questions?
Oh, perhaps you might find someone who was truly desperate -- but then, I would think, they would not have many fiefs to bestow. Did you have an other questions?
Well, in that case, depending on the circumstances, I might be inclined to let you keep it. Did you have an other questions?

You are known as a brave {reg33?warrior:man-at-arms} and a fine leader of men, {playername}.I shall be pleased to accept your {s0} into my service and bestow vassalage upon you,if you are ready to swear homage to me.
You've yet to show yourself as a competent commander, {playername}.Take your {s0} to my enemies and prove to me that you are worthy of becoming my vassal.Then we may speak more of this.
I am ready, {s65}.
Forgive me, {s65}, I must give the matter more thought first...
Take whatever time you need, my lady.
What are you playing at, {playername}? Go and make up your mind, and stop wasting my time.
Good. Then repeat the words of the oath with me: I swear homage to you as lawful ruler of the {s41}.
I pledge homage to you as lawful ruler of the {s41}.
Excuse me, {reg65?my lady:sir}. But I feel I need to think about this.
I will remain as your loyal and devoted {reg33?follower:man} as long as my breath remains....
I will remain as your loyal and devoted {reg33?follower:man} as long as my breath remains...
{reg65?My lady:Sir}, may I ask for some time to think about this?
...and I will be at your side to fight your enemies should you need my sword.
...and I will be at your side to fight your enemies should you need my sword.
My {reg65?Lady:Lord}, please give me more time to think about this.
Finally, I will uphold your lawful claims and those of your legitimate heirs.
Finally, I will uphold your lawful claims and those of your legitimate heirs.
{reg65?My lady:Sir}, I must have more time to consider this.
Very well. You have given me your solemn oath, {playername}. May you uphold it always, with proper courage and devotion.

Let it be known that from this day forward, you are my sworn {reg33?follower:man} and vassal.I give you my protection and grant you the right to bear arms in my name, and I pledge that I shall not deprive you of your life, liberty or properties except by the lawful judgment of your peers or by the law and custom of the land.{reg1? Furthermore I give you the fief of {s1} with all its rents and revenues.:}
You have done a wise thing, {playername}. Serve me well and I promise, you will rise high.
So be it, {s0}. May all my vassals be as valiant and loyal as you.
I have great hopes for you {playername}.I know you shall prove yourself worthy of the trust I have placed in you.

Heh, a wise move,{playername}. With loyal service, a {reg33?woman:man} in my service could become wealthy and powerful,and our enemies... Well, our enemies are as wheat before a scythe.However, to enter my service you must first renounce all worldly oaths and bonds,and swear to serve only the {s5}.
I do so swear, {s65}.
I need some time to think about this.
Are you having me on? I've no time for games, {playername}.Make up your mind and stop wasting my time.
Then it is my pleasure to welcome you to the service of my house. From this day on, {playername},you are a soldier of the {s5} with all the duties and privileges that come with it.

I charge you with rooting out and destroying the forces of our enemies wherever you may find them.Moreover, I will have special tasks for you from time to time, as may some of my other vassal lords.Serve, fight, and honour your oaths. These things will take you far, if you've a mind for promotion.May God grant us long lives and many victories to toast in my hall!

Hrm.Has your oath become burdensome, {playername}? It is unusual to request release from homage,but in respect of your fine service, I will not hold you if you truly wish to end it.Though you would be sorely missed.
Release from homage? Hmm, perhaps it would be for the best...However, {playername}, you must be sure that release is what you desire. This is not a thing done lightly.
It is something I must do, {s65}.
You are right, {s65}. My place is here.
I am pleased to hear it, {playername}.I hope you'll banish such unworthy thoughts from your mind from now on.
Then you are sure? Also, be aware that if you leave my services, you will be surrendering to me all the fiefs which you hold in my name.
Yes, {s65}.
Of course not, {s65}. I am ever your loyal vassal.
As you wish. I hereby declare your oaths to be null and void.You will no longer hold land or titles in my name, and you are released from your duties to my house.You are free, {playername}.
Thank you, sir. It was an honour to serve you..
My thanks. It feels good to be a free {reg33?woman:man} once again.
Farewell then, {playername}, and good luck go with you.
Oh, you want your companion back? I see...
{playername}, I must beg your patience, I still have need of your companion. Please return later when things have settled.
Yes, have you made any progress on it?
Indeed. I brought you {reg1} {s1} as prisoners.
Oh, indeed. I've captured a lord from {s13} for you.
Many thanks, my friend. He will serve very well for a bargain. You've done a fine work here. Please accept these {reg5} aurums for your help.
Certainly, {s65}.
It was nothing.
Give me more of a challenge next time.
Indeed. I have raised {reg1} {s13}. You can take them.
These men may well turn the tide in my plans, {playername}. I am confident you've trained them well. My thanks and my compliments to you.
Well, the lads are at your command now, sir. I am sure you will take good care of them.
Here are all the taxes from {s3}. It comes up to {reg19} aurums.
Here are the taxes from {s3}. It comes up to {reg19} aurums.
Unfortunately, a revolt broke up while I was collecting the taxes. I could only collect {reg19} aurums.

Well done, {playername}, very well done indeed! You were truly the right {reg33?woman:man} for the job. I promised you a fifth of the taxes, so that amounts to {reg21} aurums. If you give me {reg20} aurums, you may keep the difference. A good result for everyone, eh?

What?! Is this some scheme of yours, {playername}? That's less than half the taxes I'm owed! You have let them get away with murder as well as my money. What a farce! You can forget the money I promised you, I'm taking {reg20} aurums from what you collected, and you're lucky I'm leaving you a few coins for honour's sake.

God, what a bloody mess you've gotten us into, {playername}.This could turn very ugly if I do not take immediate action.I certainly hope you're not here expecting to be paid for failure.Hand over my {reg19} aurums, if you please, and end our business together.
I found {s4} hiding at {s3} and gave him his punishment.
I'm afraid he got away.

And we'll all be a lot better off without him! Thank you, {playername}, for removing this long-festering thorn from my side. 'Tis good to know you can be trusted to handle things with an appropriate level of tactfulness. A bounty I promised, and a bounty you shall have. 300 aurums and not a copper less!
Let me take the money, {s65}. Thank you.
This is blood money. I can't accept it.
Of course, {playername}. Here you are. Once again, you've my thanks for ridding me of that {s43}.

You are a {reg33?woman:man} for whom justice is its own reward, eh? As you wish it, {playername}, as you wish it. An honourable sentiment, to be true. Regardless, you've my thanks for ridding me of that {s43}.
It is a sad day when that {s43} manages to avoid the hand of justice yet again. I thought you would be able to do this, {playername}. Clearly I was wrong.
I am still working on it.
I am afraid I won't be able to do this quest.
Good. Remember, I am counting on you.
It's {reg0}.
That should be possible. Very well, we'll attack {s1}.
As it happens, {playername}, I promised {s10} that I would hire a company of mercenaries for an upcoming campaign.
I'm not interested, but thank you for the offer
Aye, this sounds good to me. I'll join {s9}.
I'm interested. Please tell me more about your offer.
Perfect. Of course you shall have to make a formal declaration of allegiance, and give your oath that you and your company will remain in service to {s9} for a period of no less than one month.
As you wish. Your enemies are my enemies.
On second thought, forget it.
That will do. You've made a wise choice, my friend. {s9} does well by its loyal fighters, you will receive many rewards for your service.
Now, I suggest you prepare for a serious campaign. Train and equip your soldiers as best you can in the meantime, and respond quickly when you are summoned for duty.
I'm very sorry to hear that. You'll find no better place than {s9}, be sure of that.

I can offer you a contract for one month. At the end of this period, it can be extended on a monthly basis. An initial sum of {reg12} aurums will be paid to you to seal the contract. After that, you'll receive wages from {s10} each week, according to the number and quality of the soldiers in your company. You still have your rights to battlefield loot and salvage, as well as any prisoners you capture. War can be very profitable at times...

Duties... There are only a few, none of them difficult. The very first thing is to declare your allegiance. An oath of loyalty to our cause. Once that's done, you shall be required to fulfill certain responsibilities. You'll participate in military campaigns, fulfill any duties given to you by your commanders, and most of all you shall attack the enemies of our kingdom wherever you might find them.
And what about my duties as a mercenary?
Can I hold on to any castles I take?
Can I fly my own banner?
How much will you pay me for my service?
Sounds good. I wish to enter your service as a mercenary.
Apologies, my sword is not for hire.

Only my loyal vassals can own lands and castles in my realm -- and all my vassals are {reg65?men:women}. I am not inclined to depart from this tradition without a very good reason. If you prove yourself in battle, you can swear an oath of homage to me and become my vassal. We may then discuss how you may obtain a castle.

Hmm... Only loyal vassals of {s10} can own lands and castles. While {s0} will sometimes accept vassalage from {reg33?women:men} who prove themselves in battle, and grant them land, I have never heard of a {s1} who gave fiefs to {reg33?women:men}. You had best discuss that issue with {s10} {reg0?herself:himself}.

Only my loyal vassals can own lands and castles in my realm. A mercenary can not be trusted with such a responsibility. However, after serving for some time, you can swear homage to me and become my vassal. Then you will be rewarded with a fief.

Only loyal vassals of {s10} can own lands and castles. You understand, a simple mercenary cannot be trusted with such responsibility. However, after serving for some time, you may earn the right to swear homage to {s10} and become {reg0?her:his} vassal. Then you would be rewarded with a fief.

Only my noble vassals have the honour of carrying their own banners. However, after some time in mercenary service, you may earn the opportunity to swear homage to me and become my vassal, gaining the right to choose a banner of your own and fight under it in battle.

Only noble vassals of {s10} have the honour of carrying their own banners. However, after some time of mercenary service, perhaps you can earn the opportunity to swear homage to {s10} and become {reg0?her:his} vassal, gaining the right to choose a banner of your own and fight under it in battle.
You still haven't finished the last job I gave you, {playername}. You should be working on that, not asking me for other things to do.
I don't have any other jobs for you right now.
A task?

My {reg33?Lady:Lord}, by the traditions of courtship, I should be offering my services to you. Unfortunately, I have little time right now, so I beg you to take this declaration of my esteem in its place.
There are some minor errands which I need completed, but it would be more appropriate to give them to one of my own {reg65?servants:men}, not to {reg0?my sworn liege:a sworn vassal of the realm}.
If you are looking for action against our foes, you may join our attack on {s4}. The enemy may come in force to oppose us, so it is good to have as many {reg33?soldiers:men} as possible.

If you are looking for action against our foes, you may try venturing out to {s4}. We have received word that a force of the {s5} is in the area, and I am going there myself. I cannot guarantee you that our enemies will be there when you arrive, of course.

If you are looking for action against our foes, you may try venturing out to {s4}. We have received word that a force of the {s5} is in the area. I am not currently headed that way, but others may be.  I cannot guarantee you that our enemies will be there when you arrive, of course.
If a worthy task presents itself, however, I may have a favor to ask of you at a later date.

Yes -- there is something you can do for us. We have heard reports that a group of {s4} have established a hideout in this area, and have been attacking travellers. If you could find their lair and destroy it, we would be very grateful.

My {s11}, {s13}, has been taken prisoner by {s14} of the {s15}. Normally, honorable nobles will grant prisoners of gentle blood the privilege of parole, and treat them as honored guests so long as they give their word that they will not attempt to escape, until such time as a ransom can be paid.  But {s14}, instead of granting {s13} parole, has consigned my {s11} to {reg3?her:his} dungeons -- no doubt in the hope that {reg3?she:he} can demand more from us.

We need you to get my {s11} out of prison. You may be able to pay a ransom -- in which case we could cover your expenses, up to 5000 aurums. If you have connections within {s24}, you may be able to use them to sneak {reg4?her:him} out. Or, you may try a more direct approach -- walk up to the gaoler, take the keys by force, and then fight your way out. Can you do this for us?
I can try.
I don't think that I can help you.
It would not have been an easy task. Perhaps we will find another way.
We are most grateful. Could I ask you how you were planning to proceed?
Did you have any other ideas which you wished to discuss?
I am thinking of breaking into the prison in {s24}, finding {s13}, and fighting my way out.
I am thinking of taking {s24} by storm.
I have done enough planning. Time to act!
May the heavens protect you.

I had discussed this idea with some of my men. One could enter {s24}, either in disguise or openly, then walk up to the prison guard and try to take the keys by force. However, getting out may be difficult. The garrison may be slow to react, but even so, you are likely to find yourself fighting a half dozen or more of the enemy at once, with limited space in which to maneuver. If you can fight your way past them, though, you can probably get out.
You may find it useful to create a distraction, to divert the attention of some of the garrison. If you have any connections in the villages near {s24}, this may be a time to put them to use.
Well, that is certainly the most direct approach.

I need to send a letter to {s13} who should be currently at {s4}. If you will be heading towards there, would you deliver it to {reg0?her:him}? The letter needs to be in {reg0?her:his} hands in 30 days.
Certainly, I intend to pass by {s4} and it would be no trouble.
I doubt I'll be seeing {s13} anytime soon, {s65}. You'd best send it with someone else.
I am no errand {reg33?girl:boy}, {reg65?my lady:sir}. Hire a courier for your trivialities.
I appreciate it, {playername}. Here's the letter, and a small sum to cover your travel expenses. Give my regards to {s13} when you see {reg0?her:him}.
Ah, all right then. Well, I am sure I will find someone else.
Hm, is this how you respond to a polite request for a small favor? A poor show, {playername}. I didn't know you would take offence.
Then you shall know better from now on.
Forgive my temper, {s65}. I'll deliver your letter.
All right. I will remember that.

Ah, love. Have you ever been in love, {playername}? I have fallen for a lady. I saw {s13} at a banquet not long ago, and have thought of little else since... I must know if she feels the same way. Will you deliver this message for me?
Certainly, I will carry your message.
I doubt I'll be seeing {s13} anytime soon, {s65}. You'd best send it with someone else.

I appreciate it, {playername}. Er, there's just one small snag. I'm not a literary man, and I suspect this type of thing is beyond me. You will have to help me write the note. Hmmm, let's see. How do you think I should start it off? I was thinking either, 'Greetings, wench,' or 'My love, my darling, I hunger for your touch'.
Greetings, wench.
My love, my darling, I hunger for your love.
Er, how about, Dear Lady, I hope this letter finds you well.
Excellent, I like it! Now, what next? ^'I could not help but notice your bustle at the ball,' 'Your fragile beauty excites my desires,' or 'I admire a woman with some meat on her bones'?
I could not help but notice your bustle at the ball.
Your fragile beauty excites my desires.
I admire a woman with some meat on her bones.

Wonderful. Truly a masterpiece. And to conclude on a high note? ^How about, 'In truth, I love you more than my own horse.' No? Well, what about, 'Your beauty dazzles me like glare of the sun on an enemy shield.' Ahhh, I like that one.
In truth, I love you more than my own horse.
Your beauty dazzles me like glare of the sun on an enemy shield.
Maybe, your noble mien evokes a subtle mystery?
I appreciate your help, {playername}. Here's the letter, and some money to cover your travel expenses. Ha ha! How can she resist?
Ah, all right then. Well, I am sure I will find someone else.

I need to deliver a letter to {s13} of {s15}, who must be at {s4} currently. If you are going towards there, would you deliver my letter to {reg0?her:him}? The letter needs to reach {reg0?her:him} in 40 days.

There is a small thing... My {s17} {s13} is due for a visit to {reg4?her:his} relatives at {s14}. The visit has been postponed several times already with all the trouble on the roads, but this time {reg4?he:she} is adamant about going. So, I want to at least make sure {reg4?she:he}'s well-guarded. I trust you well, {playername} so I would be very grateful if you could escort {reg4?her:him} to {s14} and make sure {reg4?she:he} arrives safe and sound.

A group of bandits have taken refuge in my village of {s15}. They are plundering nearby farms, and getting rich and fat stealing my taxes and feasting on my cattle.I'd like nothing better than to go out there and teach them a lesson, but I have my hands full at the moment, so I can't do anything about it.
Worry not, I can go to {s15} and deal with these scum for you.
You shall have to find help elsewhere, I am too busy.
Will you do that? Know that, I will be grateful to you. Here is some money for the expenses of your campaign. Make an example of those {s43}s.
Ah... Very well then, forget I brought it up.

No lord should have to admit this, {playername}, but I was inspecting my soldiers the other day and there are {reg0?{reg65?women:soldiers}:{reg65?soldiers:men}} here who don't know which end of a sword to hold. {s43} You are a warrior of renown, {playername}. Will you train some troops for me? I would be grateful to you.
How many men do you need?
If you can raise {reg1} {s14} and bring them to me, that will probably be enough.
Of course, {s65}. Give me {reg1} fresh recruits and I'll train them to be {s14}.
I am too busy these days to train anyone.

You've taken a weight off my shoulders, {playername}. I shall tell my sergeants to send you the recruits and attach them to your command. Also, I'll advance you some money to help with expenses. Here, this purse should do it. Thank you for your help.
Oh, of course. I had expected as much. Well, good luck to you then.

You probably know that I am the lord of the {reg9?town:village} of {s3}. However, it has been months since {s3} has delivered the taxes and rents due me as its rightful lord. Apparently the populace there has grown unruly lately and I need someone to go there and remind them of their obligations. And to . . . persuade them if they won't listen. If you go there and raise the taxes they owe me, I will grant you one-fifth of everything you collect.
A fair offer, {s65}. We have an agreement.
Forgive me, I don't have the time.

Welcome news, {playername}. I will entrust this matter to you. Remember, those {reg9?townsmen:peasants} are foxy beasts, they will make every excuse not to pay me my rightful incomes. Do not let them fool you.
Oh, yes. Well, good luck to you then.

I have something you could help with, an issue with the lawless villain known as {s4}.  He murdered one of my men and has been on the run from his judgment ever since. I can't let him get away with avoiding justice, so I've put a bounty of 300 aurums on his head. Friends of the murdered man reckon that this assassin may have taken refuge with his kinsmen at {s3}. You might be able to hunt him down and give him what he deserves, and claim the bounty for yourself.
Then I will hunt him down and execute the law.
I am too busy to go after him at the moment.

That's excellent, {playername}. I will be grateful to you and so will the family of the man he murdered. And of course the bounty on his head will be yours if you can get him. Well, good hunting to you.
As you wish, {playername}.I suppose there are plenty of bounty hunters around to get the job done . . .

The wretched truth is that I owe a considerable sum of money to one of the merchants here in {s3}. I've no intention of paying it back, of course, but that loud-mouthed fool is making a terrible fuss about it. He even had the audacity to come and threaten me -- me! -- with a letter of complaint to the trade guilds and bankers. Why, he'd ruin my good reputation! So I need a {reg33?woman:man} I can trust, someone who will guarantee the man's silence. For good.
Worry not, he shan't breathe a word.
I'm no common murderer, sir. Find someone else for your dirty job.

Very good. I trust in your skill and discretion, {playername}. Do not disappoint me. Go now and wait for my word, I'll send you a message telling when and where you can catch the merchant. Dispose of him for me and I shall reward you generously.

I have a sensitive matter which needs tending to, {playername}, and no trustworthy retainers to take care of it. The fact is that I have a spy in {s13} to keep an eye on things for me, and report anything that might warrant my attention. Every week I send someone to collect the spy's reports and bring them back to me. The job's yours if you wish it.
I don't mind a bit of skullduggery. Count me in.
I must decline. This cloak-and-dagger work isn't fit for me.
Excellent! Make your way to {s13} as soon as you can, the spy will be waiting.
{s13} is heavily defended. How can I get close without being noticed?

You shall have to use stealth. Take care to avoid enemy strongholds, villages and patrols, and don't bring too many men with you. If you fail to sneak in the first time, give it a while for the garrison to lower its guard again, or you may have a difficult time infiltrating the town.
How will I recognise the spy?

Once you get to {s13} you must talk to the locals, the spy will be one of them. If you think you've found the spy, say the phrase '{s11}' The spy will respond with the phrase '{s12}' Thus you will know the other, and {reg7?she:he} will give you any information {reg7?she:he}'s gathered in my service.
Will I be paid?
Of course, I have plenty of silver in my coffers for loyal {reg33?women:men} like you. Do well by me, {playername}, and you'll rise high.
I know what to do. Farewell, my lord.
Good luck, {playername}. Remember, the secret phrase is '{s11}' The counterphrase is '{s12}' Bring any reports back to me, and I'll compensate you for your trouble.
As you wish, {playername}, but I strongly advise you to forget anything I told you about any spies. They do not exist, have never existed, and no one will ever find them. Remember that.

This peace with {s13} ill suits me, {playername}. We've let those swine have their way for far too long. Now they get stronger with each passing and their arrogance knows no bounds. I say, we must wage war on them before it's too late! Unfortunately, some of the bleeding hearts among our realm's lords are blocking a possible declaration of war. Witless cowards with no stomach for blood.
You are right, {s65}, but what can we do?
I disagree, sir. It is better that there be peace.

Ah, 'tis good to hear someone who understands! As a matter of fact, there is something we can do, {playername}. A little bit of provocation... If one of our war parties managed to enter their territory and pillage one of their caravans, or raided one of their villages, and perhaps left behind a little token or two of the {s14}, they would have ample cause to declare war on us. And then, well, even the cowards among us must rise to defend themselves. So what do you say? Are you interested?
An excellent plan. Count me in.
Why don't you do that yourself?

Well, {playername}, some of the lords in our kingdom won't like the idea of someone inciting a war without their consent. They are already looking for an excuse to get at me, and if I did this they could make me pay for it dearly. You, on the other hand, are young and well-liked and daring, so you might just get away with it. And of course I will back you up and defend your actions against your opponents. All in all, a few lords might be upset at your endeavour, but I am sure you won't be bothered with that.
That seems reasonable. I am willing to do this.
I don't like this. Find yourself someone else to take the blame for your schemes.
Very good! A raid on a caravan, or, if you can't manage that, an attack on one of their villages, should do the trick. Now, good luck and good hunting. Go set the borders aflame!
Ah, you think so? But how long will your precious peace last? Not long, believe me.
Hm. As you wish, {playername}. I thought you had some fire in you, but it seems I was wrong.

Well, some of the serfs working my fields in {s4} have run away. The ungrateful swine, I let them plough my fields and rent my cottages, and this is how they repay me! From what I've been hearing, they're running to {s3} as fast as they can, and have split up into three groups to try and avoid capture. I want you to capture all three groups and fetch them back to {s4} by whatever means necessary. I should really have them hanged for attempting to escape, but we need hands for the upcoming harvest, so I'll let them go off this time with a good beating.

I have good information that a man in this very town is actually an enemy spy. He should be seized and hanged for his impudence, but we also believe that very soon he will leave town to meet with his master, the man to whom the spy feeds all his little whispers. The spy himself is of little import, but the master is a dangerous man, and could tell us a great deal if we could only get our hands on him...

I want you to wait here until the spy leaves town. Then you must follow him, stealthily, to the meeting place. You must take absolute care not to be seen by the spy on your way, else he may suspect foul play and turn back. When the master appears, you must ambush and arrest them and bring the pair back to me. Alive, if you please.
I'll do it, {s65}.
No, this skulking is not for me.
Good, I'm sure you'll do a fine job of it. One of my men will point the spy out to you when he leaves, so you will know the man to follow. Remember, I want them both, and I want them alive.
A shame. Well, carry on as you were, {playername}...

There is a difficult job I need done, {playername}, and you may be the {reg33?woman:man} who can carry it off. I need someone to capture one of the noble lords of {s13} and bring him to me. Afterwards, I'll be able to exchange him in return for a relative of mine held by {s13}. It is a simple enough job, but whomever you choose will be guarded by an elite band of personal retainers. Are you up for a fight?
Consider it done, {s65}.
I must refuse, {s65}. I am not a kidnapper.
I like your spirit! Go and bring me one of our enemies, and I'll toast your name in my hall when you return! And reward you for your efforts, of course...
Clearly you lack the mettle I had thought you possessed. Very well, {playername}, I will find someone else.

Hmm. I guess you got on the wrong side of somebody. Very well, who do you want to restore your relation with?
Never mind. I get along with everyone well enough.
Well I can try to help you there. I am sure a few expensive gifts will make {s10} look at you more favorably.

You can improve your relation with {s10} by sending {reg4?her:him} a gift worth {reg10} aurums. But if you can afford spending {reg11} aurums on the gift, it would make a good impression on {reg4?her:him}. And if you can go up to {reg12} aurums, that would really help smooth things out.
I think a gift of {reg10} aurums will do.
Maybe I can afford {reg11} aurums.
In that case, I am ready to spend {reg12} aurums.
I don't think I can afford a gift at the moment.
Excellent. Then I'll choose an appropriate gift for you and send it to {s10} with your compliments. I am sure {reg4?she:he} will appreciate the gesture.
Thank you for your help, madame.
I am afraid, I can't be of much help in that case, {playername}. I am sorry.
I must beg my leave.
I still don't see why I should accept what you're asking of me.
Then I'll make it worth your while. ({reg8} aurums)
Please, do it for the sake of our friendship. (-{reg9} to relation)
Let me try and convince you. (Persuasion)
Never mind.
Mmm, a generous gift to my coffers would certainly help matters... {reg8} aurums should do it. If you agree, then I'll go with your suggestion.
I'm afraid my finances will not allow for such a gift.
Very well, please accept these {reg8} aurums as a token of my gratitude.
Let me think about this some more.
Ah. In that case, there is little I can do, unless you have some further argument to make.
My dear {playername}, your generous gift has led me to reconsider what you ask, and I have come to appreciate the wisdom of your proposal.
You've done well by me in the past, {playername}, and for that I will go along with your request, but know that I do not like you using our relationship this way.
I am sorry, my friend, but I need your help in this.
If it will not please you, then I'll try something else.
All right then, {playername}, I will accept this for your sake. But remember, you owe me for this.
I don't think I owe you such a favor {playername}. I see no reason to accept this for you.
Is this a joke? You've some nerve asking me for favours, {playername}, and let me assure you you'll get none.
Very well. Make your case.
[Attempt to persuade]
Wait, perhaps there is another way to convince you.
By God's grace, {playername}! Haven't we talked enough already? I am tired of listening to you, and I do not want to hear any more of it right now.
All right, all right. You have persuaded me to it. I'll go ahead with what you suggest.
You've a point, {playername}, I'll admit that much. However I am not yet convinced I should do as you bid.
Enough, {playername}. You've a lot of arguments, but I find none of them truly convincing. I stand by what I said before.
Truthfully, {playername}, I fail to see the virtue of your reasoning. What you ask for makes even less sense now than it did before.
I must congratulate you on your victory, my {reg33?lady:lord}. Welcome to {s1}. We, the housekeepers of this castle, are at your service.
Are you the seneschal?

Indeed I am, my {reg33?lady:lord}. I have always served the masters of {s1} to the best of my ability, whichever side they might be on. Thus you may count on my utmost loyalty for as long as you are the {reg33?lady:lord} of this place. Now, do you intend to keep me on as the seneschal? I promise you will not be disappointed.
Very well, you may keep your post for the time being.
You can stay, but I shall be keeping a close watch on you.
Thank you, my {reg33?lady:lord}. If you do not mind my impudence, may I inquire as to what you wish to do with the castle?
I will sell it to another lord.
I intend to claim it for myself.
I haven't given it much thought. What are my options?

According to our laws and traditions, you can do one of several things. First, you could station a garrison here to protect the castle from any immediate counterattacks, then request an audience with some wealthy lord and ask him to make you an offer. It would be worth a tidy sum, believe you me. If you do not wish to sell, then you will have to find yourself a liege lord and protector who would accept homage from you. Without a royal investiture and an army at your back, you would have a difficult time holding on to the castle. Both you and {s1} would become great big targets for any man with a few soldiers and a scrap of ambition.
What do you mean, a liege lord and protector? I won this place by my own hand, I don't need anyone else!

Of course you don't, my {reg33?lady:lord}. However, no lord in the land will recognize your claim to the castle unless it is verified by royal decree. They would call {s1} an outlaw stronghold and take it from you at the earliest opportunity. Surely not even you could stand against a whole army.
Hmm. I'll give it some thought.

I am very pleased to hear it, my {reg33?lady:lord}. I am only trying to serve you to the best of my ability. Now, if at any time you find you have further need of me, I will be in the great hall arranging a smooth handover of the castle to your forces.
Good day, {reg33?madam:sir}. I do not believe I've seen you here before. Let me extend my welcome to you as the seneschal of {s1}.
A pleasure to meet you, {s65}.
How can I help you?
What exactly do you do here?

Ah, a seneschal's duties are many, good {reg33?woman:sire}. For example, I collect the rents from my lord's estates, I manage the castle's storerooms, I deal with the local peasantry, I take care of castle staff, I arrange supplies for the garrison... All mundane matters on this fief are my responsibility, on behalf of my lord. Everything except commanding the soldiers themselves.
Good day, {reg33?madam:sir}.
Anything else?
I would like to ask you a question...
I wish to know more about someone...
Perhaps I may be able to help. Whom did you have in mind?
Never mind.
I must take my leave of you now. Farewell.
I'll do what I can to help, of course. What did you wish to ask?
Perhaps you know where to find someone...
Well, a man in my position does hear a lot of things. Of whom were you thinking?
Never mind.
There! I can see the walls of {s3} in the distance. We've made it safely. Here, take this purse of {reg3} aurums, as I promised. I hope we can travel together again someday.
We've made it this far... Is everything clear up ahead?
There might be bandits nearby. Stay close.
Trust me, {playername}, we're already staying as close to you as we can. Lead the way.
No sign of trouble, we can breathe easy.
I'll breathe easy when we reach {s1} and not a moment sooner. Let's keep moving.
What do you want? We paid our toll to you less than three days ago.
Hail, friend.
What do you want? We are but simple merchants, we've no quarrel with you, so leave us alone.
Be warned, knave! This caravan is under the protection of {s9}. Step out of our way or you will face his fury!
Yes? What do you want?
Anything else?
You are trespassing in the territory of the {s17}. I am confiscating this caravan and all its goods!
What? What nonsense is this? We are at peace with the {s17}, and are free to cross its lands!
We'll see about that! Defend yourselves!
Hmm. Maybe this was all a misunderstanding. Farewell.
I have an offer for you.
What is it?
I can escort you to your destination for a price.
Nothing. Forget it
I am hunting a group of bandits with the following description... Have you seen them?
Tell me about your journey
We are coming from {s11} and heading to {s12}.{s14}
I demand something from you!
What do you want?
There is a toll for free passage here!
Please, I don't want any trouble. I can give you {reg6} aurums, just let us go.
I don't want any trouble. I can give you {reg6} aurums if you'll let us go.
Agreed, hand it over and you may go in peace.
Very well then. Here's {reg6} aurums.
I changed my mind, I can't take your money.
No, I want everything you have! [Attack]
Hand over your gold and valuables now!
Nothing. Forget it.
Are you robbing us?{s11}
Robbing you? No, no! It was a joke.
God, don't joke about that, {reg33?lass:lad}. For a moment I thought we were in real trouble.
Of course I'm robbing you. Now hand over your goods.
Damn you, you won't get anything from us without a fight!
These roads are dangerous indeed. One can never have enough protection.
An escort? We're almost there already! Thank you for the offer, though.
We are heading to {s1}. I will pay you {reg2} aurums if you escort us there.
Agreed.
I want you to stay close to us along the way. We'll need your help if we get ambushed by bandits.
Don't worry, you can trust me.
Good. Come and collect your money when we're within sight of {s1}. For now, let's just get underway.
Forget it.
Perhaps another time, then.
Not so fast. First, hand over all your goods and money.
Never. It is our duty to protect these goods. You shall have to fight us, brigand!
[Leave]
Good day, {s0}. Will you be visiting the prison?
Yes. Unlock the door.
No, not now.
Yes? What do you want?
Who is imprisoned here?
I want to speak with a prisoner.
I want to release a prisoner.
Alright, which prisoner shall I set free?
No one.
As you wish, I will release {s10} of {s11}.
Very well.
No, I changed my mind.
Currently, {s50} {reg1?are:is} imprisoned here.{s49}
Of course, {reg33?madam:sir}. Go in.
You need to get permission from the lord to talk to prisoners.
There is nobody inside, therefore you can freely go inside and look around.
All right then. I'll take a look at the prison.
I have more important business to do.
All right then. I'll try that.
Come on now. I thought you were the boss here.
He-heh. You got that right. Still, I can't let you into the prison.
All right then. I'll leave now.
I found a purse with 100 aurums a few paces away. I reckon it belongs to you.

Ah! I was looking for this all day. How good of you to bring it back {reg33?madam:sir}. Well, now that I know what an honest {reg33?lady:man} you are, there can be no harm in letting you inside for a look. Go in.... Just so you know, though -- I'll be hanging onto the keys, in case you were thinking about undoing anyone's chains.
Give me the keys to the cells -- now!
Help! Help! Prison break!
Never mind.
Your orders, {reg33?Lady:Lord}?
Open the door. I'll go in.
Never mind.
Get out of my sight, beggar! You stink!
Get lost before I lose my temper you vile beggar!
I want to enter the hall and speak to the lord.
[Leave]
Are you out of your mind, {reg33?woman:man}? Beggars are not allowed into the hall. Now get lost or I'll beat you bloody.
What do you want?
I want to enter the hall and speak to the lord.
Never mind.
I'm afraid there is a feast in progress, and you are not invited.
You can go in after leaving your weapons with me. No one is allowed to carry arms into the lord's hall.
Here, take my arms. I'll go in.
No, I give my arms to no one.
Then you can't go in.
What do you want?
Yes?
We need shelter for the night. Will you let us in?
I want to speak with the lord of the castle.
I want to speak with someone in the castle.
[Leave]
Wait here. {s2} will see you.
My lord is not here now.
Who is that?
Never mind.
Wait there. I'll send {reg0?her:him} your request.
I'm waiting...
All right. {s2} will talk to you now.
{s2} says {reg0?she:he} will not see you. Begone now.
My lord {s2} will be happy to see you {reg33?madam:sir}. Come on in. I am opening the gates for you.
My lord {s2} is not in the castle now. But I think he would approve of you taking shelter here. Come on in. I am opening the gates for you.
Come on in. I am opening the gates for you.
Come on in. But make sure your men behave sensibly within the walls. My lord {s2} does not want trouble here.
My lord {s2} does not want you here. Begone now.
You have come just in time. Let us join our forces now and teach our enemy a lesson.
You are making a big mistake by fighting against us.
I don't think we have met properly my friend. You just saved my life out there, and I still don't know your name...
Your help was most welcome stranger. My name is {s1}. Can I learn yours?
Thanks for your help, stranger. We haven't met properly yet, have we? What is your name?
My name is {playername}.
Well met indeed {playername}. My name is {s1} and I am forever in your debt. If there is ever anything I can help you with, just let me know...
Well met {playername}. I am in your debt for what you just did. I hope one day I will find a way to repay it.
Well met {playername}. I am {s1}. Thanks for your help and I hope we meet again.
Again you save our necks, {playername}! Truly, you are the best of friends. {s43}
You arrived just in the nick of time! {playername}. You have my deepest thanks! {s43}
You turned up just in time, {playername}. I will not forget your help. {s43}
Good to see you here, {playername}. {s43}
Thank you for your help {reg33?madam:sir}. You saved {reg1?our lives:my life} out there.
Thank you for your help {reg33?madam:sir}. Things didn't look very well for us but then you came up and everything changed.
Thank you for your help, {reg33?madam:sir}. It was fortunate to have you nearby.
Oh {reg33?madam:sir}. Thank you so much for rescuing me. Will you take me to my family now?
I am in your debt for freeing me friend.
You're not going anywhere. You'll be my prisoner now!
Alas. Will my luck never change?
You're free to go, {s65}.
Thank you, good {reg33?lady:sir}. I never forget someone who's done me a good turn.
Would you like to join me?
All right I will join you.
No, I want to go on my own.
Who are you, if I may ask?
Good sir, I am a Tolranian veteran. I am a direct descendant of Otto Waveshore, the man who led the first Tolranians onto Perisno. Do you our history?
No. I would like to know more.

Of course. We, the Tolranians, were once a part of the Old Hakkon Empire from an island far from here. The Hakkon ruler was a tyrant, and a small group of men escaped using boats. It was a miracle they survived, and part of the reason was because of my ancestor, Otto Waveshore, who was a great captain.
Very interesting. I guess I will leave now.
Yes, I am familiar with it. It was a nice talk.
Hello again. What is it this time?
Hello again. What is it this time?
I wwould like to know about your past, if you are willing to share.
I am a direct descendant of Otto Waveshore, the captain who led a small group of rebels from the Hakkon Island to Perisno, where we could live a new life.
Nevermind.
Who are you?
Why, I am the royal scribe of Tolrania, of course. I chronicle the events and history of our great nation.
That's nice. Goodbye.
Could you tell me more about the history of Tolrania?
Of course! What would you like to know about?
King Torlian.

King Torlian was the son of King Calarin, who was considered to be one our wisest and most benevolent monarchs of all time. When Calarin died at the age of seventy eight, he ascended upon the throne. He is not a bad ruler, but is always under pressure of his nobles telling him to live up to his father's name.

Personally I think he has, in more ways than one. Take the Battle of Haelinfields, for example. King Torlian led the army himself against a superior Elintoran army. Torlian knew that they had many archers, so he lined all his Kingsmen with shields up and ordered them to lock shields the Volheere way. They advanced, under a hail of arrows. It is said that King Torlian himself was at the front.

While the foolish Elves wasted their arrows on our shields, the Horse Archers stealthily encircled the enemy army and soon the Elves were the ones being shot. Then, Torlian ordered his mounted Kingsmen Vanguard to advance and after a few hours of scattered fighting, the Elves were beaten. We slaughtered over six thousand elves that day, and lost only five hundred of our own. T'was a great victory!
That was an interesting talk. Goodbye.
Nevermind.
You are not a lord of Tolrania. Don't think that I will tell any of our secrets!
Hello again. What do you need from this humble scribe?
I would like to know of some history of Tolrania.
Nothing. Sorry for disturbing you.
Who are you?

I am Lord Halgar Malin, a minor noble of Tolrania. I participated in the War of the Woods in the year 320. We fought against the Elintoran rats and routed them in a great battle. King Torlian himself led our army. I still bear the scars from that battle, and proudly too.

The Elintoran fools were so busy concentrating on our kingsmen that they did not notice as our horse archers surrounded and completely devastated their army. Of course, once the Kingsmen got into the melee, it was all over.
Very interesting! Goodbye.
Who are you again?
Hello there, traveller.
Hello.
Have you found the republic in your journey so far?
A what?
A republic. A system of government where the ruler is...ahh, never mind. Here I go again.
Tell me more.

I was hoping you'd tell me! I'm a foreigner to these lands, a historian from the Klyrintin Empire. One day I came across the news that some people had broken away from the empire and formed a 'republic' in this land. I consulted the scripts about this 'republic' and concluded that it was a fairer system of government for the people. I left my old life behind in search of this republic, but haven't found it so far. Have you seen it?
I'll let you know if I hear anything.
Goodbye crazy man.
Uhh, I have to be somewhere else.
Hello. Have you found the republic yet? I am a foreigner, from the Klyrintin Empire, with a very oppresive government. I came here to search for the ideas of a republic after reading some scripts.
No... I need to be going. Goodbye.
What's new?

Oh, you are that guy! Remus wanted me to tell you that during a recent tournament he heard rumors that a large group of Sut giants grew interested in the path of the Wolf, and they seek to join those Wolf Knights. Remus left for the town of Sut and he's looking for help.
I don't want no business with the Wolf Knights!
Alright, I'll find him then.
Hello, {playername}! It's good to see you.
I failed the quest.
Hello, {playername}! It's good to see you.
Group Sut Giant Interested in the Path of the Wolf is destroyed.
Good work.  That's your reward. But be careful. People over there are watching you. And I don't think their intentions are good.

Hello, {playername}! It's good to see you. I've learned that many giants here became interested in the path of the Wolf. One quite agressive group already went on their way to find the Wolf Knights. You need to stop them while I'm trying to calm down the giants that still stay in the town.
I don't want to mess with Wolf Knights or their followers.
Sure, I'll deal with them.
Greetings, traveler. Care for a drink?
Sure. Thank you.

There you go. Don't worry about paying me or anything - it's on me. The innkeep here doesn't charge me anything after I helped them out with a gambling debt. Then again, they don't charge for things within reason of course... but still. They're generous souls. A far cry from the people I used to associate with.
What sort of people?
The Wolf Knights. My story with them is a long one, but I'm willing to share if you're willing to listen.
Absolutely. Please tell me.
Where to begin...

I am the younger of two brothers. We lived in a small village nestled amongst the foothills of the Reich's mountains. It was a fairly isolated place that saw the older men mindlessly driving away at their chores while the younger men nurtured dreams of the world that lay beyond the village. Lupus, my older brother, was in charge of guarding the village animals from the wolves that lived not far away. Every night he would stand vigil over our meager livestock, with the howling of the wolves to help keep him awake.

Strangely, the wolves never attacked. They would prowl in the darkness, barely visible by the light of Lupus' torch, but they never approached. My brother complained to our village elder, Garrell, that his position was useless. Elder Garrell wouldn't have any of that. 'Nonsense!' he would say, and Lupus would spend the next few nights without provisions.

Eventually, my brother came to me one day all worked up over something. He kept flexing his fingers, eyes wide and shoulders shaking. From fear, anxiety, or exhilaration, I couldn't tell. One of the wolves approached him the other night, he told me. Spoke to him in the human tongue. Asked him to follow it.
Sounds like he had just fallen asleep or something.

That's what I thought too. Yet he vehemently denied that suggestion, insisting that the wolf had spoken to him. 'Okay then,' I said. I asked him what the wolf had shown him. He wouldn't tell me. He just shook his head and ran off to the village well for water. Then the next day came. Lupus and another lad got into a heated argument that drew the whole village around. The argument threatened to get violent when Lupus's hands blurred faster than our eyes could follow... and smashed the man's head into bloody pieces.
That couldn't be good...

It certainly wasn't. We stood there in stunned silence, too afraid to say or do anything, while Lupus stared at his bloody hands. Elder Garrell was the first to gather his senses about him. He proclaimed Lupus exiled from the village the moment he did.
Why not just hang him?

I imagine it had something to do with my brother's apparent super strength - getting him in the gallows would've been a hard task, looking back on things. Despite what he did, I couldn't stand the thought of my brother travelling alone. I asked Elder Garrell if I could leave with Lupus. He nodded, but I think his mind was still trying to process what had happened. We left the village at dawn, with no farewells from the people we grew up with. As we trudged away, Lupus stopped me and laid his hand upon my forehead. 'Blessings upon you, brother,' he said. And what happened next...was... I don't know how to describe it.

Imagine the thrill of adrenaline, the bloodlust of battle. Now take that energy, and multiply it a hundred fold. That energy coursed through my    veins, leaving me paralyzed... But when I regained my senses, I felt reborn. I felt strong. Powerful. Able to take on the world, a million to one. It was strange. After his blessing, I could lift boulders with one hand, and run faster than deer... We began our lives anew. At first we traveled from city to city, fighting in the arenas. Our strength was unmatched - Lupus could shatter shields with a flick of his wrist. I would dart around my opponents and knock them to the ground before they knew what was happening.
Surely you are joking.
This is enough. At first I believed your tale, but now I think it is pure fantasy. Good day.

I do not jest. I could knock you to the ground and be out of the city before you could get back on your feet. But moving on... We won fight after fight, tournament after tournament. Prize money came to us, and we eventually bought our own armor, weapons, horses even. Notoriety came too, and soon we had a small following. Lupus had an idea. Why not go bigger, beyond the arena? Become mercenaries, he said, and see more of what the world has to offer. We recruited from our following of admiring fighters. And so the Wolf Knights were born.
I am afraid I have not the time for any more today. Perhaps another time.
Yes, I understand. Farewell, traveler. I shall finish my tale the next time we meet, if you will.
Impossible. I'm not going to listen to your story any longer, fool man. Goodbye and good day.
Forgive me, but I don't have the time.
No thanks. I've got things to attent to.
Hello, traveler. We meet again.
Can you finish your story?
Can you repeat the first part of your story?
Goodbye. Maybe next time we shall meet again.

Roaming through the misty forests of the Elintoran Nation, traversing the dry deserts of Drahara, meeting Lords and Ladies for employment. It was amazing. And exhilirating. We won battle after battle, always fulfilling whatever tasks the lords of Perisno set upon us. More soldiers, experienced veterans, joined us. The feeling of fabulous wealth and glory... Ah, there are no words to describe it. Lupus even found an old abandoned fort. We used it as a base of operations, and with our newfound wealth we had turned it into a fortress to rival that of any lord's...
It all sounds too good...

Of course it was. Life does not ride upon a single wave of euphoria. My brother was changing. I didn't notice it, nor did my other brothers, as we ourselves were changing as well. We were getting more ruthless. Brutal. Merciless. Bloodlust became our one true companion in battle, blind rage consuming us as we tore down our enemies. Lupus was getting more ideas. 'These so called lords are weak,' he told us one night. 'They are foolish, ever quarrelsome, unfit to hold their titles! They cater to the feeble, leech off the strong!''My brothers, Perisno is ripe for the taking!' he yelled.

'Let me cast down the pretenders that lounge in their thrones,' said he. 'And let us show them the true meaning of power!' We all cheered him on, our adrenaline going into overdrive. The idea that we could hold our own kingdom, or even conquer all of Perisno? Anything seemed possible to us.
So, what happened?.

Well, nothing happened to the Wolf Knights per se. It's what happened to me.One night came when we raided a Tolranian caravan in the woods outside of Vinica. They never knew we were coming. We charged out of the darkness, our lances lowered, swords swinging, their blood splashing... There was a caravan guard. Couldn't have been any older than me or Lupus when we left our home. I killed his horse while he attempted to flee, sending him to the ground, leaving him trapped under the weight of his dead companion. 'Mercy,' he begged, with my sword at his throat. He was a grown man, fresh into adulthood... and bawling his eyes out like a small child, sobbing into the night.

I did nothing. In the midst of the clashing swords and dying screams, his face stood out above all else. I didn't know what was happening. The bloodlust was fading, and I was staring at the red and pink gore splashed across my greaves...Lupus came in bloodied armor on his black mare, saw what was happening, and plunged his sword into the guard's chest. He twisted the blade, and drew out the man's screams before he choked on his own blood. And my brother simply glared at me, and rode off. Later that night, he drew me away from the camp. I thought he wanted to reprimand me, scold me for my hesitation. 'I can't do this anymore,' I heard myself saying.

The most peculiar sensation overcame me, and suddenly I was on the ground, staring at a sword embedded in my gut. My own brother had stabbed me. 'You are weak,' I heard Lupus say. 'The pack cannot function with a lone wolf in its midst. Face death bravely, Remus.' And he left. The last I ever saw of him... his silhouette blocking out the stars above. The night was getting darker, the stars dimmer. I passed out from the wound, and might have died were it not for a passing elven lord. I owe Archduke Methenor my life. Had his party not come investigating what had happened, I would surely have died, isolated and alone. He recognized my face from seeing it in the arenas, and took me into his castle to heal me.
So, what did you do then?

It took months, but I was able to recover thanks to him. I inquired about the raiding party my brother and I had led, without inferring I helped organize it, and discovered that they had left before Methenor came. I felt different once I had become healed, more determined and less wild. I turned down Methenor's suggestion that I swear homage to Queen Arwen, thanked him by swearing a life debt to him, and left for the Reich. I eventually found the old village I grew up in... in burned ruins. Everyone dead and gone. Bandits, apparently. Perhaps it was Lupus.

I tried finding the fortress we had set up for the Wolf Knights. I couldn't find it, because I couldn't remember where it was... It's strange. You'd think I would remember where it would be...Anyways, I now spend my days travelling the land, looking for hints of Lupus' whereabouts. Perisno needs to know the threat he poses. His world is one where only the strong will thrive, while the rest shall be cast down.
That was quite the tale... thank you for sharing it.
No, thank you for listening. I've never told my tale in its entirety before. Beware the wolves, friend. And remember... the wolf can survive without the pack.
I shall indeed beware them ...

Wait! I almost forgot! Could you visit Archduke Methenor sometime, and tell him: 'I, Remus, still search for it. I am sorry.'? Please accept this as a token of my gratitude for listening as well. Anyone who is forced to endure my dreary tale should at least get some type of reward.
Goodbye. I hope I will see you again sometime.
Of course. Thank you again for that story.
Remus told me to say that he is sorry and he still searches for it.
What? How do you know Remus? That lad is still alive?
Yes. I met him in a tavern and he told me to convene the message to you. He told me his entire story. It was saddening.
Indeed. That lad has had a miserable past. I hope he is well ... (the lord's eyes grow distant). Thank you for giving me this. Take this as a token of my gratitude. Farewell.
Those bastards, HIC... They knew all about it HIC... Cowards, HIC.
Listen my good man, I think you've had enough to drink today.
Just go away like everyone else HIC... Just leave me alone... HIC
Alright... Alright... Just give me that *you take his drink*. Now, let's talk. What's the story behind this drink?
(You spend some time with the man as he sobs quietly into his hands. He eventually becomes -somewhat- sober.)

You are still here? Well... alright. If it returns me to my drinking sooner, why not. Years ago, there was a great realm going from the mountains to the south, all the way to the Elintoran forest in the east. The name of this place was the Kingdom of Randor. The Kingdom's might was feared by everyone in Perisno. Even the elves showed us respect. But none of that mattered. When Randor was at it's strongest, the invaders came. They claimed to have fled from a far distant land. A land where disease, war and famine did rot the very essence of the land, the people.

They claimed they weren't like them, and only desired peace... but behind our backs, they plotted with the other kingdoms. Together, they formed an alliance against us. The King of Randor couldn't believe it. They had deceived him, they had taken his hospitality and tossed it to the ground like garbage. The alliance took the King by surprise and..
Wait wait wait. What does this have to do with your drinking problem?

If someone didn't interrupt me, I would have gotten to that point sooner... So as I was saying, the alliance took the King by surprise. Before he could even send out his orders, the alliance attacked. In no time at all, they had taken half of his country. Together, they formed a coalition army and marched on the capital of the Kindgom of Randor. The Great city of Beler, the last stronghold of Randor. The siege went on for months. By the time the coalition army entered the city, many of it's inhabitants had already died from hunger, or by their own hands fearing the horrors of being conquered.

The King and his family were left alone in the citadel protected by the last of the Royal guard. That is when the worst tragedy struck, one of the most cruel and vicious acts of the war. Lundrill, captain of the Royal guard, betrayed the King. He butchered the King's family, and gave their heads along with the captured King to the leaders of the coalition army. All of this, in exchange for the title and rights of the Lord of Beren.

What he didn't know was that the coalition leaders were already planning on betraying him. They did just that when they razed the city to the ground, and burned the citadel with the remnants of the Royal guard alive inside, killing off the last of the Randorians...
Are you sure you are sober? I've never heard of Randor or anyone you've mentioned... anyway, continue on. What does all of this have to do with you?

Don't you get it, they wiped out an entire civilization! They are dangerous, they are liars, they are thieves! They betrayed me and left me to wander the world as punishment for thinking I could rule something they wanted to rule themselves.
Look sir, I'll ask you agai... OH wait, so you were the King of Randor?
The man looks sadly at the player, nodding his head up and down. Yes, I was... But that's a mistake I'll never make again.
Okay... I'll leave you to your drinking then.
Sounds like a load of grown up Falki dung.
Why you... you... you little runt! I am the King! I'll crush you!
(After your previous talk with the man, he does not want to look at you any longer. He stares sadly at his drink, thinking of the days of old, when he was the ruler of Randor.)

I told you!! DOOOOM! RUN!! THE ZANN ARE HERE! IN PERISNO!! They will conquer all, their armies will shake the earch and their Imperial Warriors, with armor as black as midnight, will conquer the world. DOOOM!
How... how could it be! The Zann have been defeated. Doomsday is over. We have survived!
DOOOM! We are ALL RUINED!!!!.
Do you feel alright good man?
They are coming... He is coming... They, he will rule over all of us. He, they will make us all slaves, light will be no more. They are coming... He is coming...
Who's they? Who's he? What are rambling on about?

They live over the infinite waves, across a continent so far and vast. They will come, he will lead them. Revenge, power, a new empire will they come for. Over our dead bodies, our skulls, our children will they rule. For he, they are coming... Run we must, for all hope his lost. The final hour is upon us, we must ready for when they, he arrives. Flee we must... Flee...
Who's coming, and how can we defend ourselves? Explain yourself. What do you mean by final hour?

Deadly they are, a massive army he will bring. Thousands will die, we must run for all hope is lost. DOOMSDAY IS UPON US. The GODS have forsaken us... RUN, HIDE, FLEE those are our only chances. The others are already coming, they will follow them here. They will never stop, he won't let them. They will chase the others until they slaughter all of them, and then they will come for us.
This is your last chance mad-man. WHO ARE THEY? What do you mean by doomsday?

The ZANN are coming. The invincible army is crossing the Ocean, they are headed to Perisno. Unstoppable they are, thousands they will bring, thousands more await to cross aswell. We are doomed, we are dead, we stand no chance...
(You leave the Mad-man talking to himself. Invincible army, phuahaha what a looney! Crossing the Ocean with an army. He must be really mad.)
DOOM! DOOMSDAY is COMING!! THE ZANN, they are COMING!! RUN, the gods have FORSAKEN US!
What is the story behind your household troops, the Draharan Ghareebians?.

You wish to ask about my pride, my Draharan Ghareebians? Very well. The Draharan Ghareebians are a mix between Western, or 'Ghareebian' culture. They are like the dragoners of the Reich, except they are more nimble and trained by Draharans!
Very interesting.
Anything else?
Why, I am the royal scribe of the Elvarie, of course. I chronicle the events and history of our great nation.
Could you tell me more about the history of the Elintoran Nation?
Of course! What would you like to know about?
Queen Arlina.

Ah. You wish to know about the queen. Well, what can I say? She is a great ruler, although many find her rash and too hotheaded. She was always like that, even as a child. She has led our nation well, but many feel that she shoul not rule because of her age. She is very young and her critics say that she is inexperienced.

Personally, I like the way she rules and I think that there is a bright future for the Elvarie under her leadership. She has proved herself to be very worthy so far. Take her campaign against the Demon Worshippers, for example.

When Arlina took the throne, the Demon Worshippers infested our land like vermin. She led her army personally against the Demon Worhsippers and, one by one destroyed every Demo Worshipper lair she could find. She also strengthened greatly the patrols around the kingdom and we have not had an issue with the Demon Worshippers for a long time.
That was an interesting talk. Goodbye.
Nevermind.
You are not a lord of the Elintoran Nation. Don't think that I will tell any of our secrets!
I would like to know some history of the Elintoran Nation.
I am a Dragon Anrufer, or caller. I serve only the Dragon Gods and it was my responsibility to 'call' dragons to us.
What do you mean, 'was'?

There are no dragons in this land, unlike where we come from. When we landed on this continent, we thought it would provide more breeding spots and possibly dragon brethren. However, I have called for a long time and there are no Perisno dragons that have responded. I will continue trying, though, and so will all who share my title.
Very interesting. I must leave now.
Who are you again?
Hail and well met, traveler. We are but poor pilgrims traveling through the land.
Hello. I am {playername}. Forgive me for saying so, but you look a bit ... strange in your attire. Who might you be?
Good sir, I will answer you. We are the Pilgrims of the Old Perisnoan Empire. We hope one day a hero will rise to reclaim the empire. Might you be the one?
Indeed, I am the one. I invite you to join me on my conquest to power. I will pay you an initial sum of {reg0} aurums.
We have finally found the one! We will join you, hero, to conquest!
I'm not the one you think I am, sorry. Goodbye. I hope we meet again.
Hello, good sir. We are the Rivermen, the proud people of this land. Who are you?
Hello. I am {playername}.
We are under the protection of our lord, Lord Achelous of Mistylake Town, who has charged us with the task of hunting down any evil men around here.
Well, it was a fun talk with you. Goodbye and good luck.
Spare me. I am the King of my country. You would not like our revenge.
I'll spare your life, but I'll be taking your treasury - AND your very fine sword.
You will pay for this!
I'll spare your life, but I'll be taking your treasury. Good bye!
Hah! King? You look like a fool. You can die.
If the likes of you can become king, then I am sad for your country.
Spare me. I will repent from my sins.
I'll spare your life, but I'll be taking your loot. Good bye!
You are a hypocrite.
I'll be taking your money instead.
You have defeated me, little man. Kill me now.
No, I don't think I will. However, I will take your money.
When I come back, you will die with me.
Bah! Make it quick!
No, I don't think I will. However, I will take your money.
Why have you forsaken me, great Volhar?
If you are going to do it, then why don't you make it quick? I do not fear death.
Good. Because you have no reason to. I will let you go, but I will take your money.
Very well.
Tell your Emperor that once I kill him as well, I will spit on his grave!
What a joke!
You have defeated me, little man. Kill me now.
No, I don't think I will. However, I will take your money.
When I come back, you will die with me.
Tell your Emperor that once I kill him as well, I will spit on his grave!
What a joke!
Spare me. I am the Chosen One. You would not like the wrath of the entire Illica nation upon you.
Spare me. I am the Chosen One. You would not like the wrath of the entire Illica nation upon you.
I'll spare your life, but I'll be taking your treasury. Good bye!
Shut up already and fight. I don't care who you are.
Chosen One? Are you sure you're not delusional?
Spare me. I am the last hope of the Third Legion. You would not like the wrath of all six legions upon you.
I'll spare your life, but I'll be taking your treasury.
I thought you guys died out ages ago?
Third Legion? I'm surprised you aren't ancient already.
This is not the end! When I return, I shall destroy you painfully.
Not before I take your money!
Someday, I will have my revenge.
Until now, I wasn't sure which one of you were worse - the Eagle Brotherhood or the Demon Worshippers. Now I know. At least the Eagle Brotherhood didn't smell as bad.
Ahhhhh! Spare me, please! Take anything you want ... just let me live!
Very well.
Oh, thank you my {reg33?lady:lord}. Thank you!
I think I will be taking your money instead.
If you kill me, then all hope is lost for this world. Spare me, for the sake of this land!
I don't think this land cares if you live or die. However, because I am nice, I will let you live ... and take your treasury!
We will meet again, someday, and I will make sure to destroy you myself.
I'm not sure if you're crazy, or just stupid.
If you kill me, the entire nation of Ankars will rise against you. Do it, I dare you!
I'll let you live ,but I will be needing your treasury!
Take it then. It means nothing to me. I will have my revenge, one day.
Target practice? Are you talking about yourself?
You can kill me, but I will come back stronger.
I won't kill you, but I will take everything you have. Including your nice sword and your treasury!
I won't kill you, but I will take everything you have.
This is not the end.
I will do the world a great favor by eradicating the filth you are from the world.
I am a priest. I see in your eyes that you are a pious soul.
May the Gods guard you, {playername}. What can this humble servant do for you?
Your Gods are a disgrace, stupid priest. Preach elsewhere.
You... you... you are spawn from the Underworld, {playername}. People in this kingdom will hate you!
I believe in your Gods.
I do not believe in your Gods but I want to.
Goodbye...
I am here for help you, {playername}, but you must help us too.But you need to donate 300 aurums. People in this kingdom know of the generosity of {playername}, but you need to donate 1000 coins
Thanks you, priest. We need the Gods to forgive ours sins - I will donate 300 coins.
Thanks you, kind priest. I want this kingdom love me. I will donate 1000 coins.
Are you selling your Faith? What will the Gods say?!
Actually, cancel that order.
Well, well, what do we have here! A victim for sacrifice, perhaps?
You are the one who is going to die. For Mal'Kiarj!
It looks like those foolish priests have been busy. Come to die, have you?
Actually I think I will kill you instead. For Mal'Kij!
I have done it!
I knew you could! Those disbelievers will need to think twice before harassing us again. Here is your reward, as promised.
Is there anything I can do to help our cause?

My son, I am glad you have asked. There is a group of Heretics of - Disbelievers! nearby. They have been causing trouble and raiding and sacking our towns. Can you fight them for me, my champion? Fight them, for the King of the Gods, Mal'Kij!
I will gladly do it. Do you have any tips for me?
I have not the time for this. Maybe later ...
These Disbelievers are very strong. They will be hard to defeat, but only one with true honor can do it. If you do succeed, I will reward you with a gift.
I knew you could! Those infidels will need to think twice before harassing us again. Here is your reward, as promised.
Is there anything I can do to help our cause?

My son, I am glad you have asked. There is a group of Heretics of - Disbelievers! nearby. They have been causing trouble and raiding and sacking our towns. Can you fight them for me, my champion? Fight them, for the King of the Gods, Mal'Kiarj?
I will gladly do it. Do you have any tips for me?
I have not the time for this. Maybe later ...
These Infidels are very strong. They will be hard to defeat, but only one with true courage can do it. If you do succeed, I will reward you with a gift.
You'll not live long to enjoy your victory. My kinsmen will soon wipe out the stain of this defeat.
You are my prisoner now.
Damn you. You will regret this.
You're free to go this time, but don't cross my path again.
We will meet again.
I think that is a wise move. Good luck to you.

Perhaps the best way for me to do this would be to send {reg4?her:him} a gift -- a fur-trimmed velvet robe, perhaps. If you can provide me with a bolt of velvet and a length of furs, I can have one made and sent to {reg4?her:him.}
Splendid. I shall await the materials.

As you may realize, many of us in the peerage of the {s5} consider {s4} to be {s7}, and a liability to our cause. We worry that {reg4?she:he} will {s8}. People know my views on {s4} already, but if you were to denounce {reg4?her:him} to {reg4?her:his} face, you would further erode his standing -- and discourage our liege from entrusting {reg4?her:him} with any more power or responsibility. Of course, you would make an enemy of {reg4?her:him}, and risk being challenged to a duel.{s9}
We appreciate what you are doing. I find such intrigues distasteful, but it is all for the good of the {s5}.

You and I have a common interest in seeking to curtail the rise of {s4}. I feel that {reg4?she:he} is {s7}, and worry that {reg4?she:he} will {s8}. Were you to tell our liege {s9} your opinion of {s4}, it might discourage {s9} from granting {s4} any further powers or responsibilities, at least for a while, and I would be much obliged to you.
We appreciate what you are doing. I find such intrigues distasteful, but it is all for the good of the {s5}.
I cannot think of anything right now, but we will have some items of mutual interest in the future.
I like that idea.
Hmm.. Maybe you can think of something else?
Let us discuss another topic
Very well.
Very well.
Very well.
Very well.
Mercy! Please don't kill me!
I have nothing against you {reg65?woman:man}. But {s2} wants you dead. Sorry.
Damn you! May you burn in Hell!
I'll let you live, if you promise me...
Of course, I promise, I'll do anything. Just spare my life...
You are going to forget about {s2}'s debt to you. And you will sign a paper stating that {reg4?she:he} owes you nothing.
Yes, of course. I'll do as you say.
And if my lord hears so much of a hint of a complaint about this issue, then I'll come back for you, and it won't matter how much you scream for mercy then. Do you understand me?
Yes {reg33?madam:sir}. Don't worry. I won't make any complaint.
Good. Go now, before I change my mind.
Good day to you, {reg33?lassie:man}. I'm the captain of this outpost.
Hello! I'm {playername}.
Would you  like something to eat?
Yes! Thanks!

Mind your manners within the walls and we'll have no trouble.
Mind your manners within the walls and we'll have no trouble.
Good day, sir. I am the captain of this outpost, Augustus Makmix.
I have heard that you sell the finest mercenaries here. Is this true?
Indeed. Would you like to hire some? These upgrade into the finest soldiers in all of Perisno.
My men have grown a bit restless. Good idea.
Yes.
No. Goodbye.
I would like to hire a freelancer recruit, upgrading into any Freelancer Guild troops (30 denars).
I would like to hire a freelancer soldier, upgrading into freelancer dismounted knights (100 denars).
I would like to hire a freelancer rider, upgrading into marshals (400 denars).
