No thanks.
That is too expensive.
They are all at your service, {playername}
Glad to see you again, {playername}. I assume you have come to hire my renowned mercenaries?
Indeed.
I would like to know your story.

I was born about 29 years on a little island, about a 3 weeks journey from Perisno, where the names and architecture are of an old era.  Raised in a noble home, I was always over eager for adventure and battle. I was taught from age 7 to wield two handers and throwing weapons.

I came to Perisno seeking adventure, and I had no idea that I would be the one giving others adventure. After coming to Perisno, I settled down and built an outpost - this very one, by myself. I raised my own personal army soon enough, with the help of some useful connections and loyal friends. However, local squabbling nobles attacked us and decimated us, even though we won. I hanged the foolish lords who did this. I realized that my life was not going anywhere, so I decided to set up the Freelancer Guild. We are basically mercenaries that are freelancers and help whoever pays us.
Very interesting!
No thanks. I have to go.
Do I know you? Did my brother send you?!
Do I know you? Did my sister send you?!
Do I know you? Did my father send you?!
Do I know you? Did my uncle send you?!
Do I know you? Did my commander send you?!
Do I know you? Did my master send you?!
I am looking for a fugitive by the name of {s4}. You fit the description.
Nothing. Sorry to trouble you.
How do I know you're not a bountyhunter?!!
I can assure you I....
Allright so I made a mistake! ONE mistake!! Can't a man start over?!! Do I have to keep on paying?!! HUH?!?! Maybe I should make another mistake!!!
What do you want?
I am looking for a murderer by the name of {s4}. You fit his description.
Nothing. Sorry to trouble you.
I don't understand, {reg33?madam:sir}. I never killed anyone. I think you've got the wrong man.
Then drop your sword. If you are innocent, you have nothing to fear. We'll go now and talk to your neighbours, and if they verify your story, I'll go on my way.
I'm not going anywhere, friend. You're going to have to fight for your silver, today.
No problem. I really just need your head, anyway.
I come not for money, but to execute the law!
Alas, that you cannot be made to see reason.
Die, dog!
Yes {reg33?madam:sir}?
Take this letter to {s1} and give it to {s2}.
Nothing. Nothing at all.
Yes {reg33?madam:sir}. You can trust me. I will not fail you.
Good. I will not forget your service. You will be rewarded when you return.
Arggh! I can't do this. I can't send you to your own death!
What do you mean {reg33?madam:sir}?
There's a trap set up for you in the town. {s3} ordered me to sacrifice one of my chosen warriors to fool the enemy, but he will just need to find another way.
Thank you, {reg33?madam:sir}. I will follow you to the gates of hell. But this would not be a good death.
Don't worry, {reg33?madam:sir}, I'm on my way.
Good day {reg33?madam:sir}. Such fine weather don't you think? If you'll excuse me now I must go on my way.
In the name of {s1}, you are under arrest!
You won't get me alive!
Never mind me. I was just passing by.
Greetings.
In the name of {s1} You are under arrest!
You will have to fight us first!
Never mind me. I was just passing by.
Good day {reg33?madam:sir}.
I have been sent by your {s4} whom you are running from. He will not punish you if you return now.

My good {reg33?madam:sir}. Our lives at our village {s1} was unbearable. We worked all day long and still went to bed hungry. We are going to {s6} to start a new life, where we will be treated like humans.
You have gone against our laws by running from your bondage. You will go back to {s1} now!
Well, maybe you are right. All right then. If anyone asks, I haven't seen you.
All right {reg33?madam:sir}. As you wish. We'll head back to {s5} now.
God bless you, {reg33?madam:sir}. We will not forget your help.
Good day {reg33?madam:sir}. Don't worry. If anyone asks, we haven't seen you.
I have changed my mind. You must back to your village!
Good. Go quickly now before I change my mind.
Good day {reg33?madam:sir}. We were heading back to {s5}, but I am afraid we lost our way.
Do not test my patience. You are going back now!
Well, if you are that eager to go, then go.
We are on our way back to {s5} {reg33?madam:sir}.
Make haste now. The sooner you return the better.
Good. Keep going.
Yes {reg33?madam:sir}. As you wish.
This must be your unlucky day, mate. We're just about the worst people you could run into, in these parts.
Heh. For me, you are nothing more than walking money bags. A merchant in {s1} offered me good money for your heads.
A bounty hunter! Kill {reg33?her:him}! Kill {reg33?her:him} now!
What do you want? You want to pay us some more money?
Sorry to trouble you. I'll be on my way now.
Yeah. Stop fooling around and go make some money. I want to see that purse full next time I see you.
No. It's your turn to pay me this time.
What nonsense are you talking about? You want trouble? You got it.
We are the free brothers. We will fight only for ourselves from now on. Now give us your gold or taste our steel.
When I'm done with you, you'll regret ever leaving your army.
There's no need to fight. I am ready to pay for free passage.

Good. You are clever. Now, having a look at your baggage, I reckon a fellow like you could pretty easily afford {reg5} aurums. We wouldn't want to be too greedy, now would we? Pay us, and then you can go.
All right here's your {reg5} aurums.
I don't have that much money with me
Too bad. Then we'll have to sell you to the slavers.
Heh. That wasn't difficult, now, was it? All right. Go now.
Good day dear {reg33?madam:sir}. How can I help you?
Anything else?
I was told to deliver you {reg9} units of {s4}.

At last! My stock was almost depleted. I had paid the cost of the {s4} in advance. Here, take these {reg5} aurums. That should cover your pay. And give {s9} my regards. I'll put in a good word for you next time I deal with him.
I was told to deliver you {reg9} units of {s4}, but I lost some of the cargo on the way.

Attacked by bandits eh? You are lucky they left you alive. Anyway, I can pay you no more than {reg5} aurums for this. And I will let {s1} know that my order was delivered less than completely, so you will probably be charged for this loss.
I was told to deliver you {reg9} units of {s4}, but I lost the cargo on the way.
What? I was waiting for that {s4} for weeks! And now you are telling me that you lost it? You may rest assured that I will let {s1} know about this.
I'd like to buy every man who comes in here tonight a jar of your best {s0}.
I'd like to flip a coin with you.
Alright. How much money do you want to lose?

Head.
Tail.
Well, here we go... (He flips the coin.)
Look, it's {s3}! Bad luck for you.
Damn, it's {s2}... Here's your money.
Here are your {reg6} aurums.
Of course, my {reg33?lady:lord}. I reckon {reg5} aurums should be enough for that. What should I tell the lads?
Let everyone know of the generosity of {playername} to the people of {s10}.
Don't worry {s0}. Your name will be cheered and toasted here all night.
Actually, cancel that order.
Have you heard of anyone in this realm who might have a job for a {reg33?woman:man} like myself?
Hmm... Well, {s10} is often looking for mercenaries to fight in {reg0?her:his} wars.{s9}
Let me think some more...
I have heard that {s7} {s9}{s10} You may want to speak with {reg4?her:him}.

There may be other work, of course -- lords and guildmasters often have other tasks which we don't hear about. Also, the villages around here frequently need help, although they'd be more likely to pay you with a wedge of cheese and goodwill than with cold hard aurums.
I'll keep my ears open for other opportunities. You may want to ask again from time to time.
Be sure to bring me more of your prisoners when you have them.
I wish to hire some slaves from you.
Great! You can buy them for sixty aurums each - my slaves do not come cheap! With proper training, they may become professional warriors.
Nevermind. That's a tad too expensive for me.
Expensive? That's nothing! I'll buy them.
Here, take a look at my captives. You can handpick them.
Nevermind. Good day.
I would like to hire a male slave.
I would like to hire a female slave.
I would like to hire 5 male slaves.
I would like to hire 5 female slaves.
I would like to hire 15 male slaves.
I would like to hire 15 female slaves.
I would like to hire 50 male slaves.
I would like to hire 50 female slaves.
That is too expensive.
It was nice doing business with you, my friend.
Do you have any larger bounties for me?
Why, of course! {s17}
Can you help?
No thanks. Maybe next time.
I failed the quest.
I found these scoundrels and I gave them their punishment!
Good work.  That's your reward. But be careful. People over there are watching you. And I don't think their intentions are good.
I found the mysterious group and I gave them their punishment!
Good work.  That's your reward. But be careful. People over there are watching you. And I don't think their intentions are good.

The noble said that the prisoners should not be far away and he would reward the person who defeated them handsomely. If you are looking for a bounty, you could defeat the party and report back to me.
No thanks. Maybe next time.
I'll do it.
Excellent! I'll contact the noble and tell him have a reward ready ... if you succeed, of course.
Who are you? What do you want?
You've been causing a lot of trouble around here and I don't have to answer to you. Surrender or die!
I found the dangerous bandits and I gave them their punishment!

Excellent! I knew that you would succeed. Earlier today, the noble came in and gave me the reward to hand you should you suceed. Of course, he warned me that if I took it for myself he would come after me. So here's your reward.
If you are looking for a bounty, you could defeat the party and report back to me.
No thanks. Maybe next time.
I'll do it.
Excellent! I will await news of your success.
Who are you? What do you want?
You've been causing a lot of trouble around here and I don't have to answer to you. Surrender or die!
I found the dangerous bandits and I gave them their punishment!
Excellent! I knew that you would succeed. Here is your reward.
If you are looking for a bounty, you could defeat the party and report back to me.
No thanks. Maybe next time.
I'll do it.
Excellent! I will await news of your success.
Who are you? What do you want?
You've been causing a lot of trouble around here and I don't have to answer to you. Surrender or die!
I found the demon worshippers and I gave them their punishment!
Excellent! I knew that you would succeed. Here is your reward.
That is a shame. You can come back next time for more quests, however.

About the bounty you gave me...

I found {s4} hiding at {s3} and gave them their punishment.
I'm afraid they got away.
I am still working on it.

Well done, {playername}!  'Tis good to know you can be trusted to handle things with an appropriate level of tactfulness. A bounty I promised, and a bounty you shall have. 300 aurums and not a copper less!
Let me take the money, {s65}. Thank you.
This is blood money. I can't accept it.
Of course, {playername}. Here you are.
You are a {s25} for whom justice is its own reward, eh? As you wish it, {playername}, as you wish it. An honourable sentiment, to be true.
It is a sad day when that {s44} manages to avoid the hand of justice yet again. I thought you would be able to do this, {playername}. Clearly I was wrong.
So you reckon yourself a bounty hunter, eh?

I have something you could help with, an issue with the lawless villain known as {s4}.  They supposedly murdered someone, or stole something, or....whatever, and have been on the run from their judgement ever since. There is a bounty of 300 aurums on their head. Associates of the murderer who, while they issue them no ill will...reckon that this outlaw may have taken refuge with their kinsmen at {s3}. You might be able to hunt them down and give them what they deserve... ^and claim the bounty for yourself of course.
I'm sorry, but I don't have any bounties for you right now.
I will claim this bounty.
I am too busy to go after them at the moment.

That's excellent, {playername}. Their associates will be so grateful to have them....found. And of course the bounty on their head will be yours if you can get...err find them. Well, good hunting to you.
As you wish, {playername}.I suppose there are plenty of bounty hunters around to get the job done . . .
I guess I should leave now.

Good day {reg33?madam:sir}, I have some items with me. I will sell these items to you in their regular price. You might buy an item in bad shape for a high price, or, perhaps, an item in good shape for a low price. Do you wish to try your fortune?
That sounds good. I wish to have a try.
Greetings to you, {s0}. You look like someone who should get to know me.
Why is that?

I broker ransoms for the poor wretches who are captured in these endless wars. Normally I travel between the salt mines and the slave markets on the coast, on commission from those whose relatives have gone missing. But if I'm out on my errands of mercy, and I come across a fellow dragging around a captive or two, well, there's no harm in a little speculative investment, is there? And you look like the type who might have a prisoner to sell.
What if their families can't pay?

Oh, then I spin them a few heartwarming tales of life on the galleys. You'd be surprised what sorts of treasures a peasant can dig out of his cowshed or wheedle out of his cousins, assuming he's got the proper motivation! And if in the end they cannot come up with the silver, then there are always slave merchants who are looking for galley slaves. One cannot do Heaven's work with an empty purse, you see.
What can I get for a prisoner?

It varies. I fancy that I have a fine eye for assessing a ransom. There are a dozen little things about a man that will tell you whether he goes to bed hungry, or dines each night on soft dumplings and goose. The real money of course is in the gentry, and if you ever want to do my job you'll want to learn about every landowning family in Perisno, their estates, their heraldry, their offspring both lawful and bastard, and, of course, their credit with the merchants.
Would you be able to ransom me if I were taken?
Of course. I'm welcome in every court in Perisno. There's not many who can say that! So always be sure to keep a pot of aurums buried somewhere, and a loyal servant who can find it in a hurry.
That's all I need to know. Thank you.
Greetings. If you have any prisoners, I will be happy to buy them from you.
Anyway, if you have any prisoners, I will be happy to buy them from you.
Then you'd better bring your purse. I have got prisoners to sell.
I want to sell all the prisoners I have with me.
Let's see...  I'll give you {reg0} aurums for your {reg1} {reg2?prisoners:prisoner}.  Do we have a deal?
We have a deal.
Let me think about it again.
Tell me about what you do again.
I wish to ransom one of my companions.
Whom do you wish to ransom?
Never mind

Let me check my ledger, here... Yes. Your friend is being held in the dungeon at {s7}. How interesting! I remember hearing that the rats down there are unusually large -- like mastiffs, they say... Now... For the very reasonable sum of {reg5} denars, which includes both the ransom and my commission and expenses, we can arrange it so that {s5} can once again enjoy {reg4?her:his} freedom. What do you say?
Here's your money.
I can't afford that right now.
Splendid! In a few days, I would think, you should find {s5} riding to rejoin you, blinking in the sunlight and no doubt very grateful! Is there any other way in which I can help you?

Of course, of course... Never mind what they say about the rats, by the way -- I've never actually seen one myself, on account of the pitch-black darkness. Anyway, I'm sure that {s5} will understand why it's important for you to control expenditures. Now... Was there anything else?
Not this time. Good-bye.
Let me see what you have...
I will be staying here for a few days. Let me know if you need my services.

Greetings, friend. You look like the kind of {reg33?person:man} who'd do well to know me. I travel a lot all across Perisno and keep an open ear. I can provide you information that you might find useful. For a meager price of course.
Greetings, {playername}. I saw your companion {s10} at a tavern in {s11} some days ago. I thought you might like to know.
Thanks. I'll go and find {reg3?her:him} there.
Thanks, but I don't really care.
Greetings, {playername}.
Yes?
What can you tell me about this land?

Perisno is divided into rival kingdoms, which can neither manage to live in peace with their neighbours, nor completely eliminate them. As a result, there's seldom a break to the bitter wars which plague this land and drain its life blood. Well, at least this must be a good place to be for an adventurer such as yourself. With some luck and skill, you can make a name for yourself here, amass a fortune perhaps, or gain great power. Opportunities are endless and so are the rewards, if you are willing to risk your life for them.
Tell me more about these opportunities.
Thank you. That was all I needed to know
Well, you probably know everything I could tell you already. You seem to be doing pretty well.

The kingdoms will pay good money for mercenaries if they are engaged in a war. If you have done a bit of fighting, speaking with one of their lords will probably result in being offered a mercenary contract. However the real rewards come if you can manage to become a vassal to a king. A vassal can own villages, castles and towns and get rich with the taxes and revenues of these estates. Normally, only nobles of the realm own land in this way, but in time of war, a king will not hesitate to accept someone who distinguishes {reg33?her:him}self on the battlefield as a vassal, and grant {reg33?her:him} the right to own land.

It is not unheard-of for adventurers to renounce allegiance to a Perisnon king altogether, declare themselves kings, and claim land in their own name. This is a difficult path, however, as the great nobles of the land, with their long ancestries, are not likely to accept such upstarts as their monarch. Such rulers would need to be very careful in establishing their right to rule, or they would be set upon from all sides.

It might be easier for an adventurer like yourself to pledge support to an existing king's rival.  There are many such pretenders in Perisno -- those who are born to the right family, who go around and stir up trouble saying they have a better claim to the throne than the current king. If those claim holders could find supporters, they could easily start civil wars and perhaps even replace the king one day.
Interesting. Where can I find these claim holders?
I guess I heard enough already. Thank you.

A claim holder's life would be in danger in his own country of course. Therefore, they usually stay at rival courts, raising support and hoping to find someone willing to champion their cause. I usually hear news about some of them, and may be able to tell you their location with some precision. But of course, I would ask for a little something for such a service.
I want to know the location of a claimant.
Whose location do you want to know?
Never mind.
I can reveal this information to you for a small price, let's say 30 aurums.
All right. Here is 30 aurums.
Never mind.
{s15} is currently at {s11}.
I want to know something about a person.
About whom do you wish to hear?
Rafklazan

Ah.. funny you ask about that one. One of my associates was talking about him just the other day as well. Rafklazan is the leader of the Rafkla clan back in his homeland in Nisaynia, where he hails from. He likes to title himself as 'King.' They were raiding another clan, but somehow a wind blew them off course and they were blown away and scattered. For days they sailed until they reached Perisno. He is a formidable one, with a large army. You will need to be careful if you ever venture near Reich or Draharan lands, where he spends most of his time now, wandering around. Rafklazan himself is particularly dangerous. It is said he ripped apart a bear with his bare hands! Can you believe it? Yes, I think you will need to watch yourself if you ever face him in battle.
Zeladeck

Zeladeck, Illica's greatest Falki Knight was not an Illica to begin with. He was an orphan raised by a lumberjack couple , living in the forest near the mountain range of Illica. One day, he found a big injured Falki in the forest, and tended its wound. Nursing the everyday Falki for half a year, Zel and the Falki became best friend. The Falki then regained its strength, and took Zel to the Illica clan, only to reveal that that Falki is a direct descendant of the Sky King, the strongest and most respected Falki. He was 10 by that time. Zeladeck then was trained, and with his gifted ability of a warrior, plus the good teamwork between him and his Falki, he soon became the greatest Falki Knight only at the age of 19. Now, he thinks he is the Chosen One to lead the Falki to victory.
Octiem

Octiem is an odd one. He is the leader of the fabled Third Legion, who have long been a legend in Perisno. Hundreds of years ago, the Third Legion is said to have ruled the entire world. Octiem believes that he is the one to lead his men to victory, like his ancestors did. He proclaims himself as the one that was chosen to lead and rule the new empire. In reality, he is one delusional bastard who thinks only of himself and has ambitions that are beyond comprehension by the normal man (laughs). Anyway, little is known about him, and it is said that he was born to lead, raised by wolves after being abandoned as a baby. Should you ever fight him, be careful, for his army of loyal followers are very strong.
Ral'Daiun.

I do not know much about Ral'Daiun. It is said that his title is 'Ral,' and his real name is only Daiun. Ral supposedly means 'Legendary Leader' in the Assassins's wretched dialect. Ral'Daiun is a shadowy figure who have led his assassins to become a huge organization. They have no loyalties and kill for gold and gold only. You won't be seeing Ral'Daiun doing the killing the person, for his assassins do all the dirty work for him while he collects the money. He has a hidden castle somewhere in the mountains, but you will not find it for it is too well hidden. Years ago, the assassins were only a small organization, but now they seem to have quadrupled in size and number. You must be careful fighting them, for they have some new technology in their crossbows.
Zolona

Ah, Zolona. What can I say about her, hmm? She is the queen of her people, I am told, with the duty of a mountain upon her frail little soldiers. She acts brave and strong, but in reality, she is just a little girl without anyone to guide her. She is the daughter of the dead clain leader of the Syrin Nomads, and she has been chosen to lead her people to salvation. How she will do this is beyond me. You must be careful though, for her honor guard is very strong and can wield the bow better than even the Draharan camel riders. Should you meet her, know that while she is a hard enemy to defeat, she isn't invincible. Also, should you defeat her, remember to show her mercy, for even I feel sorry for her. You should, too.
Ulfheonar.

Ulfheonar is one of those cursed Volheere raiders. What's more, he is the leader of a large majority of them, and in particular the leader of those Volheere Berserkers. Now, you are young, reckless and headstrong. Word of advice -- don't go looking for Ulf. He and his men are all berserkers without a care or doubt about their own safety. If you fight him, you will most likely lose, and even if you win, you will lose many. Ulf was a Jarl back in Nisaynia where he came from. I think he was chosen as the leader of his people, sent to sail to a new land and populate it. I think he mistook 'populate' for loot and pillage, however, as thousands of men and women can gladly tell you. Now, anything else you would like to know?
Nibor

Nibor Hood is the leader of the Free-Men rebellion of Tolrania. They are rebelling because they think the Tolranian Government are hypocrites, and I say they are right! Even though I disagree with most of Nibor's methods, the government of Tolrania do need to change. Anyway, enough of me going off topic. Nibor was born and raised in a noble family like his sister, Lady Tylora. He grew sickened by all the flaws in the system and wanted a change. A republic, he said. We need to make Tolrania a republic, and fulfill our founders's wishes. Trouble is, you know what happens when someone wants to overthrow you, right? The King of Tolrania sent his men to kill Nibor, but he escaped, and ever since then he and a band of loyal followers have been wrecking havoc in Tolrania.
Nobody.
Have you heard anything interesting lately?
I have not heard any other rumors lately. Perhaps another time.
Very interesting. Goodbye.
I am looking for book merchants...
I am sorry I haven't run across any lately.
I might have crossed paths with one or two recently. For 100 aurums, I'll tell you where.
All right. Here is 100 aurums.
Never mind.
You can find them at {s11}.
I am looking for ransom brokers...
I am sorry I haven't run across any lately.
I know where they are. For 50 aurums, I'll tell you.
All right. Here is 50 aurums.
Never mind.
You can find them at {s11}.
I am looking for one of my former employees...
Maybe I can help you. Who are you looking for?
My fomer chamberlain, {s11}.
My fomer constable, {s11}.
My fomer chancellor, {s11}.
Never mind.
I will send word to {reg0?her:him} that you are looking for {reg0?her:him}.
I am afraid I'm not able to help you.
I am looking for one of my companions...
Maybe I can help you. Who are you looking for?
Never mind.
I guess I know where {s15} is. For 30 aurums, I'll tell you.
All right. Here is 30 aurums.
Never mind.
{s15} is currently at {s11}.{s12}
Farewell.
Greetings. They say you're the kind of {reg33?woman:man} who'd be interested to hear that I travel frequently to {s17}. I'll tell you all I know for a mere 100 aurums.
Here's 100 aurums. Tell me what you know.
Sorry friend. I am not interested.
Well, that's all I can tell you. Good bye.
Good day {reg33?madam:sir}, will you be looking at my books?
Yes. Show me what you have for sale.
Of course {reg33?madam:sir}.
Anything else?
Nothing. Thanks.
Greetings to you, most noble {reg33?lady:sir}.
What is it you do?
I have some questions about courtship in Perisno
Can you teach me any poems?

I can teach you the poem, 'The Storming of the Castle of Love.' It is short enough to be easily learned. It is an allegoric poem, replete with symbols and metaphor. It describes how a brave but rough warrior wins the heart of his lady by learning the virtues of chivalry, becoming a true and noble knight. Its theme -- that the role of a woman is to inspire but also civilize a man -- is appreciated by some noble ladies, but not all.

I can teach you the poem, 'The Heart's Desire.' It is a lyrical poem, which can be interpreted either erotically or spiritually. The lover realizes the majesty of the divine by gazing upon the body of his beloved. I believe that it appeals to women of a certain romantic temperament, but you risk scandalizing or boring others.

I can teach you the tale of Kais and Layala. It is a sad and simple story -- the shepherd boy Kais and the nobleman's daughter Layala love each other, but they can never marry. The poem is Kais' lament as he wanders alone, unwilling to forget his true love, driving himself mad with longing. Some ladies melt at the sweetness of his sorrows; others glaze over at his self-pity.

I can teach you part of the saga of Helgerad and Kara. It is a heroic tale, full of blood and battle. The shieldmaiden Kara chooses the warrior Helgered as her lover, as he is the only man who can defeat her in combat. Her father, who pledged her to another, comes with his sons and his huscarls to kill Helgered. They fight, and Helgered and Kara slaughter the entire host except for Kara's beloved younger brother -- who, alas, grows up to avenge his father by slaying Helgered. The depiction of warrior and shieldmaiden as equals will appeal to some women, but a mail-wearing, blood-spattered heroine will shock and repulse others.

I can teach you the poem, 'An Argument in the Garden.' It is a comic poem, which satirizes the conventions of courtly love. A lover steals into a garden in Veluca, and plies her with lots of witty lines to persuade his lover to submit to his embraces. She shoots down all of his advances one by one, then when he is downcast, she takes him in her arms and tells him that she wanted him all along, except on her terms, not his. A lady with a sense of humor may find it amusing, but others might feel that they are the ones who are being mocked.
To teach it to you, I will need some hours of your time -- and, of course, a small fee for my services. About 300 aurums would suffice.
I believe you already know the poems I am best equipped to teach.
Yes -- teach me that one
Never mind
Very well -- repeat after me:^   I deflected her skeptical questioning darts^   with armor made of purest devotion^   purged in the forge of my heart^   from the slag of any baser emotion

Very well -- repeat after me:^   You are the first and the last^   the outer and the inner^   When I drink from the cup of love^   I escape the tread of time^   A moment in solitude with you^   Would have no beginning and no end

Very well -- repeat after me:^  The wind that blows the dry steppe dust^  Stirs the curtains in your tower^  The moon that lights my drunken path home^  Looks on you sleeping in your bower^  If I cried out to the wind^  Could it carry a message from my lips?^  If I wept before the moon^  Would it grant me just a glimpse?

Very well -- repeat after me:^   A light pierced the gloom over Wercheg cliffs...^   Where charge of surf broke on shieldwall of shore^   Grey-helmed and grey-cloaked the maiden stood^   On wave-steed's prow, the sailcloth snapping^   Over din of oars, of timbers cracking^   She cried out to her hearth-brothers, arrayed for war

Very well -- repeat after me:^All the silks of Veluca, all the furs of Khudan^Would buy you not the briefest kiss^What I bestow, I bestow for love^And the sake of my own happiness^But brought you a gift? Let us see! Let us see!^Or should tell my father how you came to see me?
'I deflected her skeptical questioning darts...'
'You are the first and the last..'
'The wind that blows the dry steppe dust...'
'A light pierced the gloom over Wercheg cliffs...'
'All the silks of Veluca...'
Pshaw... What kind of doggerel is that?

Very well. If the poem is not to your taste, then keep your money. But remember -- with poets and with lovers, what is important is not what pleases you. What is important is what your pleases your audience. If you wish to learn the poem, I am still willing to teach.
Very good -- but there are many stanzas to go. Now, listen closely...
Can you tell me anything about the eligible maidens in this realm?
About whom did you wish to know?
Just tell me the latest piece of gossip
Never mind
{reg0?She:He} is married to you, of course! Clearly, no one would dream that {reg0?she:he} would do anything to engender gossip.
Very interesting -- but let us speak of something else.
Very interesting -- is there any more news?
What? I'll make that miscreant face my sword
Do you mean that? {s11} will be honor-bound to fight you, but challenging a lord to duel over a woman is seen as a bit hot-headed, even in this warlike age.
Yes -- I intend to force {s11} to relinquish his suit of {s12}
No -- I let my passions run away with me, there
As you wish. I'll spead the word of your intentions, so that {s13} does not try to back out...
Do you know of any ongoing feasts?
Good-bye.
What do you wish to know?
Can I answer any other questions for you?
Is there a place for me in the game of love?
How would a suitor meet a lady?
Having met a lady, how would the suitor woo her?
Tell me about marriage and love among the nobility of Perisno

Nobles are an odd lot. In Perisno, a daughter is a political asset, to be given away to a lord with whom her father wishes to make an alliance. Yet the great families of this land idealize pure love between man and woman, and I have seen many a hardened warrior weep copious tears at the doomed ardour of Sahira and Janun in the songs -- even as he made plans to break his own daughter's heart.

Fathers differ, of course. Some Perisnon nobles will let their daughters choose a husband who pleases them. Others, however, feel that to allow their daughters any choice at all would be to diminish their own authority, and insist on imposing a groom whether she likes it or not.

But the majority will steer a middle course -- they will want to make the final decision about a groom, but will weigh their daughter's preferences heavily. Among other factors, a happy marriage is more likely to produce heirs. So, there is a place for courtship, and for the use of skill and passion to win a lady's heart.
What if a lady and her father disagree about a suitor?

It happens sometimes that a bride elopes. This is a major blow to the father's prestige, leading to lasting enmities. Indeed, it is possible that a war may be fought over a woman. Now, that is a fine topic for a song.

In the end, however, most brides will submit to their parents' choice. A noblewoman's family is everything to her, and few are brave enough to risk its disapproval for the sake of man she barely knows. She may pine for her lover, but still accept the groom -- and without tragic love, what would we have to sing about?

Of course! Perisnon lords make a great deal of lineage, but in the end, lands and money speak louder than one's ancestors. Even though you are a foreigner, if you are coming up in the world, then many parents will consider you a fine catch.

You will have to compete with many other lords of your realm, however, who will have an advantage -- they have known these ladies from childhood, and will have been sized up as grooms by carefully discerning mothers and aunts. Some ladies may be fascinated by the stranger, yet opt for the familiar.

So know this -- you may have your heart broken. But to enter the arena of love fearing heartbreak is like entering the battlefield fearing the enemy's arrows. Be brave, and shrug off the sting of rejection, and victory may yet be yours.

{reg33?Lady:Sir} -- I will speak bluntly. Most of the {reg33?lords:ladies} of this land are looking for a demure {reg33?maiden:lad}, whose skin as fair as snow -- and your skin is burnt brown by the sun. They want a {reg33?maiden:boy} whose voice is soft as bells -- and your voice is hoarse from commanding {reg33?soldiers:men} in battle. Also, although the {reg33?lords:ladies} of Perisno appreciate poems about love, most also want heirs, and few {reg33?women:men} can ride and fight while {reg33?with child:caring for their children}.

However, not all {reg33?lords:ladies} will be so conventionally minded. We poets sing of shield {reg33?maidens:boys} and of {reg33?huntresses:hunters}, of {reg33?women:lads} who forged their own path without having sacrificed the chance for love. I would not tell you that it would be easy for you to find a devoted {reg33?husband:wife} who will accept your ways, but I would not say that it is impossible.
What advantage is there in seeking a {reg33?husband:wife}?

Ah! You are quite the romantic, I see! Well, aside from the obvious benefits of love, companionship and other, em, domestic matters, to marry among the nobility brings great assets. You may forge a strong alliance with the bride's family, and a wife may also assist you in manipulating the politics of the realm to your advantage.
What's more, most of the great families of Perisno have at some point intermarried with royalty, which would boost your own claim to rule -- should you ever choose to assert it...

Ah! You are quite the romantic, I see! Well, aside from the obvious benefits of love, companionship and other, em, domestic matters, to marry among the nobility brings great assets. You may have access to the groom's castles and properties, and be able to work with him to advance both of your standings in the realm.

Every so often, a king or great lord of Perisno will hold a feast. In towns they will often be accompanied by tournaments, and in castles they will be accompanied by hunts. The feasts provide a chance for the lords to repair some of the rivalries that may undermine the strength of the realm. They also provide an opportunity for families to show off their eligible daughters, and ladies will often be allowed to mingle unsupervised with the guests.

If you have the opportunity, you may attempt to pay the lady a compliment. This indicates to her that you are a potential suitor, and she will usually know if she wishes you to continue your suit. Incidentally, if you come to her fresh from having distinguished yourself in the tournament or in the hunt, then you may make a stronger first impression than otherwise.

To woo a lady takes a certain amount of time and patience, and several meetings spaced over a period of months. A lady who is interested in you will often find ways of letting you know if she wishes you to come visit her. Alternately, you may simply go and ask her father or brother for permission. If you do not have permission from her guardian, it may be possible to arrange an assignation through other means.

Having arranged an assignment, you may then attempt to charm her and win her favor. Perhaps one of the most difficult aspects of this is finding a topic of conversation. Most Perisno noblewomen lead a cloistered life, at least until they are married, and thus will have little to say that will interest you. On other hand, she will soon tire of hearing of your own deeds in the outside world.

One time-tested mode of courtship is simply to recite a popular poem, and discuss it. This way, you are both on an equal footing, and neither will have an advantage in knowledge or experience. Of course, different ladies will have different tastes in poetry.

At some point, you will be able to discuss directly the issue of marriage. She will then let you know if you measure up to what she wants in a husband. Some ladies will coolly assess who is the most prestigious of her suitors, others will be guided by their passions. Some will look to your companions, to see whether you are the kind of husband who will treat her as an equal, while others will follow the lead of their fathers.

At any rate, it is a challenging business -- and do not forget, you may find that your suit prospers with a lady, only to have it falter on a father's political ambitions. So you must ask yourself: are you willing to risk disappointment and heartbreak? Alternately, are you willing to throw away your standing in society, to make enemies of allies, in pursuit of a forbidden love? Because if you are, then perhaps some day we will write poems about you.
What is it that you poets and musicians do again?

I compose and write songs for the lords of the land, and their ladies. Sometimes I sing about war, sometimes about the virtues of kings, and sometimes, for the more sophisticated audiences, about the virtues of wine. For most audiences, however, I sing of love.
No, that is all.

I am a member of the Entertainment Guild. Our guildsmen travel around Perisno's taverns, and offer our services to those who wish it -- for a price, of course. We provide entertainment to the travel-weary, or to people who just want to relax and enjoy.
I see. Would you be able to provide my men and I entertainment if I asked for it?

Welcome to the Mercenary Guild, traveller. How can I help you?
Welcome again to the Mercenary Guild.
What is this place?
We call ourselves Mercenary Guild. My name is Ingvar and I am the head of the Guild.
Here come people from all over the world who for one reason or another abandoned their old life and decided to start anew.

Some of them left their masters, some of the ran from a war they didn't want to fight. Farmers who want to become warriors, outlaws sick of their former lives, religious people who became disillusioned with their faith.

We all here have different stories, different backgroud, different training. You can walk around and talk to guys - some of them might decide to join you... provided you can afford to pay for their service, of course.

Finally, it might interest you that although most people here prefer to stick to their old weapons and trainings, there are always volunteers who I train personally to be good with different weapons - whether it is a shortbow or a longbow, a sword or a mace. Therefore you can equip them however you want, and they won't mind, though more costly equipment will naturally raise their upkeep.
Is there something else you wish to know?
I want to recruit some of those mercenaries you train.
Sure, I have a few volunteers.

Good day to you {reg33?lass:lad}. You look like another adventurer who has come to try {reg33?her:his} chance in these lands. Well, trust my word, you won't be able to survive long here unless you know how to fight yourself out of a tight spot.
Thank you for your advice. This place looks like a training field. Maybe I can learn about fighting here?

Indeed you can. I am a veteran soldier... fought a good deal in the wars in my time. But these days, I train young novices in this area. I can find you some opponents to practice with if you like. Or if you have any questions about the theory of combat, feel free to ask.
Yes, I do have a few questions.
Actually, I can move on to practice.
Well, ask anything you like.
Good. It's good to find someone eager for practice. Let's see what you will do.

Ha! Looks like you've developed a bit of a limp there. Don't worry, even losses have their value, provided you learn from them. Shake the stars out of your eyes and get back in there. There's no other way to win.
Good day. Ready for some training today?
Ah, are you ready for some training?
I am ready for some practice.
First, tell me something about combat...
I need to leave now. Farewell.
What do you want to know?
What else do you want to know?
Tell me about defending myself.
Tell me about attacking with weapons.
Tell me about fighting on horseback.
I guess I know all the theory I need. Let's talk about something else.

Good question. The first thing you should know as a fighter is how to defend yourself. Keeping yourself out of harm's way is the first rule of combat, and it is much more important than giving harm to others. Everybody can swing a sword around and hope to cut some flesh, but only those fighters that are experts at defense live to tell of it.

Now. Defending yourself is easiest if you are equipped with a shield. Just block with your shield. [Hold down the right mouse button to defend yourself with the shield.] In this state, you will be able to deflect all attacks that come from your front. However, you will still be open to strikes from your sides or your back.
What if I don't have a shield?

Then you will have to use your weapon to block your opponent. This is a bit more difficult than defending with a shield. Defending with a weapon, you can block against only ONE attack direction. That is, you block against either overhead swings, side swings or thrusts. Therefore you must watch your opponent carefully and start to block AFTER he starts his attack. In this way you will be able to block against the direction of his current attack. If you start to block BEFORE he makes his move, he may just attack in another direction than the one you are blocking against and score a hit.

Good question. Attacking is the best defence, they say. A tactic many fighters find useful is taking an offensive stance and readying your weapon for attack, waiting for the right moment for swinging it. [You can ready your weapon for attack by pressing and holding down the left mouse button.]
That sounds useful.

It is a good tactic, but remember that, your opponent may see that and take a defensive stance against the direction you are swinging your weapon. If that happens, you must break your attack and quickly attack from another direction [You may cancel your current attack by quickly tapping the right mouse button].
If my opponent is defending against the direction I am attacking from, I will break and use another direction.

Yes, selecting the direction you swing your weapon is a crucial skill. There are four main directions you may use: right swing, left swing, overhead swing and thrust. You must use each one wisely. [to control your swing direction with default controls, move your mouse in the direction you want to swing from as you press the left mouse button].

Very good question. A horse may be a warrior's most powerful weapon in combat. It gives you speed, height, power and initiative. A lot of deadly weapons will become even deadlier on horseback. However you must pay particular attention to horse-mounted enemies couching their lances, as they may take down any opponent in one hit. [To use the couched lance yourself, wield a lance or similar weapon, and speed up your horse without pressing attack or defense buttons. after you reach a speed, you'll lower your lance. Then try to target your enemies by maneuvering your horse.]
I train novices in four stages, each tougher than the one before. To finish a stage and advance to the next one, you have to win three fights in a row.
You have passed all stages of training. But if you want you can still practice. Are you ready?
Way to go {reg33?lass:lad}. With this victory, you have advanced to the next training level. From now on your opponents will be regular fighters, not the riff-raff off the street, so be on your toes.

Way to go {reg33?lass:lad}. Welcome to the third training level. From now on your opponents will be veteran fighters; soldiers and arena regulars and the like. These guys know some dirty tricks, so keep your defense up.

You've got the heart of a champion, {reg33?lass:lad}, and the sword arm to match. From now on your opponents will be champion fighters. These are the cream of the crop, the finest warriors I have trained. If you can best three of them in a row, you will join their ranks.
It does my heart good to see such a promising talent. You have passed all tiers of training. You can now tell everyone that you have been trained by the master of the training field.

I wish you good luck in the tournaments. And, don't forget,  if you want to practice your swordwork anytime, just come and say the word.
Your next opponent will be a {s9}. You need to win {reg8} more fights in a row to advance to the next stage. Are you ready?

Certainly, my {reg33?lady:lord}. Most of the time, the most profitable thing for you to do would be to let us buy raw materials and sell the finished goods directly to the market. Because of our longstanding relations with the local merchants, we can usually get a very good price.

However, if you find that you can acquire raw materials cheaper outside {s5}, you may place them in the inventories, and we will use them instead of buying from the market. Likewise, if you feel that you can get a better price for the finished goods elsewhere, then you may ask us to deposit what we produce in our warehouses for you to take.

{playername}, it was an incredible feat to get {s14} and {s15} make peace, and you made it happen. Aye, my scouts saw the whole thing. That should make anyone else think twice before turning outlaw! The bounty is 40 aurums for every band, so that makes {reg1} in total. Here is your money, as promised.

And that's not the only good news! Thanks to you, the looters have ceased to be a threat. We've not had a single attack reported for some time now.   If there are any of them left, they've either run off or gone deep into hiding. That's good for business,   and what's good for business is good for the town!   I think that concludes our arrangement, {playername}. Please accept this silver as a token of my gratitude. Thank you, and farewell.

Well done, {playername}, that's the last of the goods I need. Here is the money for your {s6}, and a small bonus for helping me out. I'm afraid I won't be paying for any more goods, nor bounties on looters, but you're welcome to keep hunting the bastards if any remain. Thank you for your help, I won't forget it.
Good to see you again {playername}. I have heard that you have delivered the cattle successfully. I will tell the merchants how reliable you are. And here is your pay, {reg8} aurums.
I heard that you have lost the cattle herd on your way to {s9}. I had a very difficult time explaining your failure to the owner of that herd, {reg33?madam:sir}. Do you have anything to say?

Well, it was your responsibility to deliver that herd safely, no matter what. You should know that the owner of the herd demanded to be compensated for his loss, and I had to pay him 1000 aurums. So you now owe me that money.

{playername} -- I am in your debt for bringing back my friend's daughter.  Please take these {reg8} aurums that I promised you.  My friend wished he could give more but paying that ransom brought him to his knees.

Well -- it sounds like you were able to track down the bandits, and show them what happens to those who would disrupt the flow of commerce. Here is your reward: {reg5} aurums. It is well earned, and we are most grateful.

I have heard about your deeds. You have given those bandits the punishment they deserved. You are really as good as they say. Here is your reward: {reg5} aurums. I would like to give more but those bandits almost brought me to bankruptcy.
According to my accounts, you owe the merchants guild {reg1} aurums. I'd better collect that now.

I'm afraid I can't pay that sum now.

In that case, I am afraid, I can't deal with you. Guild rules... Come back when you can pay the {reg1} aurums. And know that we'll be charging an interest to your debt. So the sooner you pay it, the better.
